text: Magnifique quadruple arborant une belle robe orange. Puissante et goûteuse elle est une vraie perle. Un must have pour chaque amateur de bonne bière.

Copper to light brow colour, average sized head. Malty and spicy aroma, hops is also noticable. Heavy malty taste and pretty sweet. Alcohol harshness is not there but it delivers warming sensation. Average carbonation, long sweet finish.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy Amber, large creamy white head, dissipates slowly, good lacing. Aroma is full of Belgian spice and candy sugar, toffee, dust. Flavor is medium sweet, minimal bitter. Medium body, soft mouthfeel.
Интерес& но не совсем мой стиль.
Slightly hazy amber. Sweet, caramel aroma. Quite high carbonation with a slightly burned, fruity sweet taste. Well balanced with bitterness at the end. One of the best quads.
Rødbrun farge med hvitt luftig skum. Lukter av belgisk gjær, alkohol. Medium fylde. Dette var en god øl..

Bottle from Andersons. Nose is plum and smoky dark esters. Super smooth and sweeter side of a quad. Weak carbonation. Complex with malts and dark sugars and bitterness hidden. Smooth and a solid beer. Would do again. Top 5 quads.
Belle couleur ambrée avec une fine mousse. Goût de levure. Agréable en bouche sucrée et amertume légère. Quasi parfaite.

Bottle. Aroma fruity but raisins dates not fresh. An alcoholic pungency. Pours cloudy amber with some white bubbly lace. Taste is caramelized malts, vanilla sugars and dark fruits. Alongside this is a full bodied presence on the palate that coats the tongue and quite possibly blurs the vision. Like a brandy after a fine meal, this finishes everything. For that reason alone I am relieved not all beer is like this but I still wish more could be.

Ar: Plums, figs, and slight smoky earthiness; candied orange and moderately toasted malts; herbal, slightly sweet hops. Ap: Amber and hazy; medium slightly off-white head with moderate-low retention, leaving a ring of mostly fine bubbles, a few suds, and a thin haze of foam. T: Toasted malt, peach, and banana, with a moderate-low sweetness; warm, very clean alcohol; prominent banana and peach skins mid-palate, with a low bitterness and a slightly herbal hop character; fruity tannins, relatively smooth, linger on the finish with underripe peach and orange peel. P: Medium-full body with very high, refined carbonation; finish is medium-dry. O: Very good quad; lots of fruit, spice, and clean alcohol flavor; quite drinkable even though it has a ton of flavor and substance; strong and bold while never becoming cloying or overbearing.

Aromas are complex with a lot of variety, though all of the aromas are subdued - bread, caramel, dried fruit, spices (hard to pin down but the official description of banana, vanilla and almond seems like a reasonable attempt).

Color is a slightly cloudy amber with a very large off-white head.

Taste is somewhat sweet with a quite mild bitterness.

Body is medium; texture is oily/creamy; finish is long, fruity, malty and spicy.

Overall an excellent beer - subtle but complex and interesting.

330ml bottle. Clear, copper-ish, dark amber to brown colour with average, thick, creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, off-white head. Sweet-ish, malty and estery fruity aroma, notes of cherry, banana, apricot, marzipan, baked apple, vanilla. Taste is sweet malty, fruity, notes of banana, cherry, apricot, some marzipan, vanilla, baked red apple, dry hoppy counterweight with hints of apple parings; alcohol is hidden under the fruitiness but not inhibited to unfold efficacy. Smooth, soft, silky and slightly sticky palate, soft and fine carbonation.
Greetings from Bydgoszcz, Poland to all Beer Geeks and Hopheads around the world!

Great amber colour with a light head. Aromas are ripe fruit, maybe pineapple, and inviting. Sweet tangy, warm malty flavours. A little bitter on the edges of my tongue. Great balance. It's a strong brew at 10%, but easy to drink.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. It poured a copper color with a big frothy cream color head that maintainted? a nice covering with minimal lacing. Nice dark fruit and banana aroma. Boozey up front. Sweet finish. Full bodied.

Do tap: cerveja marrom avermelhada, levemente turva, com espuma de boa formação e média duração. Aroma de pão, biscoito, um leve caramelo, banana ameixa, passas. Sabor doce, com leve frutado de passas e banana, leve acidez, muito álcool. O sabor, como um todo, é bem suave. Possui corpo médio, pouca carbonatação. Retrogosto bem maltado, voltando ao pão e grãos e calor de álcool.
É bem forte, o álcool as vezes sobressai, mas é uma delícia, sempre vale a pena.

bjcp:
aromat 8 - przyprawy i rodzynki.
wygląd 2
smak 15 - słodko, rodzynki kolendra jakiś przejrzały banan
usta 4 - alk za mocno grzeje
ogólnie 6 - ak by poleżało byłoby lepiej

Butelka 330 ml, cena 13 zł
Aromat: Estry owocowe, banan, cytrusy, delikana wanilia, także guma balonowa
Wygląd: Wysoka, biała piana. Dość drobna. Zostawia znaczne ślady na szkle. Barwa ciemno pomarańczowa, brązowa
Smak: Owocowe, przede wszystkim o smaku pomarańczy, cytrusów, ale też zarówno banany jak i śliwki. Lekka wanilia, karmel. Trochę upodabnia się do szampana. Delikatnie kwaskowe. Drobny posmak alkoholowy. Odpowiednie wysycenie i tekstura. Brak dominujących nut. Tak jak w przypadku mniej alkoholowych wersji złożony zapach i smak bez nut dominujących. Bardzo fajne piwo, ale cena jednak dość wysoka.

Apprarance: slighty hazy brown copper. Slight head that falls away quickly
Aroma: light orange. Plums, raisins. Hints if alcohol
Palate: medium mouthfeel. Medium low carbonation
Taste: rich malt, dried fruits, warm alcohol on back of palate that lingers. Balanced bitterness, not sweet
From old tasting notes. Hazy Amber liquid topped by a creamy beige head. Soft fruity malt nose hints at a banana split (?) flavor. Syrupy, spicy malt flavor is smooth, but potent. A real mouthful .

Dunkelbraun, Rotstich und hefetrüb mit guter Blume. Der Antrunk ist hefig, malzig. Vanille gut schmeckbar, Alknoten kommen bei 10% auch durch. Schmeckt wie ein Weizenbockbier, da Ich auch Banane schmecken kann.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2017 Hazy brown amber color, decent head for such a thing, getting some nuts, wine, not nauseatingly sweet, some alco on the tail but I never done minded that too much, works here. Plus for general availability.

Light beige frothy head soon left a cover on a hazy, light oak coloured body. 
Boozy aroma with stewed fruits, demerara sugar & almond. 
Medium to full bodied. Smooth, soft on the palate & little carbonation. 
Caramel, banana, hints of orange, stewed fruits & bitter/sweet alcohol aft. 
Excellent Quad
caramel, resin, earthy, alcohol, amber, clear, minimal head, medium sweetness, full body, slick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Marrón cobriza con espuma densa color canela suave, buen encaje. Especiada, licórica, notas a levadura belga, frutas maduras, vainilla y frutos secos. En boca, untuosa, plena, maltosa, licórica con notas especiadas y un amargor que entra rápido. Retrogusto a frutos secos. Siempre alcohol, pero muy bien integrado. Una cerveza muy bien balanceada.

Butelka 0,75l pite w domu.Kolor mętny, bursztynowy, piana w normie niezbyt mocna jak to u belgów ale ładnie osiada.Aromat toffi i karmelu lekkiego. W smaku szampańskie toffi alkohol wyczuwalny. Mała goryczka, średnie wysycenie. Spodziewałem się więcej ale dostałem swoje, bardzo dobre piwo.

0,33 l bottle. Pours hazy dark amber with small off white head. Aroma of malt, yeast some alcohol, dried fruit, strong ripe banana scent, light vanilla. Taste is heavy sweet, but also quite bitter. Body is full, texture is creamy, carbonation quite lively. Finish is long, bitter sweet. Alcohol is very much present all the way, it gives you nice warm felling.

Butelka 330 ml. Trochę zbyt hardkorowe. W składzie m.in.: sytop glukozowy, który powoduje za dużą słodkość. Rozgrzewający słodki alko, aż przypomina szampana. Barwa ciemna miedź-rubin, piana puszysta jak u Belga, ale jakby mniej imponująca, niż się spodziewałem. Lekka paloność, toffi, mało cierpkie na podniebieniu. W sumie mała goryczka, wysycenie duże do średniego. Ogólnie myślałem, że będzie po prostu lepsze.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2017 Wow, tried that one on tap at the Bier Markt on Sparks. This is one of my fond beer discoveries. And I thought the triple was good. Brought the 750ml at my sisters annual lobsterfest gathering, a great drink with seafood.
The aroma is of alcohol, vanilla. The appearance is a nice amber with a cream head. The taste is also of alcohol. Overall not as great as I had hoped.
Hazy dark amber colour with thon white head, aroma is yeasty and boozy, taste of caramel, slightly roasted, sweet with great bitterness.
Piwo wypite przed założeniem konta na RB, ocena w celu uzupełnienia profilu. Troche alkoholowe, poza tym bardzo smaczne.

Bottle at the Bier Hoose. Pours a beautiful armagnac amber/gold. Soft malty, toffee and deep must aroma. Fabulous full mouthfeel, soft and luscious. Lovely balance of booze, toffee, yeast. Stands to applaud.
Looks stunning, has a good, syrupy mouthfeel and a rich taste but the alcohol presence is way too dominating for my taste.
33 cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de bière. Belle robe cuivrée, arômes de banane et de vanille.
Bottle 0,33. Pours clear amber with off-white head. Peach, pears, yeast, toffee, banana. Full body and average carbonation.

Bottle on sale at Hankyu, best by this month. Pours a deep bronze amber, low beige head. Aroma throws up banana, roasted nuts, brown sugar, freshly baked bread, caramel. Flavour of sweet and toasty malt, banana, Belgian yeast, caramelised sugar, dark fruits, a touch of booze. Nicely fizzy up front, full feel on the backend, nut flavour a lingering and throat warmth. A big beer and thoroughly enjoyable.
Birra dolce, fruttata forse un pò "semplice" per essere una quadrupel. Probabilmente bevuta con il suo bicchiere dordonanza a calice ha provocato la dispersione di alcuni importanti aromi.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2017 Barwa miedziana. Wysoka, drobnopęcherzykowa piana. W aromacie alkohol, banan i inne owoce. W smaku wyraźnie słodowy, lekko karmelowy, owocowy. Nikła acz przyjemna goryczka. Dobrze ukryty alkohol ujawniający się dopiero jako rozgrzewające uczucie w przełyku.

Bottle served in Trappist glass. Cloudy reddish brown with an off white head that fizzed away to almost nothing. Banoffee pie aroma - toffee, banana, bread - which carries over into the flavour, which adds alcohol warmth and some extra fruit flavour. Rather splendid

Bärnstensfärgad med gräddigt skum. Oerhört fyllig och komplex doft med mycket malt, knäck och övermogen banan. Smaken är eldig, fyllig med massa fruktighet och en underbar värmande eftersmak. Flytande godis av bästa klass! Att en öl kan smaka så mycket!

Vjerojatno ima malo ljudi koji imalo poznaju pive da nisu čuli za La trappe. Ovaj put je u dućane doao quadrupel od 10% alk. Jedno od onih piva koje je teta brzo piti. Ima pregrt aroma i okusa i teta je to u par minuta uliti u sebe. Čista petica! Vrhunsko, vrhunsko pivo!
Really nice murky copper colour. Dense, creamy head. Aroma is toffee and some fruit. Taste is candied fruit, vanilla, and toffee. Feels pretty boozy.

Aroma rather mild, malt, toffee, sweet fruit, some yeasty spice. Pours deep copper with very large frothy head. In flavor intense, sweet: maltiness, toffee, caramel. Beyond that winey, slightly fruity, raisins, yeasts (bananas). Finishes with spiciness and mild but a bit numbing bitterness which seems to be part herbal and part alcoholic; same sensation in the aftertaste. Full body, syrupy, with quite considerable tingling carbonation. Quite delicious, also looks impressive with beautiful retentive head and lacing.

Excelente cerveza, elixir de los dioses medievales. Tomar una bebida cómo esta sin dudas te remonta a la edad media, con los monjes creando deliciosas bebidas para sobrevivir crudos inviernos y que a la vez sirven de precioso alimento. Color excelente, ámbar oscuro tirando a rojizo, espuma duradera y de alta consistencia. Carbinatacion media- alta. Sabor, simplemente maravilloso. Frutal, acaramelado, y está muy bien equilibrado con sus 10.5% de alcohol. Una cerveza de postre sin duda alguna. Excelente para el invierno. En realidad para cualquier estación viene bien este cervezote.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2017 0,33 bottle. Pours nice amber color with tan medium head that lasts. Aroma of fruits an alcohol. Taste of candid fruits, plums, vanila. Strong presence of alcohol.  Soft carbonation, oily mouthfeel, sweet and dry aftertaste.

Banana toffee caramel aromas with hints of alcohol. Nice reddish orange amber colour with good lacing. Soft carbonated mouth feel and alcohol nicely hidden. The beer smooths out nicely at the end, I like the tingling alcohol sensation.
Pours amber with white soapy head. Aroma of raisin, fig, and spice. Dry finish and surprisingly light with dark fruit flavor with some tartness, spice,and banana. Touch of alcohol burn. Very nice.

Bière rousse sans mousse, un arôme de caramel, de sous bois un peu grillé., juste pétillante comme il faut, un goût assez corsé, on sent la force de la quadruple fermentation, on est quand même sûr du 10°. On reste sur du fumé, de la force de fruits secs grillés, de caramel très bonne bière qui se boit mieux à température ambiante que fraîche cest une bière de dégustation

Pours a hazy dark amber color with foamy light tan head and lively carbonation. Aroma is mostly fruity with banana and raisin notes. Spicy with a bit of tartness, with some sweet fruitiness and bitterness rounding out the tasting. Full bodied with mostly sweet finish. Very good.

Birra dal colore ambrato. Schiuma fine e persistente. Allolfatto profumi come frutta candita, caramello e sentori floreali. Al palato è dolce, frutta secca, caramello e un lievisdimo tostato. Lalcol è ben camuffato. Unottima birra per un dolce.

Gran cerveza de abadía cuádruple. Prefiero La Trappe Dubbel por cuestiones de gusto personal, pero ésta igualmente está a un altísimo nivel.
Tomada en copa a partir de botella de 33 cl.
Tiene un aroma afrutado, no demasiado intenso, pero llega de forma muy notable. En cuanto a su apariencia posee un color anaranjado oscuro con tintes marrones y ambarinos, con una corona de espuma blanca bastante espesa y densa que se mantiene constante.
El sabor es bastante intenso, afrutado y sorprendentemente dulce. El paladar es algo alcohólico pero muy agradable captando los mismos matices del sabor.
Muy recomendable.
user_location: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, SPAIN

text:
Long time staple for me. Aroma of malt and some dark fruit. Flavours of caramel, malt, and soft banana. Great fermentation. This beer never lets me down. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled 330ml, best before 03-2019. Pours in beautiful clear amber with ruby reflexes with a solid, sturdy medium white head. The coating left on the glass is just superb, semi-thick long lasting. Sweet banana and vanilla aroma. I also smell peaches? Full bodied, oily texture but can feel foamy due to very lively carbonation but still its a very nice feeling. Lightly sweet in taste, very slight amount of bitterness and a sweet after-taste. I would like a bit more bitterness in the taste. The alcohol is very well hidden, almost undetectable except a small warming sensation in the mouth. Great beer.

21. 2. 2017, Ljubljana. Bottled. Still not a fan of Trappists but this one is heavily strong but still a bit sour in the taste. Sweet in the aftertaste and quite interesting nevertheless.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 33cl.
Poured dark amber with a tan fading head.
Aroma is dark fruit, alcohol is very present!
Taste is fruity, alcohol, caramel.
Warm full bodied.

Head disappeared quickly and was rather thin. Red rotten apples in the aroma, caramel, grapes. Sharp alcohol flavor, minimal sweetness. Aftertaste is long and pleasant. Actually, easy to drink, not much body.

Bottle. Dark amber colour. Very sweet. Rich, smooth. Very fruity (dried fruits, raisins, and oranges). Very malty (caramel & burnt sugar). Spicy (peppery, coriander). Yeasty (lots of floaties). Alcohol very well disguised for its high ABV. Very drinkable. Liked this. (2008)

330ml bottle into tulip. Copper colour with thin white head and a million tiny bubbles. Nose has doughnuts, plum and vanilla malt. Thick, viscous mouthfeel. Zingy on the tongue, banana on the swallow, warming alcohol at the end. Later tastes bring out woody, vinous dryness. Excellent contemplative sipper.
UPDATED: FEB 26, 2017 Pours amber, big head, clear. Dry fruits, hay, alcohol, yeast, Heavy sweetness, little biterness. Full of wild aromas.
For me one of the best Belgium beer with a nice amber color and a little white head. Great malty tast with caramel and a soft aftertaste.

From bottle to tulip. Aroma of dark fruit and alcohol. Slight banana and spicy esters. Slightly hazy copper with sustained off-white head that leaves a full collar and covers the top of the beer. Minimal lacing. Taste is plum. There is a bit of a harsh graininess on the end.

Une bière couleur dambre, à leffervescence moyenne, émettant des arômes de gomme balloune, tant en nez quen bouche. Les saveurs divaguent ensuite entre sucre dorge, toffee et pêches, dans un équilibre quasi parfait. Lalcool est ressenti, mais contrôlé, alors que la signature de levure trappiste est ici la vraie vedette. Une bière superbe, moelleuse et décadente.

Poured from a 330 ml bottle into a pint glass. The appearance is an murky amber color with orange tint with a small white head. The aroma is full of fruit and malt. The taste is malt driven and has an excellent blend of fruit.

Acheter chez tabac&co palais des bières dans famiflora à dottignies. 
Bouteille de 33cl.
Verre TEKU. 
Couleur ambre/ cuivre reflet acajou .
Belle brillance bien profond .
Mousse subtilement présente aéré. 
Au nez : cest le malts, note de caramel et de malts torréfiée très ancré au nez .
En bouche : cest noté caramel et très perceptible , très longue et équilibrée. 
Un arrière de malts torréfié assez rapidement remplacer par un peu boisée très léger .
Beaucoup de corps !
Amertume très légèrement étudier. 
Équilibre maîtriser, beaucoup de goût !
Parádní masivní pivo , které je sice doopravdy těké na pití, ale proitky jsou naprosto ve vech směrech originální.

0.33 l bottle from Pivoteka, Zagreb. Shared with lovely Anja. Murky amber, lasting, small off-white head. Dry fruits, brown sugar, toasty, light floral. Sweet and strong. Warming, soft, alcohol present, moderate finish. Very strong and husky and some like it that way!

33cl bottle at de Brasserie in Emmen. Pours a slight hazy dark amber colour with a reddish glow and a small off white head which rapidly recedes to a thin layer on top. Aroma of dried fruit, red fruit, malts, candy sugar, alcohol. Taste is fairly sweet, light bitter with a warming finish. Notes of caramel, malts, banana, red fruits, alcohol, candy sugar. Texture is oily, full bodied with moderat carbonation
UPDATED: JUN 22, 2017 a gentle quadrupel. molasses and banana esters are evident. medium bodied, soft carbonated.  well balanced. hidden abv makes it dangerously drinkable.

Pours quiet light as for a quadrupel... I expected it to be darker. On the one hand belgian beers are usually highly carbonated but this is too much for me. The aroma gives domination to some bananas and yeasts than some dark notes, the beer is quiet alcoholly and not balanced. Overall it was not so complex and rather a disappointment.

33cl bottle
 pours a dark amber tiny whit head that does not last
 Aroma bit chemical dry tones bit of fruit
 Taste dry tart fruit again bit chemical
 not a beer i would drink again vastly overrated

On tap @Walla Walla (Rome). Bruna, intensa, schiuma bianco-sporco media, discretamente persistente. Al naso tanto malto, caramello, datteri, fichi secchi, ciliegie sotto spirito. In bocca è dolce, maltata, bilanciata appena da un finale amarognolo. Corpo pieno, carbonazione leggera. Bella bevuta, nonostante tutto.

Aroma: bready with caramel, plum, soft alcohol.
Appearance: amber color, white head, thick head.
Taste: malt, plum, sweetness, low bitterness, heavy finish.
Palate: smooth, warm, medium body, high carbonation.

Flaska från Beergium, drygt året gammal. Klar bärnstensfärgad med vitt skum. Brödig och maltig doft och smak av bränt socker, honung, övermogna äpplen, dadlar, lite alkoholvärme och lite bittra toner.
Boca 0,33L - s obzirom na cijenu a pogotovo ocijene ovdje na stranici zamiljao sam bolje pivo...dosta se osjeti alkohol i u mirisu i okusu, tamna amber boja...

Pours amber (its the lighter quad in color Ive ever had) slightly hazy. Little whitish head. Aroma is fruity for days, lots of yeast esters and sweet booze. Flavour is complex: raisins, plums, honey, caramel, toffee, nice sweet booze. A slight bitter note in the end. Finish is quite dry but warm. Medium body, low carbonation. One of the best quads for sure.

07.01.2017. 0,33l Bottle. Thanks KKS<3!! Brown colour with white head. Aroma is dark malts. Lots of malty flavours. Dark malt, pale malt and sweet malt. Lots of alcohol. Strong rich body. Good aftertaste wit flavours of malt. Very good beer!!!

Bue 2ans avant DLC. Bière blonde foncée/ambrée à carbo moyenne et col de mousse moyen à tres bonne tenue. Arôme dabricot et dalcool. Douce, ronde et crémeuse en bouche. Final sur lalcool, labricot et les raisins secs. Tres bonne bière un poil trop alcoolisée à mon goût.

Bottle. Dark cloudy orange. Thick head with nice lacing. Appearance and aroma reminds me of a Belgian Strong Ale...Aroma of bananas and citrus fruits. Taste is lemons, oranges, sugar, caramell and some dried dark fruits. Yeast, bubblegum and marzipan. Sour and spicy. Finish is long, heavy, bitter and complex. Alcoholic and charming warming. Low carbonation. Full bodied. Lovely Quad but different than the ones I had before.
Очень вкусный Бельгий& квадрюп& красивы& цвет, хороший аромат и вкус, приятно& послевк& хорошая плотнос& алкогол& почти не ощущает& качеств& пиво! Дата розлива 20.05.2016. (Bottle 0,33/ 10%)

erved in a Trappist glass from a 330ml bottle. Pours cloudy dark golden colour with a thick off-white head. Aroma is bread, slightly sour dough, yeast, grass, caramel and hints of orange peel. Taste is caramel, orange peel and hints of bread. Full, almost creamy body with medium carbonation and increasing sensation of warmness in the finish. Very enjoyable but a bit heavy in the mouthfeel.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2017 Update 19 februari.

Amber kleurig bier met een aroma van: banaan, zoet, beetje bubblegum, donker fruit. Smaak is zoet, banaan, donker fruit en wat alcohol in de afdronk.

Fles gedeeld door Inoven, geprobeerd met Benzai. Een fles La Trappe Quadrupel van de eerste lichting, 25jaar oud, houdbaar tot einde 1995. Heerlijk hoe het bier zich ontwikkeld tot een haast port achtige drank!
Fat @ Taproom. Rödbrun öl med beige skum. Doft av karamell, mörkt socker och russin. I smaken tillkommer en lättare kryddighet som balanserar sötman något.

Bottle, 0.33l. Pours hazy copper body with small and creamy off-white head. Lovely smell of yeast, vanilla, nuts and wood.

Full body, softly carbonated. Nice thick texture. Pleasantly sweet with a touch of alcohol bitterness. Rich and complex aroma. Yeast, brown sugar, vanilla, caramel, toffee, licorice. Nutty and woody. Slightly sticky on the tongue. Warming alcohol presence, especially in the finish. 

Overall, very good. Perfect brew to enjoy during the cold winter evenings.

25cl bottle at home. Hazy cherry red pour with a really tall off-white head and visible carbonation rising to the top of the glass. Notes of dried fruit (apples, plums, pears), overripe bananas, light rosemary, burnt caramel, light metallic bitterness. Medium to full body, medium carbonation and a bitter sweet (mostly sweet) finish.

Barwa ciemno miedziana, bardzo mocno m?tna, ?redniej wielko?ci, bia?a piana, ?rednio trwa?a. 
W aromacie wyra?ne nuty owocowe, wanilia, nieco lukrecji, delikatnie karmel, drewno i orzechy.
Smak to nuty owocowe, s? ?liwy, figi, dalej jest wanilia ponownie karmel i lukrecja, nuty orzechowe w tle.
Na finiszu ka?dego ?yku pestkowa, sucha goryczka, doskona?e redukuje karmelow? i owocow? s?odycz.
Umiej?tnie schowany alkohol.
Nasycenie ?rednie w kierunku do wysokiego

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2017 Update : après une Malheur 10 carrément éventée que jai du retester, jai décidé de revoir La Trappe Quadrupel après une dégustation désastreuse. Le nez est déjà différent : sur lalcool bien sûr, très liquoreux et hyper puissant, mais avec des arômes bien plus subtils : la pêche, labricot, la prune, la datte, de bons malts, la châtaigne, un fort côté résineux avec des grosses notes de pin, du cuir, un peu de banane, une levure droite... Il me manquera des notes florales et dagrumes pour vraiment avoir quelque chose moins brut de décoffrage. En bouche, la carbonatation est assez faible, lamertume légère, la texture très huileuse et lalcool vraiment (trop) puissant à mon goût qui déséquilibre lensemble. Un petit côté beurrée qui me fait dire que le stockage et/ou le transport de cet exemplaire nest toujours pas optimal, mais on est à des années lumières de la "saloperie" que jai pu boire auparavant. Une arrière-bouche sur les arachides (noix, cacahuète) est perceptible, très douce, très agréable et ajoute de la souplesse. La longueur est très bonne, sur lalcool, les saveurs de malts et ces fameux arachides. Il me manque toujours la note végétale pour bien faire. Mais ça reste une bonne Quadrupel qui ne viendra quand même pas titiller ce qui se fait de mieux dans le genre. Bouteille 33cl, V&B Grenoble.
Belle rousse/ambrée légèrement troublée avec sa mousse stable sur 1cm, bien blanche. Rien qui ne nous annonce la Bérézina à venir. Au nez, la banane, mais une banane chimique ! Limpression désagréable davoir ouvert une boite de bonbons acidulés, vous savez, ces bananes et bouteilles de cola acides à souhait quon bouffait étant gosses. Bref, un nez artificiel qui fait médicament et qui est limite écurant à la longue. Bon, tout nest pas jeter quand même : on sent tout de même des agrumes avec des notes de mandarines, pas bégueules, mais le tout est massacré par un alcool type Vodka qui prend le dessus immanquablement. En bouche, texture huileuse, carbonatation faible, toujours cette banane omniprésente et un alcool digne dune mauvaise liqueur. Alors une fois de plus, suis-je tombé sur une mauvaise bouteille ? En attendant, jai juste limpression davoir bu une bière de cuite pour punk à chien. Breuvage insignifiant et inutile. Bouteille 33cl, V&B Grenoble.

Pours a pretty persistent thick foamy light brown head. Has a dark cloudy amber appearance. Aromas are of earth hops and bready malts, slightly yeasty. Has nutty flavours and resin type hops with hints of caramel and toffee. Mouthfeel is warming and a bit chalky, medium bodied and fairly lively carbonation. Alcohol taste is pretty noticeable.
Finish is a bit of mild bitterness. Wasnt really blown away but still a good brew.
El alcohol predomina en esta quadruple, para mi sobrevalorada, demasiado dura, me superó
Brown appearance with little head. Complex tastes of candisugar, caramel and dried fruits. Medium-heavy, soft carbonation and a sweet finish of caramel. Great Trappist

Dark gold to copper. Fruity aroma with some caramel. Has a strong taste of alcohol, but enough sweetness to carry it. Very balanced. Though, we were not all in agreement at the dinner party. One commented that it was just an alcohol bomb with little balance. Well attenuated, so it maintains drinkable. I consider a great example of the style.

Hazy brown with littel white head. Aroma is cinnamon, leather, phenolic stuff, spices, clove, peach, citrus, wood, complex and nice. Taste is smooth phenolic spicyness with some fruity sweetness and less carbonation induced sourness. Its like eating a christmas cookie. Heavy and smooth. Not much carbonation. A bit oily. No alcohol. This is nice.
Bottle. Brown color with no head. Aroma is booze, raisins. Taste is raisins, toffee, booze, some figs. Medium carbonation. Nice, but a bit too boozy.

tap@ 안녕 amber, carbonating, with a creamy beige head. Banana, caramel,, , alcohol, candisugar. Lovely, silky, warming mouthfeel with flavors of alcohol, dried fruits, yeast, candisugar, caramel, spices and ripe pears. Full-bodied and sweet. The finish has alcohol, spices and sugar.
Aus der Flasche im Fritz-Brauhaus in Strslsund getrunken. Goldkupfern im Glas. Schöne Hopfen- und Alkoholnoten in der Nase. Gute Abschlusstrunk.

Poured into a tulip. Has a nice ginger colour with an inch or so of head.

Lots of sweetness, cherries, bananas and some vanilla on the nose.

Tastes super sweet, lots of cherries, banana. Some spices and a bit of acidity help to balance the palate.

Medium body that lingers on the tongue. Aftertaste is boozy and dominated by dried cherries and bananas.

Overall impression is that this is a very fruity beer, perhaps a bit too sweet. The booziness and bitters help to balance that quite well so it never seems too over the top.
Pours cloudy amber with an off white head. Notes of caramel, chocolate, leather, banana, yeast. Had this a while and forgot to rate it but it was quite good.
Pours hazy honey with medium sized off-white head. Aroma is yeast, fruits and malts. Taste has yeast, hops, malt. Great trappist.

Very clear dark amber color with off white normal head, lasting and lacing beautifully. Nose is caramel, light yeast esters( banana) , candy sugar, sweet malts, very light caramel oxidized notes, toffee. Taste is sweet, complex, burnt sugar notes, caramel, honey, some phenolic spiciness. Light alcohol and sweet caramel malts on the finish. Medium lasting sweet and warm aftertaste. Very good.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2017 Dark amber colour. Nice taste that balances between a subtle sweetness, fruit, very subtle bitterness and alcohol. Banana, fruity notes, yeast, cream, very subtle chocolate. Hint of cloves.

Enjoyed: Poured from a bottle into a trappist glass.
Appearance: Hazy red/amber colour, with small lively foam/carbonation (like a little spring).
Aroma: Banana, pear, citrus, alcohol
Palate: Full body, moderate carbonation with many small nibbling bubbles. 
Taste: Sweet, caramel, honey, banana, malt/whole grain bread, moderate bitter/sweet alcoholic aftertaste.
Overall impression: Enjoyable, tasty, strong.
Pours chestnut in color with an off white lacing. The aroma is caramel and somewhat nutty, with notes of alcohol and baking spices. Its certainly not on par with Westvleteren or St. Bernardus

330 ml bottle. Rich amber slightly hazy pour. 2 finger off-white head. Aroma: lots of ripe banana, light alcohol touch, nuts, toffee. Flavour is nutty, malty, toffee, alcohol, dough. Intense in general. A bit harsh. Throat warming. Dry finish. Full body. Still rather smooth for a 10 abv brew. An interesting experience.

Tap at Clubhouse BFD. Pours light orange caramel white head. Aroma is banana laffy taffy, Belgian spice, maybe nutmeg, some clove, plum. Flavor is Belgian spice, plum, very nice quad character, Belgian yeast strain is prominent, plum, banana, clove. Nice. Dont know if Ive had this before. Pleasant. But a little sweet. Fairly boozy alcohol burn.

Bottle. Amber-brownish pour, big creamy beige head with exceptional retention and lace. Nose is toffee, dried fruit, candy sugar, banana, spice. Mouth is caramelly, nutty, fruity, vanilla, honey, candied peel, yeasty spice, faint warmth on the finish. Very nice.

De color marrón con destellos. Espuma de fina burbuja y media retención. Bastante carbónico. Aroma y sabor a bizcocho bañado en almíbar, también fruta madura, azúcar moreno, dulce. Alcohol bien integrado. Batch: K24B15 BB 2018-02

The color is hazy amber with off-white head. Aroma of malt and banana, little roasted. Taste is medium sweet with sweet finish. Notes of fruits and resins. Warming alcohol, but not too much. Overall a very good beer.

330 ml bottle. Pours a nearly clear amber with an off-white head. The aroma is lightly yeasty (dough) with some caramel notes. Full body with low carbonation and a medium to heavy sweetness. The flavor is alcoholic with lightly roasted malt, caramel, molasses, whisky along with some fruity aromas.

Piwo lekko metne w kolorze zloto brazowym z obfita grubopecherzykowa piana. W aromacie typowe nuty belgijskich drozdzy, dojrzale owoce jak brzoskwinie i sliwki oraz troche orzechow laskowych. W smaku mieszanka przypraw, banany i karmel. Slodkie z wysyceniem na sred im poziomie i dosc niska goryczka. Czuc lekki alkohol i slodycz.

Idealna piana, drobna, stojąca. Zapach i smak bardzo bogaty w zioła, słód, ale też orzeźwienie. Dużo ciemnych owoców, ale też nuta wina. Mega pijalne, z jednej strony słodkie, ale też orzeźwiejące. Bardzo dobre piwo

Aroma is bubblegum. Initial mouth taste is of an ok ale, but further mouthfuls allow the less pleasant bubblegum flavour to become dominant in the nose and on the palette, leading to a growing dislike of the beer, and a determination never to waste time or money on it again...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

An aged bottle at home. Date on the label is 09-2011, so this is probably 7+ years old. A deep ruby red amber brown autumnal coloured pour with a thin beige tan head. Aroma is cola cubes, boozy raisin, brown sugars, christmas pudding, whiffs of hot alcohol, Flavour is composed of unrefined sugars, toffee, burnt toffee apple, christmas spices, dried orange rind. Rich layered malts and complex sugars. Palate is medium sugar but good attenuation, highish carbonation. Age isnt actually that noticeible on this beer. Very good beer. I used to go mad for beers like this.

Pour cette dernière bière élaborée par labbaye Notre-Dame de Koningshoeven en 1991, les moines trappistes se sont laissés emportés par une véritable envolée lyrique! Cest une réelle chevauchée des Walkiries qui envahit le palais lors de cette dégustation. Notre pure sang est dun bel ambré, limpide, et surmonté dune splendide mousse blanc crème dun cm dépaisseur, onctueuse. Le nez est racé, la base se porte sur les céréales avec des notes citronées et de coriandre mais les arômes liquoreux viennent le renforcer et lui donner une belle consistance. A la dégustation, la galop est tout de suite donné. Lattaque, épicée, sur les céréales et le caramel est puissante voire imposante. Lamertume apparaît alors, dune intensité et corpulence exceptionnelle. Telles les notes dun opéra de Wagner envahssant lespace, les arômes surgissent et vous prennent le palais. Les arômes sont portés vers le cointreau, la girofle avec une présence de lalcool marquée, souhaitée, très bien maîtrisée et lui conférant un côté liquoreux (sans être pour autant de trop sucré). Le final, très long laisse une place un peu plus marquée aux épices. En conclusion, la Trappe Quadruple est une bière excptionnelle. Lintensité de ses arômes, sa longueur en bouche très longue et son côté liquoreux marqué en font une bière de dégustation mais qui par ses spécificités pourra déplaire à certains. Pour ma part, les moines auront réussi à élever ma spiritualité. Leur art, dune maîtrise sans faille, vaut allégrement la note maximale.

0.33 l bottle. Pours copper color with a long lasting, foamy white head.
Strong dried fruits notes both in aroma and taste, with roasted malts, burnt sugar, nutty and alcohol overtones. Pleasant sweet aftertaste, very soft carbonation, and not overwhelmingly heavy body with surpringly well hidden ABV. Well balanced, complex brew.

Pours copper bronze. Aroma full of banana, caramel and vanilla. When you taste it the banana sweetness is balanced with darker tones of roasted malt. Aftertaste left in the mouth is like resinous licorice. So far, this is my favourite trappist.
Very good, if somewhat distanced by the really amazing beers in its category. Esters and dried fruit, good amount of boozeyness and too much carbonation for my taste in a quad.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2016 Bottle. Color: Clear copper golden, dense white head. Taste: Nice complex mix of spices, hints of caramel, yeast, fruit (plums, bananas, apples), malt and alcohol. Full body. Medium carbonation. Mildly bitter spicy finish. Great quadrupel.
衝鼻而來的巧

This was poured into a chalice.
The appearance was a golden burnt orange ruddy brown color. Thick foamy white head that dissipates nice and even and then messy stringy lacing.
The aroma takes in crisp sweet Belgian sugars, plums, raisins, mild sweet Belgian yeasty/bready, subtle vanilla, creamy almonds.
The flavor takes in a nice blend of the sweetness to the spices. Lingering sweet bready/sweet to spicy aftertaste running into the finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body, surprisingly a bit more sessionable than I thought. Carbonation feels good. ABV barely reveals itself, wow, damn well hidden.
Overall, damn fine quad, I would love to have again this time of the year.
chocolate, roasty, caramel, banana, vanilla, raisin, brown, hazy, frothy, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation,

Overtuigend zoete geur, gevolgd door een even duidelijke volle smaak waarin zeker de banaan duidelijk naar voor komt. Zeer zachte afdronk met heel subtiele bitterheid. Topbiertje!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from slijterijhetfust.nl. Pours auburn brown with an initially large beige colour head. Aroma of malt, toffee, chocolate, banana, dark fruit, and light spice. Fairly heavy sweetness, mild bitterness, touch of sour. Medium/heavy body, sticky texture, soft carbonation. Finishes with alcohol edge, warming, with lasting sweetness and sour edge. Lovely.
Bottle from Real Ale Store, Newark.Amber colour with a white head. Yeasty, sweet fruit and caramel aroma with a slight spiciness. Taste fruity bitter sweet and balanced. Rich body.
Great! Really great, really great, really great, really great, really great, really great!
Shared bottle at home. Pours clear copper with dense off-white head. Aroma of apples, fruit bubble gum, plums, caramel, ethanol. Tastes sweet, alcoholic warmth, highly carbonated.
One of my favourites. Pours a dark caramel colour with plenty of thick head. Rich, sweet flavours with a hint of bitterness. Mild aroma that mirrors taste.

330ml bottle. Hazy amber colour with a creamy off-white head. Aroma: rich malt, dried fruits, spices, yeast, hint of banana, vanilla. Taste: same as aroma- sweet, rich malt, dried fruits, spices, yeast, warming alcohol. Mostly sweet with a slight bitterness at the end. Soft-moderate carbonation, smooth mouthfeel. Excellent.
Butelka, spodziewałem się szału po trapistach jednakże ten quadrupel okazał się zwyczajny. Taki sobie.

Color ámbar turbio con capa de espuma de un blanco amarillento de menos de un dedo de grosor (no mucha retención, aunque no llega a desaparecer del todo). Algo de carbonatación, pero mínima (más presente en boca por su burbujeo típico). Aroma frutal (como de fruta machacada), fresco, y alcohólico. Sabor también frutal, con predominio posterior del dulzor de las maltas (no capto lúpulo) y con un regusto final alcohólico muy placentero. Amargor no tiene, como dice en la descripción. Muy buena opción para una Quadrupel (La Trappe no suele fallar).
Amber colour, big head. Strong bananas and clove aromas. Spicy finish, low bitterness, very sweet. Alcohol hidden. Very good

It pours dark amber with a light tan head. It produces plenty of lacing. It has a sweet malt aroma with caramel, plums, and dried cherry. The flavors are highlighted by a burst of fruity esters with the plums the most noticeable. There are also some spices with dried cherry and caramel. There is some moderate alcohol warming. It has a moderately full body that produces a sweet finish with a bit of bitterness. Overall this produces a burst of fruity esters highlighted by the plums with a complex malt mixture that has a pleasant sweet finish with tinges of bitterness throughout the taste.

Pite z kranu. Bardzo dobry quadrupel o złożonym aromacie z nutami rodzynek, fig, nalewki, wina, ciemnych owoców i podobnym, bardzo owocowym, "suszonym" smaku. Nieco może zbyt słodki i wyklejający, ale w tym stylu jest to dopuszczalne. W wyglądzie ciemny brąz z całkiem przyzwoitą pianą. Piwo bardzo dobre, bogate, degustacyjne, może nie aż tak bogate jak największe belgijskie perełki, ale jest tu naprawdę bardzo dobrze. Myślę, że jeszcze wrócę, tym razem w wersji butelkowej. Bardzo dobre piwo

Très belle robe cuivrée avec des parfums de figues,raisins,bananes...et épices.
Une douceur et chaleur bien agréables en début de dégustation puis une amertume et un réchauffement alcoolisé en fin de bouche .
Délicieuse bière équilibrée et raffinée!

Dégustée dans un verre Kasteel.
Très belle robe dorée, mousse fine et carbonatation moyenne.
Le nez est raffiné avec des arômes de fruits secs.
Le goût est exceptionnellement délicat avec des touches de figue, dattes et banane, le tout idéalement enveloppé de douceur et dune légère amertume.
La finale longue est à la hauteur : alcool et sucre discrets parfaitement naturels.
Une bière danthologie!

Van t vat in Marktcafé Les Halles. U: Sterk wazig amber met beige schuimkraag. G: Banaan, karamel en wat kruiden. S: Zoet, banaan, abrikoos, karamel en alcoholwarmte. M: Volmondig met medium carbonatie.

A bottle from Jasons drunk at home during the typhoon! Aroma: malty, fruity, reminds me of the smell of a pub in the morning, before the cleaner has been through. Really good, this is the elixir of life, HA! Appearance: hazy, dark amber with a minimal tan-coloured head which hangs around. Palate: full-bodied and thick. Soft, unobtrusive carbonation, a long complex finish, vinous and fruity. Taste: heavy and sweet, pleasantly so. Good solid alcohol kick, definitely fruity. Wow... is this my favourite Trappist? Probably, yes.

Bottle. Deep amber colour with nice with head. Complex fruity and alcohol flavour. Some caramel, a bit wineous and grape. Light bitter, medium sweet (enough but not too much). Could tend to a liquoreuse cereal wine beverage. Really great

33 cl bottle poured into a chalice. Hazy, amber color. Frothy foam that diminish fast to a small crown. Fair lacing. Aroma of a malt, cereals, a banana, an apricot, raisins, some caramel and spicy phenols. Oily in palate, lively carbonated. Full body. Medium sweet and bitter. Fantastic dry, long lasting finish. Some alcohol, but very mild. Beer sticks to lips. Fantastic beer. I will try it after cellaring.

Alc. 10% vol. 
Review date: 09.2016
Expiration date: 03.2019

Veiled dark amber color with high density glass clinging activity. Extra frothy beige 4 finger island head, lasting around 10-15 minutes, with a very good amount of legs.

Aromas of light molasses, vinous, bready, and highly sweet. Flavors of toffee, roasted grains, dark fruits, walnuts, molassy, grapes, herbal spices. Super fruity and sugary with low sharpness.

Ultra thick smooth oily full body with moderate carbonation. Strong and long sugary finish, ending with a dry fruity estery tongue coat, barrel aged oaky wood feel, thick yeast and molassy, a hint of ginger and roasted grains.

Overall very good quality craft. Thick tasty flavors, but highly boozy. Low freshness from overwhelming sugars. Ideally served as an dessert appertizer being really heavy. Complex flavors and feel but overly sweet and unbalanced.

Aroma is fruity and malty with sweet dried fruits, plum, banana and caramel. Taste is sweet fruity with caramel, dried fig, plum, apricot and has a semi-sweet yet dry finish with alcoholic warmth.
Kolor ciemnobursztynowy, niewysoka piana,mętne. Aromat estrowy, słodki, cytrusowy. W smaku karmel i alkoholowa goryczka. Całkiem pijalne mimo swojego mocno alkoholowego charakteru.

Bottle, 33cl. Pours dark amber with a pale tan head. Very fruity aroma, peach, apricot and especially plum, some dried fruits and some malt. The aroma is almost overpoweringly fruity, perhaps. The flavour profile is spicy, yeasty and complex. There is also a huge fruitiness in it, more like a fermented fruit-like concept. Alcohol is more or less well balanced. Just a bit too sweet for my taste, and the fruitiness could have been more subtle. Full body, gradual finish that mellows down, nice oily texture. I was expecting a somewhat better beer though.
750ml. Bottle at kolonihaven shared with benjamin, pød mm. Amber with big creamy head. Sweet aroma of dried fruits. Taste is very sweet, maybe a bit too sweet in my taste. Fine beer though

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2016 Bottle at hopaholic. Beautiful mahagony-amber colour, small white lacing. Nose is malty, sweet. Taste is estery, banana. Very nice beer but a little bit too estery would even say its a hefeweizen with my eyes closed.
Gorgeous deep colour and huge bubbles. Sweet banana smell. Instant alcohol hit but still well balanced. Lifts you up and leaves you feeling carefree. Grassy finish. Wasnt expecting that.

Unsurprising but damn, what a classic. This is everything you can expect from one of the best Belgian beer, taste is quite awesome and Im not talking about the aftertaste that lasts in mouth for a long time... Not the strongest quadrupel on the market, taste is somewhat smoother than others I experienced previously but still remarkable. A really great beer for any occasion.. APPROVED BY TAVERNYS BLACK METAL CREW!
Draught at Delirium Monasterum. Like a softer plum liquor, as enjoyable as dangerous, Maybe not the most complex quad but a solid classic.
Rather artificial aroma and taste to be compensated by an high abv. Absloutely drinkable but not my thing.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2016 Flesje thuis gedronken, gekregen van Marja. Amberkleurig bier met mooie witte schuimkraag. Aroma is fruitig en citrusachtig. Ook de smaak is fruitig en zoet. Smaak ebt snel weg. 
------ De hierna volgende beoordeling: een fles van ca. 25 jaar oud. Houdbaarheidsdatum 1995 is als volgt: flesje gedeeld met Benzai en TomHendriksen. Aroma is magnifiek portachtig. De smaak is vol en smaakvol,  chocolade-achtig en enigszins caramelachtig en fris.  Het mondgevoel is helaas verdwenen. Geen nasmaak..

Somewhat hazy amber with a week offwhite head. Rich aroma of candy, dried fruits, raisins, toast, cookies, grapefruit, hints of spice and yeast. Tastes very sweet with a medium sourness from high carbonation, hardly any bitterness. Medium body, high alco warmth. An excellent warmer.

This is a nicely balanced Belgian style beer. Sweet but not too sweet. Cannery Row Beer Club gives it 8 thumbs up.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ei savipullo vaan normaali lasipullo. Punertavankuparinen olut La Trappelle tyypillisellä puolen sentin valkoisella kermaisella ja kestävällä, tiiviillä vaahtokerroksella. Tuoksu hiivainen, hedelmäinen ja alkoholinen. Maku sokerisen makea ja hedelmäinen, alkoholi maistuu loppupuolella. Pääasiassa jäljelle jää kuitenkin imelä makeus. Suutuntuma keskitäyteläisen ja täyteläisen väliltä. La Trappea parhaasta päästä, mutta tuntuu panimo jäävän tyylissä kuin tyylissä aina hieman muista jälkeen.

Served in a Trappist glass from a 330ml bottle. Pours cloudy dark golden colour with a thick off-white head. Aroma is bread, slightly sour dough, yeast, grass, caramel and hints of orange peel. Taste is caramel, orange peel and hints of bread. Full, almost creamy body with medium carbonation and increasing sensation of warmness in the finish. Very enjoyable but a bit heavy in the mouthfeel.

Deep Golden Amber pour with a small white head. Aroma has plenty of candied dark fruits - plums, red apple, cherry. Mild spice. Flavor is fairy sweet and spicy with a somewhat hot boozy finish, and the same fruits. Some banana flambe. Expressive yeast. Big profile. Moderately strong carbonation. Good stuff.

Happy happy joy joy. This is beer-perfection. An artisanal meld of dark fruit, yeast and peppery spice, La Trappe proves handily why they are the real deal. High octane but it never interferes. Soft and delicate but over the top at the same time. Im tasting history here and it is amazing. Ungh. Beergasm.

Geweldige quadrupel met warme, volle smaak en licht zoete afdronk. 
Deze quadrupel smaakt nog beter na een aantal jaar bewaren.
Aroma of dried fruits, cherries, biscuits, red vine, sweet toast, vanilla, spicy esters and of course alcohol. Full body, warming alcohol, sweet no bitterness with red fruits finish. Nice.

Mahognybrun med fint fast vitt skum. Doftar sött, kryddor, honung och farinsocker. Smaken omedelbart bred, mycket söta smaker med dominerande dadel. Eftersmaken dock tämligen tunn. Sötma och kryddor ligger kvar en stund.
33 cl från Casino i Montpellier. En fantastisk belgisk öl. Bara att köpa hem flera. Luktar och smakar grön banan.
Pours a dark amber with virtually no head. Has a nutty and burnt toffee taste. Will appeal to lots- but not me

Bottle. Pours a cloudy ambers it's a lasting foamy off white head. Aroma is of dark fruits, vanilla, nuts, wood, earthy, dried fruits, raisins, figs. Taste is of find his, raisins, vanilla, hint of banana on the finish, warning alcohol notes, toffee, yeasty. Sticky oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Bottle - Cloudy deep amber colour, large and stable creamy off-white head. Fruity and spicy aromas of dried red berries, red grapes, sme banana, vanilla, cloves. Taste is sweet, but no sticky, some brown sugar, dates, fig, banana. Full body, moderate carbonation, velvety texture, well rounded fruity and spicy finish. Great classic quadrupel.

Pours a amber red and hazy beer with almost nonexistent head. Aroma is dried fruits, plums, malty sweet with some caramel. Taste is pretty full, sweet and mildly bitter with notes of dried fruits and alcohol. Carbonation is quite heavy, probably a little bit too heavy in my opinion, but otherwise the body is almost perfect. Overall very enjoyable strong ale.

330ml bottle. Pours a cloudy dark red-amber with a large, frothy, short lived, off-white head that leaves spotty lacing. Sweet aroma of dried fruit, banana, caramel malt, vanilla and spice. Sweet flavour of dried fruit, caramel malt, banana, vanilla, yeast and spice with a warming alcohol finish. Full body with a smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Delicious and complex.
Bottle in Ghent. Reddish brown with a creamy tan head. Fruity and sugar aromas. Body is sweet, fruity, and dark sugars swell with depth. Really good.
Amber color. Sweet malt aromas, vanilla, fruit and caramel. Heavy sweet taste, alcohol, caramel, yeast and some spices. Long, large finish, with sweet flavors and alcohol.

0.33 bottle. Pours hazy copper color with medium, mostly lasting white head. Medium body, large particles. Lively carbonation. Aroma of malt, candies, vanilla, banana, alcohol. Flavor is light to medium sweet, medium bitter, with warm alcoholic notes. Finish is long and bittersweet, alcoholic.
Uit de fles geschonken. Mooi bijna robijnrood bier. Een moutig, zoet, caramel, gedroogd fruit bier in smaak en geur. Een heerlijke quadrupel. Geen topper, wel heel lekker.
Pours orangey Amber with decent white head. Really full bodied and full of flavour. Sweet barley malt, toasted barley, brown sugar. Lovely

Quadrupel is La Trappes heaviest ale with a stunning amber colour. Its warm and intense flavour is rich and finely balanced. Malty sweet, slightly burnt, and pleasantly bitter with a sweet aftertaste. Quadrupel continues to ferment after bottling and offers aromas of banana, almond, vanilla and others.
UPDATED: DEC 21, 2016 Ładny bursztynowy kolor. Gęsta, drobna piana. Mocny i wyraźny aromat. Alkohol dobrze ukryty. Genianle piwo. Jedno z moich ulubionych.

Yeasty and bready aroma with definite hints of raisin and dark fruits. Dark amber/ ruby in colour which is clear with a small off-white head with good retention and lovely lacing in glass as it was being drunk. Taste is dominated by raisins, dark fruit and black treacle with a small kick of alcohol mainly sweet with a hint of bitterness, definite toffee aftertaste. Mouthfeel is full but not as full as many quadrupels very smooth in texture, soft carbonation with a long finish. Lovely beer, not the best quadrupel, but it clearly has very stiff competition. (Served from 330ml bottle into Trappist glass.)

Amberkleurig bier met kleine witte romige schuimkraag. Zoetig, karamel, kandijsuiker, wat alcoholisch, ietwat fruitig, banaan, een vleugje marsepein en gist. Smaak: Zoet, gistkarakter, dadel, peren en een heel klein bittertje. Warm alcoholisch mondgevoel. Volle body en lichte koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: zoetig.

Bouteille 33 cl - couleur orange foncée, mousse blanche qui ne tient pas, odeur fruité sur la banane et les fruits jaunes, goût sur les fruits, les céréales, un pointe de sucre, très douce, amertume quasi nulle, finale sur lalcool sans être dans lexcés malgré les 10 degrés

Nice head.good rich body. Dark Amber in appearance. Slightly phenolic but good for 10%

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
amberkleurig alcoholisch suikerwater,brandy duidelijk te jong ontpopt een oudere exemplaar.zou meer smaak lagen afgeven hopelijk meer van de amandel en vanille en minder banaan
Très bon. Légèrement amer. Un peu épicé. Légère pour son taux dalcool. Arrière goût plutôt léger. Par contre bonne longueur.

0,33l bottle. Hazy (yeast drops) dark copper colour with quickly disappearing small off-white head. Aroma: Fruity, banana, flowers, a bit caramel, candy sugar, very strong and intense. Taste: Sweet malty start, a lots of yeast in the taste. Light bitter mouthfeel too and has a dessert like feel. Oily texture. Very warming feel. Different from the other quads, I think becouse of the amount of yeast that used in the brewing process. I can feel the alcohol in this one more than the other quads. Full bodied with medium/soft carbonation. Well balanced pleasent bitter/sweet/sour finish, Very good quad, but a little bit different.

Aromat: Mocna podbudowa słodowa - nuty miodu, winne, dojrzałych ciemnych owoców i delikatnie przypraw.
Wygląd: Brąz, mętne, piana średnio i drodnopęcherzykowa.
Smak: Analogicznie do aromatu, wybijająca słodycz wraz z dojrzałymi czerwonymi owocami. Całość dekoruje bardzo dobrze ukryty alkohol i posmak owocowo-korzenny. Słowem - bardzo dobry przedstawiciel stylu w kategorii jakość>cena.
sabor cálido e intenso es rica y bien equilibrada. Malta dulce, ligeramente quemado, amargo con un regusto dubte. Aromas de plátano, almendras, vainilla y toros.
Mély borostyán színű, fűszeres illatú. Nagyon fűszeres, nagyon komlós. Közepesen kesernyés, testes sör. Érezni, hogy erős, de nem mondanám meg hogy 10 százalékos.

Leżakowane, data do 04.2016. Ciemno-miedziane, piana średnia, przechodzi w drobną, trwała. Lekki gushing podrywa wszystkie osady z dna butelki, więc piwo jest pełne drobinek. Aromat suszonych i czerwonych owoców i cherry. Smak to niesamowita owocowość, jak w aromacie, spora słodowość oraz nuty miodowe. Szybko rozgrzewające, średnio nasycone.

Bottle @ Citadelle. Deep Amber pour with a small head. Nose is has plenty of candied dark fruits - plums, red apple, cherry. A bit of marzipan. Mild spice. glazed donut. Flavor is fairy sweet. Spice and a somewhat hot finish keep things from feeling flabby. Some banana flambee. Prune. Expressive yeast. Big profile. Moderately strong carb.

Quadrupel er La Trappe tungeste ale med en fantastisk ravfarve. Dens varm og intens smag er rig og velafbalanceret. Maltet søde, brændt lidt, og behagelig bitter med en sød eftersmag. Quadrupel fortsætter med at gære efter aftapning og tilbyder aroma af banan, mandler og vanille

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
caramel, bread, cereal, alcohol, banana, licorice, raisin, red, clear, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, sticky, lively,

Bottle into tulip glass. Just too strong on the alcohol to be great, but still good. Very well carbonated, and malty / sweet rather than bitter. However the alcohol content comes through with a bit of a burn. Might appreciate more if I was bitterly cold and needed something to warm me through.

75 cl. best before 10/2016, aperta il 7 maggio 2016.
Rosso rubino con riflessi ramati, schiuma beige di media persistenza.
Aroma di chiodi di garofano, uva passa, prugna e leggera banana matura.
Al palato stesse componenti, in aggiunta leggera amarena, finale erbaceo arricchito da una punta di cacao amaro.
Corpo medio-pieno, mediamente carbonata, bottiglia che inizia a sentire il peso dei suoi anni.

Butelka 0,75l. Barwa ciemnobursztynowa, zamglona, piana gruba, drobnopęcherzykowa, trzyma się bardzo długo, znakomity lacing. W aromacie słodko, przyprawowo, charakterystycznie dla belgów, w tle jakby trochę bananów i może minimalnie trawy od chmielu. W smaku minimalnie gorzej: nadal jest solidnie słodowo, trochę przypraw jak na klasztorniaka przystało, w tle banany. jednak po przełknięciu pojawia się gryzący posmak alkoholu, jest on dość mocno wyczuwalny. Piwo jak na quada jest stosunkowo wytrawne i odrobinę puste, trochę za bardzo czuć alkohol. Ale jednak bardzo przyjemnie rozgrzewa i pije się je z (umiarkowaną) przyjemnością.

Bottle from Maakun, many thanks! Pours clear amber with lasting, small, creamy white head. Aroma of caramel, raisins, berries and yeast. Taste is sweetish with nuts, caramel, raisins, dates, yeast and light banana. Hides ABV quite well. Nice one!

Pours a pale golden with a medium white head. Aroma is bananas and coriander. Taste is classic Quad. Theres banana and clove, along with very sweet pale malt (almost cloying). Some bread dough comes through as well, along with some mild sourness. ABV is there, but only as warmth after the swallow. No phenols detected. Smooth and nice, but a real sipper, primarily because of the sweetness rather than the alcohol.

Generalnie rzecz biorac, piwo jedno z lepszych w swoim stylu. Aromat ciekawy, na poczatku dosc intensywny, slodkawy. Wysycenie ?rednie do wysokiego, w smaku pierwsze skrzypce gra cos a la guma balonowa, przy pierwszych lykach alkohol dobrze zamaskowany, z czasem wychodzi na wierzch (10% w koncu). Dosc wodniste i jednolite smakowo. Niestety nie moj styl, raczej wracac nie bede.

330ml bottle: Pours a clear amber with sediment. Small off white head. Smells of stone fruits and caramel. Sweet, alcohol warmth, hints of prune and a slight breadiness in taste. Big bodied with light carbonation. Overall a big beer thats packed with flavour.
Nut brown color with foam layer. The nose is alcoholic with banana. The taste is mild, creamy and has an alcoholic banana finish. Quite strong, yet mild aftertaste.
Bière de couleur ambrée. Une très bonne bière belge, avec un fort taux dalcool qui ne gêne pas la dégustation au contraire...
Bottle. Aroma is almonds, yeast, apple, Taste is very fruity, berries,, sweet, light roast and lots of yeast.

On tap at pastoral. Really nice looking, graham cracker color. Not a ton of head. Aroma is deep and difficult to pin down. Taste is excellent. Great Belgian quad all in all. The alcohol is totally hidden. Would definitely recommend.

Amber with a thick head. Sweet with some vanilla and light malt. Strong beer with some alcohol burning. Good strong ale 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 Cobre escura, límpida. Espuma bege clara, média de média duração, fina. Aroma muito intenso. Frutada com notas de ameixa, frutas secas, caramelo e melado. Sabor doce com final seco. Levemente ácida. Bem alcoólica.

750 ml bottle. Amber color, rich off-white head. Sweet aroma with raisins and creamy notes. Complex flavor with caramel, apple peel, stewed plums, some almond. Very full body, medium-high carbonation. A fine example of the style that would pair wonderfully with many different foods. 1500th rating!

Aromat intensywny, słodki, owoce, głównie śliwki, karmel, toffi, przyprawy, alkohol. Kolor ciemnobursztynowy, mętne. Piana kremowa, obfita, gęsta, średnio trwała, ładnie zdobi szkło. W smaku słodkie, pełne, owoce (maliny, wiśnie), suszone śliwki, rodzynki, karmel, przyprawy, nuty drożdżowe, rozgrzewający alkohol. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie średnie.
A bit too sweet for my taste but def a great trappist for starters. Full body. High alcohol %. Heartwarming! Excellent choice if you are used to drink Heineken ;-)

Flaska bishops Örebro. Bärnstensfärgad vätska. Gulbeiget skum. Fyllig doft av torkad frukt, äpple och örter. Lätt söt smak med fin komplexitet. Rostad toner tillsammans med mogna frukter. Äpple, russin och lite knäck.
Perhaps, one of my favorite Belgium beers. Nice strong alcohol taste, while still fruity and malty. Not so bitter. Perfect
One of my all time favourites. A lovely strong earning beer. An off white head which lasts and poppy on the tongue
How : tap Appearance : clear amber with a small white head. Aroma : dried fruits, grapes, cherry, caramel, grass and some honey. Palate : full body, soft carbonation.

Shared 11.2 oz. bottle. Pours amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet with caramel and dark fruits. Flavors include caramel, plum, cherry, nuts, yeast, alcohol, and brown sugar. Finishes a bit sweet, but overall, its very nice.

Aroma: extremely sweet and malty; Appearance: hazy, dark amber pour with fluffy white head that dissipates slowly; Taste: honey sweet with some underlying booze; some banana as well; Palate: medium-heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: can appreciate it, but way too sweet for my taste.
Pours clear orange with mild head. Aroma contains some alcohol, caramel, dried apricot, fruits, some cinnamon. Taste has more caramel, cinnamon, alcohol, dried fruits. Very good beer!

Bottle @ home
Copper with suspencious, orange cream
Rich winey raisins, dry pears, raw sugar, roasted caramel
Complex winey, passito, butterscotch, cognac, almonds

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2016 Gedronken van de tap en die viel me erg tegen. Het bier is te zoet maar heeft niet een hoppige tegenhanger, waardoor je toch net een soort limonade zit te drinken. Jammer, gemiste kans.

Cor cobre avermelhada para âmbar, espuma densa com um dedo de altura bem carbonatada.

Aroma adocicado caramelizado, frutado como frutas cristalizadas e panetone. Sabor equilibrado, mas adocicado e com açúcar no final. Picancia e cócegas na boca, provável do álcool. Encorpada mas com álcool aparente sem comprometer o conjunto. O lúpulo só demarca o amargor. Cerveja complexa.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tomada en el Kraken.

Tostada fuerte, color opaco. Espuma blanca.
Muy aromatica.
Cerveza Quadruple al nivel de la Rochefort 10

Kolor bursztynowy, piana bardzo obfita. W aromacie rodzynki, suszone owoce i ciasteczka. W smaku jest rozgrzewające, ale alkohol ukryty. Wyraźnie ciasteczko, trochę brzoskwini i suszonych owoców, lekki karmel. Bardzo przejmne w odczuciu.
Bottle - Ruby red, small off white head. Red fruits aroma - slight ting on tongue. Strong fruity flavour - similarly alcoholic to other Belgium beers.

On tap at Cafe Sara, april 24th 2015. Brown body with a big offwhite head. Aroma is nutty with dark fruit, caramel, banana. Lovely yeast esters in taste, blend of spices, herbs, sweetness, creamy taste with light alcohol notes and a fruity and malty finish.
My favorite beer!!! Tastes like candy and caramel toffee, nice head, aroma and all the other stuff, 10/10 doktors would reccomend

.33l bottle from Firmabier.
Pours cloudy amber with medium, creamish head. Aroma is banana, belgian yeast, floral, malts, bread notes, caramel, alcohol. Well balanced flavor is mostly same. Nice soft, creamy and sweetish palate with some bitternes. Swell!

Sample on tap @ Vintage Estates. Pours a light caramel color with a thin white ring. Aroma is sweet and tart. Flavors is similar with a touch of caramel. Fairly smooth and enjoyable. Hides the alcohol well. Nice balance.

Wow! Grest texture, taste like caramel, alcohol and sugar.

Will buy it again!
Bottle @ buitenlust... medium off white head... clear dark brown colour... smell feuits dried malts yeasty banana... taste malts some yeasts some sweetness/sugar some fruits...

Bottle @ Buitenlust with Thompson. Smells quite hoppy and herby. Looks somewhat dark but consistent with a smallish foamy head. Taste is strong with herbs, some hops and a sight bit of sweet in there from dried fruit but overall well balanced. Overall, a very solid beer I?d be happy to drink more regularly.

Nice surprise for us, because the night... I love you !
Palate... but almost...
Im not satisfied by the appearance at all, nice golden look but (Lancaster, Lol) I prefer the red auburn look...
As you can read, its a very strong beer (sorry for that !)
0,33 liter fles. Thuis gedronken. Raar dat ik deze LaTrappe niet eerder getest heb. Dit is een lekkere biertje.

Bottle at home. Two year old bottle. Has a deep amber color with a huge khaki head. Sweet aroma of dried fruit, Belgian yeast, banana, almonds brown sugar, heather, paint thinner and some chocolate. The flavor follows up with more sweet tones of brown sugar, cake, dried fruit and warming alcohol in the end. Has a slick mouth feel, medium body and a light bitterness. A well-balanced and tasteful quad. A little sweet but very nice.

Dark blood orange color with a creamy cap of gorgeous golden foam. 

Rich complexity of a good quadrupel nose. Raspberries and blackberries. Raisins. It overflows with dark malt and smells almost as much like concentrated black and red raspberries as Kuhnhenn Raspberry Eisbock. 

The flavor profile also contains spiced raisins and plums swimming in dark caramel and melted chocolate bars. As it warms, I can appreciate leather and earthy hops. Its definitely on the sweet side of things, but I wouldnt change a thing. 

Its double digit ABV so there is a hint of alcohol on the nose.

My favorite is its mouthfeel. Its liquid velvet and very silky. Probably the best mouthfeel of the beers Ive had

Bouteille. Nez malté (caramel toffee sucré), assez fruité (raisins, bananes, prunes, poires ), sucré (gomme balloune, caramel doux), légèrement épicé (clou de girofle) et assez alcoolisé. Ronde en bouche. Goût fruité (raisins, prunes et très léger de bananes et de cerises noires) présent tout le long de la gorgée auxquels se rajoute dun goût malté (caramel toffee sucré), de levure (gomme balloune) et épicé (clou de girofle et très léger de poivre) et finalement suivi dune chaleur dalcool assez présente. Arrière-goût comprenant une légère aigreur fruitée (prune, raisin) et une légère amertume dalcool. [notes 2005]

0,33l bottle, at BeAbout Bratislava, Pours cloudy amber reddish colour, small creamy white head, fell down quickly, Aroma: candied fruits, raisins, cane sugar, Taste: medium to heavy sweet, light to medium bitter, light to medium sour, candied fruits, raisins, Pslate: medium to full body average carbonation, slick mouthfeel long sweet aftertaste, Overall: enjoyed, fine.
One of my favourite beers. I like very much its complexity and rich taste and aroma.
Cerveja cor caramelo. Aroma doce, frutado e alcoólico, com sabor seguindo a mesma lógica.

Cant believe I havent rated this! Best of an average selection at the local bottle O. Plays to expectations, a classic heavy weight with strong sugary fruits and astringency / burn from the alcohol. Lacks a little finess - quite early and then the alcohol kicks hard late, but no doubting a traditional effort.
Deep amber with a big fluffy head. Masses of fruity esters, bread, bubblegum, banana. Literally bursting with great Belgian flavours. Really good.

Un clásico que crea estilo: tiene las características de una gran cuadruple. En nariz huele a lupulo y maltas belgas, caramelo y alcohol. Cuerpo carbonatado. Sabor a caramelo y regaliz alcohol fuerte pero agradable. Imprescindible en su estilo.

33cl bottle on 24-Feb-2016, poured into a long stemmed tulip glass. Hazy amber with a large white head. Aroma of sweet fruit, spices and hops. Medium body and fine carbonation. Sweet fruity taste, some banana and caramel with Belgian yeast, spices and malt. Light bitterness with a hoppy spicy finish. Nice rapist able from NL.

Probada en botella de 33 cl. Rojiza opaca, con leve espuma blanca. Cerveza fuerte, algo dulce, con cuerpo medio. El dejo en el paladar es exquisito. Para disfrutar.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Trappist glass. Deep ruby, cloudy with light brown small head. Heavy malty, caramel notes. Fruity, dark fruits and rasins aroma, also some bananas and plums. Taste is sweet, heavy malty with almost no bitterness. Medium to full body, thick texture, average carbonation, finish is malty and sweet. Medium alcohol warming. In overall solid, balanced, malty and heavy beer.
Light nut brown color with a tall tan slightly rocky head. hints of prunes and dark caramel syrup. Slight orange hoppiness. Dry and warm finish with a touch of coriander.,
Tap at bulldog ne. 10oz tulip. Cloudy Ruby with thick white head and good lacing. Yeasty funk nose. Soft, sugar, yeast. Very pleasant. Such a good beer.
330ml bottle. Sparkling amber in colour with a fine white head. Combined aroma of banana, citrus tones, and slight wet grass. Cinnamon is present in the flavour, along with sugary haylage.
Aroma of prunes, raspberries, bananas, caramel and a bit of alcohol. Taste is sweet, with warming alcohol and almost no bitterness. Very good
Pretty sweet belgian strong ale. Maybe a little bit too light in body and a bit too carbonated. Anyway, it fits its role.

Pours slightly cloudy, dark amber into my LaTrappe glass. Thin head (2mm) which disappears within a minute. Aroma reasonably subtle, smells alcohol/ester. First hit to the palate is the ester and yeast, heavy on the burnt malt, followed by gentle bitterness. A bit sugar syrupy. Quite boozy, but then again, its what youd expect at 10%.
Bought at Dan Murphys, $23AUD a 4pk. Great value. Not as good as Chimay Grand reserve though for about three same $
DEFINITELY wait till it warms up to 10 - 14°, so worth it!
A dark ruby red beer with a large white head of foam. It has a spicy toffee and red cherry fruity flavour with sweet currants and spices on the smooth well carbonated finish. Excellent!

Bottle from Cash Flandre Artois, Auchy-les-Mines - FR. Color: clear golden amber beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: caramel and malt domination. Really sweet notes and floral. Banana notes and ethanol presence. Taste: full body with caramel malt. Really sweet with ethanol taste. Good attenuation. Banana finish. Astringent, alcohol. Aftertaste: fruity and candied notes. Sweet caramel. Toffee and finish. Banana notes.

Butelka 750ml z datą ważności 02.2018, temperatura degustacji 14 stopni +, szkło snifter. Aromat: aromat jest złożony, słodka delikatnie karmelowa słodowość łączy się z charakterystycznymi belgijskimi estrami (ciemne suszone owoce - śliwka, figi, rodzynki), trochę kwiatowych nut i alkohol ale przyjemny który podkreśla moc piwa, fenole na bardzo niskim poziomie. Barwa: głęboki bursztyn, delikatnie przymglone co akurat jest dopuszczalne w stylu. Piana: biało-żółtawa, obfita, zbudowana z drobnych i średnich pęcherzyków, średnio trwała, opada do cienkiego pierścienia. Smak: podobny do aromatu słodkie ciemne owoce, finisz wytrawny, goryczka ziołowo-pieprzowa, rozgrzewający alkohol. Pełnia średnia, wysycenie średnie do wysokiego. Dobre, mocne, degustacje piwo na zimowe wieczory.

Bottle from Cork & Cask. Hazy orange body with a thin white head. No visible carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of orange, pear drops, apricot and white sugar. Flavour of marzipan, yeast, banana and coriander. Medium body with a spritzy mouthfeel. Lively fizz. Quite sweet, but a tasty beer indeed.

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co., and snifter served displaying a coppery amber color. with a fingers width of soft white head foam that reduced to a persistent ring & film, and showed some wavy cling to the lacing. The nose was sweet, with dried esters as pit fruit & cherry, and a hint of vanilla. The taste was similar, with the vanilla a bit more evident, medium bodied, and lively enough effervescence to project the aforementioned flavor notes, plus an earthy bitterness and some tart astringency. The alcohol was warming, but not boozy, and the texture was non sticky/syrupy. An enjoyable, well balanced Quad.
Bottle from Appellation Wines. Rich amber colour with a creamy head. Aromas of raisin, banana, vanilla and caramel. More sweet flavours on the palate, overall very rich yet nicely balanced.

Pours dark orange towards amber with a rocky white head that lasts. Really beautiful colour. The aroma contains banana, caramel, nuts, vanilla, some other fruits. Tastes medium sweet and light bittersweet in the finish. Stunning palate, nice carbonation, full body, warming alcohol but doesnt taste that boozy. Excellent.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2016 Malt, fruity, yeast aroma. Dark amber color with a beautiful white head. Taste is fairly caramel sweet and fruity sensation, strong alcohol notes, together with slight bitterness. Medium to full body, creamy and slick texture. Very good quadrupel.

Aroma: Sterke geur, verf, banaan
Appearance: Mooie roodbruine kleur, schuim snel dood
Taste: Redelijke smaak
Palate: Prikkelend in de mond
Overall: Niet al te enthousiast

Tap. Monk, Brussels. Clear, dark orange Amber. Thin, lasting, white head. Aroma of almond. Sweet, boozy fruit. Candied peel. Chewy malt. Taste is sweet, and rich. Some vine fruit dryness. Smooth, rich, full mouthfeel. Finishes sweet, and dries a little on the close. Pretty easy drinking at the ABV.
UPDATED: MAR 11, 2016 amber, full body, long finish. A quality beer and probably the best version of the la trappe beers. Hard to believe you can get this kind of quality in your local grocery store.

bardziej przypomina miód pitny od piwa
na końcu pozostaje bardzo mocny smak alkoholu
barwa o jeden odcień jaśniejsza od bursztynu
dominuje banan, a gdzieś podobno kryje się migdał
goryczka bardzo delikatna, wręcz niewyczuwalna
piana niezbyt obfita
Dark amber cloudy appearance. Pleasant aroma. Consistent flavour, with no real aftertaste. Smooth tasting.

Hazy amber coloured beer with a big, medium-lasting, creme-coloured head. Aromas of white wine, caramel, yeast, almond, orange peel, some alcohol and some floweriness. Sweet malty, wheaty in taste with a bit of bitter almond and orange lemonade. Late ripe banana in finish together with warming alcohol. Heavy body, fizzy carbonation, creamy texture. Less round than other trappists i know.
A dark, complex and full bodied quadrupel. It has nice sweet and bitter tones, that go on in the aftertaste.
Bottle. Aroma is almonds, yeast, apple, dough. Taste is very fruity, berries, strawberry, sweet, light roast. Lots of yeast. Good stuff

Aroma of candy sugar, figs, clove, Belgian yeasty banana and a bit boozy. Taste is the same. Slight candy sugar sweet but not overly sweet. Fig dates and raisin flavors. Doesnt taste too boozy. Well done quad. Not too sweet and not too malty for a quad. Good balance. Solid beer and really good but nothing I can say bad about it, but also something missing that keeps me from thinking it is great. Prefer st bernardus, but this is still very a very solid quad. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nez peu riche, aromes dalcool et de raisins je distingue un arome de banane . Belle couleur ambrée. La mousse tient assez longuement. 
En bouche, la bière est un peu liquoreuse, assez proche du vin à nouveau. Elle est finement amère, avec de de gout de malt et un gout de pomme.
La touche finale est persistante et peu amère mais agréable

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2016 Belle couleur orange originale, mousse abondante retombant lentement, arômes subtils (raisin etc). En bouche, cette bière donne une impression de "plénitude", très équilibrée et pleine dautres choses que je ne sais pas exprimer. Mais je trouve cette quadruple vraiment digne dune trappiste dans les meilleures belges ! :-)

En fût : Couleur: orange clair
Arômes pharmaceutiques peut-être léther?, caramel en première impression.
Très rond en bouche, moelleux, très belle mousse un peu épaisse
Goût de caramel et de chocolat noir, très houblonné
Seulement 4/5 pour le fût ! :-(
Para mi gusto el gusto a regaliz inunda en conjunto de esta cerveza. Demasiado caracteristico dicho sabor.

30 cl bottle, served in trappist chalice. Poured dark amber with a one finger white head. Aromas of banana, vanilla, raisins, citrus. Tastes of again a lot of banana, then vanilla, orange, cloves, raisins, citrus, hops, alcohol, caramel. A medium body and bittersweet finish. Overall a pretty good, sweet tasting quadrupel.
Strong, caramel, coffee, nuts, roasty, alcohol, smoke flavor. Sweetness, thickness and heat are present in this flavor, great beer
Bottle from ODonovans. Slightly opaque orange-amber. Sweet fruit with caramel. Flavour is nicely dry for the %. Nice yeast with sweetness.

Pours a cloudy medium dark orange with a relatively thin, off-white lingering head. Plum nose, though light aroma. Very heavy plum flavor, and very sweet overall. Extremely effervescent mouthfeel, like its trying ot jump out of my mouth. Closes with a hint of burnt toast and a nice bitterness.
Fles, thuis. Zoete bak mild gekruide bananenschuimpjes. Erg alcoholisch, kartonnen nasmaak. Backlog from 2015/09/06.

Bottle (759 ml). Pours amber with off-white head and lacing. White raisin aroma. Plum and white raisin upfront. Alcohol and candied sugar follows. Some bitterness, more raisin, and warming alcohol in the long finish. Lighter body than expected. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Reddish orange beer with nice head on top and lacing too. Aroma has fruity notes, Belgian yeast, sweet malts also. Taste is quite fruity for a quad, some malty sweetness, a bit of wine like flavours. Full body and high carbonation.
Pours a lovely Amber colour with a off white frothy head, unfortunately the head doesnt last very long. Strong ale with a nice malty flavour. A really enjoyable glass of beer. Highly recommended.

Butelka. Barwa brunatna, lekko mętna. Piana biała, wysoka, opadająca do niewielkiej warstwy. W aromacie owoce, drożdże, przypieczony chleb, tost.
W smaku bardzo złożone. Wszystkie smaki wspaniale ze sobą współgrają. Goryczka średnia do wysokiej niezalegająca. Wysycenie wysokie, być może troszkę za wysokie, które powoduje, że piwo nie jest maksymalnie pijalnie. Alkohol świetnie ukryty, lekko rozgrzewający. Piwo charakteryzuje się bogatym smakiem, intensywnymi aromatami chlebowo-owocowymi. Jest gęste, pełne, treściwe. Klasa!

On tap at Bulldog NE. Beautiful copper and amber color with strong lacing in the form of an off white head. Dark fruit and sugary quality on the nose. Slight medicinal note. Taste is big and powerful with healthy prune characteristics. Alcohol warmth. Sugars and malt play well throughout consumption. Smooth and wonderful. You can tell this Belgian brewery knows what theyre doing.

750ml bottle shared by "homeless chic" Dave. Pours orange brown with a big light beige head. Aroma is clove, banana and caramel. Flavor follows, clove, banana, honey, caramel. A nicely balanced quad that finishes dry and hides the abv well.

8-12-2015 Delft de Waag

Kan niet tippen aan vergelijkbare bieren zoals St. Bernardus maar het blijft gewoon een lekker bier. Lekker prikkelend in de mond. Smaakt zoet en naar caramel en heeft een lekkere licht bittere nasmaak.
750ml->goblet. Murky orange-gold with small offwhite head. Dark fruit, yeast, caramel, sugar. Standard quad character, very good.

Mooie quadrupel die niet te koud gedronken moet worden. Veel graan en caramel.
