medium brown pour, fine off white head. Nose is bananas, yeast, malted grain. On the sweet side. Middle is banana, amber grain, soft stone fruit. Finish is soft and soothing. ABV very well blended. Great beer.

BBE date was may 2014. Pours lovely dark amber colored with a longlasting fine-pored, off-white head. Aroma has lots of fruits, apple, caramel, candy sugar. UPDATED: NOV 15, 2015 Aromas of green apples, honey, and alcohol. Taste is green apples, honey, dark bread, and a touch of caramel.

Bottle. Light amber colored with copper hue with a creamy tan head. Fruity nose with notes of plum and grapes and a malty aroma. There is already a strong peppery alcoholic presence here. Sweet flavor and with a light bitter dry finish. Complex in the mouth with fruity notes of banana and plum, yeast and a hint of spices with clove, pepper and some vanilla. Thick body with low carbonation causes a nice creamy mouthfeel within a pleasent alcoholic warmth. Light sweet fruity aftertaste.
Dark amber with beige head. Caramel, bread, yeast, floral and cherries. Sweet, thick, chocolate, dry and floral finish. Overall: Enjoyable.

Pours a thick white to beige head with light hops aromas. Clear Amber body. Quite Thick and warm and very long in mouth with balanced bitterness and carbonation. A good match with white creamed poultry or veal.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2015 Pours hazy muddy dark amber with surprisingly little topping. Mild esters and caramel on the nose. Flavor is rich with ripe fruit, sweet malt, and distinct banana. Best Ive had since Rochefort 10. Love this style, and this nails it.

33 cl bottle. Hazy, dark amber, thin off-white to tan head. Aroma is complex, Its sweet, bubble-gum, plum, syrup and alcohol. Mouthfeel is low carbonation, oily, a bit sour and dry. Flavour is, again, really complex with a lot of different notes to it. In some way, its a little "over the top" for an average beer rater like myself. Aroma: Sweet, toast, caramel, plum, raisins, fanny, quince, cherry, molasses, very pleasant, intensive. Appearance: Color is copper, head is dense, white, quiclky dissapears, seeable sparkling. Taste: Very sweet, some light phenolic notes, banana, caramel, quince, cherry, caramel, alcohol hidden, delicate clove, hint of herbal hoppiness. The finish should be more dry, also it is too much carbonated and generally it is so sweet that the sweetnes is floating out of my ears.

the aroma is fruity, caramel and spicy with hints of vanilla, toffee, candy and red wine... the taste is caramel and fruity with notes of port, dried banana, toffee, bisquit and nuts... sweet, dry and warming aftertaste...

Average, creamy, white, mostly diminishing head, good lacing. Flat, light amber body. Heavy malty aroma, with notes of cookie, straw, nutty and molasses. Heavy sweet, moderate bitter and light acidic initial flavor. Long, heavy sweet, moderate bitter and light acidic finish. Full body. Creamy texture. Soft carbonation. 75 cl, bottled. BB 06-2018. Pours clear quite bright red with a decent white head. Amazing lacing. Aroma: Banana, canned sweet fruits, peach, pear. Some notes of spices, cloves. Palate: Medium body, feels slightly dry. Sweet aftertaste, dried figs. Interesting quadrupel.
Dried plum aroma, sweet. Very little alcohol warmness, but clearly felt. Made me feel extremely comfortable and nice

Aromat bananów, fenoli, karmelowy, słodki. Piwo bursztynowe, opalizujące ze słabą pianą pozostawiajaca mała warstewske. Une bière orangée translucide à la mousse éphémère.Des arômes d"oranges trempées dans de lalcool, ou plutôt de lalcool aromatisé à lorange. Pours clear chestnut brown, highly carbonated with two-finger white head. Aroma of dark toffee, molasses, strawberry, some hop floral or earthy notes. 0.3 l bottle from local Albert Heijn, bottled in december 2014. Clear, reddish amber with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Sweetish, fruity-malty aroma of prunes, raisins, ripe banana, gingerbread, cane sugar, dried dates and maybe a bit of glue. Sweetish, fruity-malty aroma of prunes, raisins, dried dates, ripe banana, gingerbread, cane sugar and hints of licorice, followed by a long, medium bitter, slightly alcoholic and warming finish. Medium to full body, slightly effervescent and creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation. Nicely balanced quad with some hop bite in the end. Still almost unimaginable to see such a beer in a German supermarket whereas it is available in Holland around every corner and for just a bit more than one euro per bottle.

Bottle in the Magnolia Beer Cafe, Keswick. Hazy amber with a thin off white head. The aroma is sweet with peach and caramel. The taste is fruity with plenty of spice along with notes of peach, orange peel, caramel, tea, toffee, liquorice and raisin. Nice.

Dégustée en compagnie de Mademoiselle Irina et Marco devant la présentation extérieure du Cercle Rouge. Magnifique robe translucide de couleur prune à la mousse caramel, dense, généreuse et collante au verre jusquà la fin des temps! Le service nest même pas entamé que de puissantes arômes de figue, pruneaux, raisins et dattes emplissent lair ambiant! Cest sucré, rond, chaud, alcoolisé... Quiconque est un amateur du style sy retrouve immédiatement! Le concert se poursuit en bouche et contrairement aux autres quadrupel trappistes, sans cette Signature Belge dans la levure qui fait de La Trappe une quadrupel si différente de ses consoeurs. De la pelure de raisins, encore des pruneaux et de ces magnifiques fruits à la chair moelleuse et même fibreuse. Cest ample, très sucré et long en bouche. Lalcool nest pas dissimulé et sa présence se conjugue parfaitement à tout le reste. Une Grande Trappiste!

Contrairement à une Bush, je trouve largement plus dintérêt dans cette bière.
Magnifique robe ambrée aux reflets rouges.
Le nez rend pas mal dalcool (moins évidemment si on la laisse saerer ce qui est indispensable) mais amène rapidement de franches notes caramelisées et de pomme !
La bouche ne nous fait pas mentir : on retrouve un corps rond, de belles notes de pommes sans finalement que lalcool ne lemporte trop et finisse par écoeurer.

Bottle from dan murphys holland park, poured into a Trappist glass, aromas of banana, fresh bread and vanilla, this beer looks amazing in a glass, definitely a sipper, every sip is rich and satisfying

It hide the spices, the fruity flavours are still present. Long warm sweet finish with fruity notes. Full body and medium carbo. Quite good but the alcohol is hiding most of the complexity.

Espuma blanquecina qye se va disipando y se mantiene como una fina corona, color ámbar tirando a chocolate, se percibe a simple vista la gasificación constante de las burbujas, rico aroma en nariz, sabor que se va potenciando paulatinamente muy sabroso, final dulce regusto permanente, los 10º no matan el sabor para nada, eso si, para tomar con tranquilidad
From tap. Dark amber copper color with off white head. Malty and yeasty aroma, dark fruits, light wineous, light bready. Heavy sweet taste, caramel and fruity. Medium oily body with soft carbonation

Utterly delicious. Unlike most quads, this is not dark brown, but essentially a red/orange color - lovely. This taste is just lovely although subdued. No strong flavors one way or the other, but thats just fine as far as Im concerned. I would all the flavors banana+raspberry, and extremely subtle spice and very subtle vinous. I slept on this quad a little. I had it about 3 years ago, not thinking much about it, one way or the other, but this is exceptional in its subtlety. I would rate this slightly ahead of St. Bernardus abt 12, but just a hint behind the Rochefort quad. For the record I had a bomber dated B15 and side by side a regular size bottle dated K13. So the bottle was about a year and a half old. I would say this beer aged a year is a little better than when it is fresh. I would love to have about 5 or 6 versions of this beer aged according to 6 month intervals. Regardless, this is excellent. This beer does not get the respect it deserves. Its better than St. Bernardus by a hair - more subtle.
Clear dark amber, thick white froth. Malty aroma with notes of dried fruit and alcohol. Flavour has figs, dark sugar, caramel and alcohol warmth. Not overly complex but effective.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2015 Aromat: słodki, brzoskwinie, karmel, tosty, suszone owoce i dojrzały banan. Lekko przyprawowe.
Wygląd: barwa rubinowa, piana średnio obfita, ale ładnie oblepia szkło.
Smak: słodycz w postaci brzoskwiń, karmelu i tostów, banany i suszone owoce są na drugim planie. Występuje również średnia goryczka oraz delikatna alkoholowość.
Odczucie w ustach: piwo ma trochę treściwości, ale na pewno nie jest gęste ani likierowe, niskie nasycenie.
Ogólne wrażenie: smaczne piwo, mocno aromtyczne oraz z bogatym smakiem. Raczej degustacjne.

750ml bottle, from Dutchs. Hazy orange amber color. Thin ring and web of off-white head. Leaves some loose bits of lace. Great, big complex malty quad flavor. Banana, vanilla for sure. Mild spice. Caramel. Medium to bigger body. Good full feel. Creamy. Lighter carbonation. Light slick. Smooth, for sure. Easy to sip at. Moderate sweet taste, light bitter. Very mild alcohol warmth, its pretty well-hidden overall. Satisfying quad, but not exemplary. Lacks the complexity of my favorite examples. Bit more on the pale side too. An amber-quad.

In continuation with my All Things Belgian (That Dont Actually Come from Belgium) theme is Hollands La Trappe Quadrupel. This ale surprised me. Im used to having Quads that are decadent and big on grain sugars. La Trappes Quad is a new beast. Yes, its full and fruity, but with a balance that doesnt often show up in these warm and heavy beers. Body is brownish red and fairly lively. This brew doesnt keep a head like some of the unreasonably foamy Trappist ales, but the suds propel plenty of smells: champagne-like yeast, prune, plum, vinous and juicy grape, and rich malt. Flavor follows nose. You also get banana, toasted sugar, apple, and pear.Despite the sophisticated flavors, you wouldnt necessarily guess La Trappes Quad packs 10% ABV. While its got lots of class, this Quadrupel probably wont make you feel like youve been primed for hibernation. Depending on what kind of Belgian preferences you have, youll either like that or be turned off. Least you can do for yourself is to give it a try.

Graduación: 10º
Aspecto: De color granate con tono oscuro, traslúcida y algo turbia. La espuma es amplia y porosa, dejando rastro tras de sí en cada sorbo. Se aprecia que se trata de una cerveza con notable carbonatación.
Aroma: Al igual que sus hermanas se trata de una cerveza afrutada (manzanas?), con aromas a malta y levadura. Se aprecia claramente un aroma subyacente a madera, dándole un matiz avinado, también identificable en el gusto, debido a que esta cerveza madura en barrica de roble, por lo que adquiere características propias de las bebidas envejecidas de este modo.
Sabor: Se aprecia rápidamente de que se trata de una cerveza con mucho cuerpo, densa, maltosa, con un sabor muy afrutado y dulce, en logrado equilibrio con el amargor. La alta graduación alcohólica se hace notar, como en el caso de sus hermanas, marcando el carácter de la cerveza, que en este caso es algo avinada como las Barley Wine.
UPDATED: MAR 13, 2016 You can smell the alcohol but its tempered with the vanilla and bready yeastiness, tastes resinous prunes pepper alcohol bread then rounded off with a sweet finish great stuff.

Fruity aroma with peach and banana, some caramel and spices are also there. Pours copper with nice white head. Taste is medium sweet, fruity with pleasure alcohol warming in throat. Overall solid quadrupel.

Bottle. Oh well, one of the classic Ive grow up with. Pours in dark amber body with high creamy head. Heavy visible carbonation. Aroma has nutty caramel hitting up at first, following with slight spicy and yeasty tones very characteristic to the belgian ales. Taste has medium earthy bitterness with well balanced caramel, almost toffe like, sweetness. Body is full, heavy, high carbonation. Little bit of alcohol warmness in the after taste.
Clear copper with a nice off white head. Very spicy, banana bread, burnt caramel, ripe red fruit with a slight alcohol. Sweet. Full body, thick with a soft carbonation. Long spice finish
Bottle from McHughs. Pours clearish amber. Banana, bread, clove, pepper nose. Flavour is sweet honey bread, ripe banana, Raisins. Full body, light carbonation.
well balanced heavy beer, alcohol is not overwhelming, hint of almond banana. cereal, oily feel, average carbonation,

Bottle. Pours amber, medium head withslight lacing mild retention. Nose is roasted nuts, caramel, bananas. Sweet and malty, Fruity esters continue on the palate, sweet banana and cloves linger on the palate. This is beer...

Rich orange/tan colour with a soft well laced head. The aroma is soft and sweet, malty with a light spiciness. Drinking a beer like this after indulging in too many IPAs over time is a real treat. This beer has a lovely balance of banana, brown sugar, Belgian yeast, dried fruit and bubble gum. The body is rich and a touch syrupy with a typically fine and fluffy effervescence that enhances the taste. A great beer.
Couleur ambree rougeatres avec un mince col. Aromes de fruits rouges, bananes grilles, caramel, epices,alcool. Une bonne quadrupel!

Pours amber with very thin head, slightly hazy with minimal sediment. Aroma has a lot going on, figs, almond, brown sugar, banana, a touch of peardrop boiled sweets, yeast and a touch of burnt wood.. Nice complex flavour alternating sweet and bitter, alcohol is present but well hidden. Smooth and creamy texture. I love everything about this!

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2015 Pours slight hazy and deep amber with a white lacing head. Wineous and mild fruity aroma. Creamy carbonated mouthfeel. Fruity, light wineous and heavy caramel malt flavour. Medium sweet. Finish is a complex lingering fruitiness.

Cor âmbar, brilhante. Espuma boa, bege e de média persistência. Aroma maltado e frutas secas. No paladar caramelo, frutas secas, madeira, mel e álcool. Licorosa e encorpada. Retrogosto seco remetendo a um vinho. Complexa e deliciosa!!!

Bottle at Brot & Spiele, Graz. Pours slightly hazy dark ruby-orange in a wide La Trappe glass - they have excellent glassware in this bar. Nose is sweet caramel, Belgian yeast, dark fruits, spices. Taste follows, it is sweet but nicely balanced and alcohol is well hidden - it is there though. Worked as a nice dessert.

Liquido levemente viscoso,translúcido,coloração acobreada(vinho),espuma com média formação e duração;aroma sem dúvida é o seu ponto mais forte,altamente complexo,aparecendo frutas vermelhas e cristalizadas,caramelo,malte tostado,ameixa,passas,especiarias e álcool;sabor potente,aveludado,adocicado,amadeirado com final picante e um tanto alcoólico,me lembrando vinho do porto. Cerveja de primeira,aroma um dos melhores,sabor e o conjunto pecaram um pouquinho pelo álcool bem presente,mas é para ser reverenciada.

Bottle best before 2001(14 years ago).Dark brown, almost no head. Aroma of walnut, dried figgs and some alcohol. sweet taste, dried fruits. Some tartness while warming. Dry and nutty final. Some hints of tartness in the aftertaste. Medium body, almost flat.
Fantastic aroma: fruits, almond, spices, taste is also rich, fruity, malt sweetness, spices, high carbonation, some noble alcohol on finish. Great.
aroma lot of caramel looks light brown foam looks good taste yeast caramel light body different from other quadruples but it a decent drink
Good head when pured in a glass. Nose is belgian yeast and some floral hints. Creamy mouthfeel, some alcohol and bitterness while beeing sweet in the long warming finish.

Anaranjada y algo turbia. Potente aroma a licor y naranja. En boca mucho cuerpo envuelto en un tono alcohólico bastante marcado, que envuelve matices dulces de bizcocho y frutales de naranja y melocotón. Muy potente y sabrosa,

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2015 Pours dark amber and clear with a modest offwhite head that leaves a thin lacing. Rich aroma of caramel, banana, herbs and some vanila. Full body, creamy feel, lively carbonation. Fruity taste of sweet licorice, bread, alcohol, spices and dark fruits. Long and malty finish.

Complex aromas of sweet fruit, raisin, some toffee, and candies. Deep orange color, Full tan head fades quickly. Sweet candy up front. Not off putting..rich. Hints of sweet plum, and then spices. Alcohol burn comes next, warming. FInish is a slightly peppery bitterness, mixed with an echo of the sweet fruits from before. Carbonation cuts watery texture nicely. Nice.
Good quadrupel. Intense. Rich. Finely balanced. There are notes of banana, almond, and vanilla.
Full bodied, dark and not too sweet. A beer that works great savoring its pure taste or next to a coffee or some dark chocolate for a sweet tooth.

0.33L bottle. Alcohol, banana, leather aroma. Dark amber color with medium size white foam, stays. Sticky start. Pineapple liqueur, caramel, raw banana, intensive floral taste. Alcohol with parfume mouthfeel. Not my style beer.

Gutes Quadrupel

-karamell im antrunk

-erdig,modrig
-alkohol bemerkbar aber nicht zu stark
-viel zu viel kohlensäure

gutes quad,es geht aber noch komplexer

AROMA: bananas, belgian yeast, honey, basically sweet notes - tropical fruits, raisins, maple syrup, some alcohol notes, caramel at the end

APPEARANCE: ruby color, lots of foam which disappears fast, typical thing for quads, nice oily texture, good carbonation but beer losts it fast

TASTE: awesome quad, full-bodied, thick, almost no alcohol notes in taste, bit spicy, sweet, salty, bitter - all in the same time, theres also belgian caramel. 

Veeeeery enjoyable! Ive immediately ordered another one.
Almost perfect matching of taste and aroma. Definitely a must-try!

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2016 0.33l bottle from marktkauf/edeka. pours a hazy deep amber with a dense creamy head and some lacing. nose similar to that of a wit/weizen: banana, almond, caramel, yeast, some hops even. complex flavour; herbal liqueur, caramel, almonds, prunes. quite sweet, but also slightly acidic and bitter. alcohol warmth. good carbonation, oily mouthfeel, floral finish.
Deeeeellllllliiiiiiccccciiiioooooouuuuusssssss stuff...like drinking candy....alcohol not present...dangerous......thx Brian....(#493)

Dark amber colour, nice head. In aroma raisins, honey, banana, caramel, yeast and malt. Taste is sweet caramel, banana, alcohol, nice bitterness and long balanced sweetness. Creamy mouthfeel, very good finish.

Bottle from Cornelia Pub. Smells of caramel, almond, vanilla, cola, toffee. Small white creamy head. Muddy dark brown color. Tastes sweet , spicy, caramel, aalmond, vanillla. Sweet and bitter but salty at the same time.

Pours a rich Amber with a long lasting thin head. Initial aroma of caramel and bananas(?). Initial taste of caramel slightly sweet marsh mellows with a hint of banana bread. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy
A big quad gorgeous dark amber heavy sweet brown sugar aroma. Mid to high carbonation like a champagne. A very simple yet classic trappist style ale. Alcohol very well hidden. Nice and worth a try.
Beautiful beer. Its creation reminds of good summer or autumn nights with a slight taste of perfection. Tastes may varies. Cheers!

Draft. Colored like marzipan, hazy, with a pillowy head of light tan. The aroma is brilliant and complex: banana, almond, baked bread, maple, raisin. Its sweet-smelling and beautiful. This transcendence is almost replicated in the flavor, though here theres more raisin, booze and bitterness. The candy-like sweetness is still there, playing off smooth banana notes and a background of bread crust. Body is a creamy medium with moderate, peppery carbonation. My favorite quadrupel, and its not even a contest.

Bière brune plutôt pâle, orangée-cuivrée à la lumière, bien voilée, très effervescente, et surmontée dun bon col blanc cassé, moyennement large, mais très dense, très mousseux, et très persistant. Arômes principalement desters de fermentation, beaucoup de banane, gomme balloune, et esters fruités (mangue, poire), avec également un peu dalcool et de phénols (clou de girofle et poivre, mais cest aussi un peu limite aseptisant et caoutchouc). Derrière ces effluves typiques de fermentation, on note un peu de pain grillé, ainsi que du caramel/cola et des pointes de prune et de raisin rouge. Nez correctement agréable, complexe et intense. En bouche, pétillement très élevé sur la langue, breuvage bien mousseux, onctuosité moyenne-faible sur la langue. Au goût, cest sans surprise quon retrouve la domination de la fermentation, banane mûre, gomme balloune, esters fruités, phénols épicés, alcool, levure typiquement belge. Autrement, saveurs de pain un peu grillé, léger sucré qui fait très cola, prune et raisin rouge. Amertume minimale voire inexistante, finale principalement alcoolisée, différentes saveurs tout de même assez bien intégrées les unes aux autres, bonne intensité en bouche, complexité plutôt moyenne. Très bonne bière, mais je trouve que les saveurs liées à la fermentation et la levure sont trop dominantes, je préfère les quadrupels qui mettent davantage les saveurs maltées en avant-plan.

bottle at home. amber very hazy / light cloudy color. gusher. small off-white head. smelly liqueurish, dried fruits, sweetness, plums, lightly citric, lightly alcoholic. quite nice smell. full body, quite little carbonation (probably because the beer came gushing out the bottle), full rather soft mouthfeel. tastes quite alcoholic, citric, yeasty, malty sweetness, dried fruits, plums, oranges. alcoholic / fruity finish. quite good, liked the smell a bit better than the taste. taste is a bit too alcoholic for me. overall quite good.
Bottle. Strong banana aroma. Alcohol is almost hidden. Mostly sweet taste, light bitterness. Excellent beer.
Aroma is strong bubblegum, cloves, fruity malts. Overall the strongest bubblegum Belgian that one adult male can possibly allow.

Bottle from Whole Foods High Street Kensington, London. Colouration is a reddish bright copper colour with a thin off white head. Great looking. Nose is delightfully fragrant and sweet. Sherbert, pear drop sweets, sweet barley, candy sugar, pineapple cube sweets, prune, sultana. Taste is sweet, candy sugar, prune, raisin, barley sugar, pineapple cubes, pear drops, little bit of burnt caramel. Its nice but very sweet. Sweetest Quad Ive had. Body is touch oily and bit sticky. Palate is not really sophisticated, just lots of sugary sweetness and fruity sweetness.

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, vanilla, fruit, banana and spices.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque amber/orange beer with a slight/medium off-white/beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, vanilla, fruit and banana; ends slightly dry with spices.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Really stands out from the darker quads and it is one of the best of its kind. It shares one their aspects however, it is amazingly rich for how sweet it is. Ready to be barrel-aged with its rich vanilla and fruit.

33cl bottle at home from Mitra, Maarssen. Body is clear golden amber, head is medium, tan, slightly fizzy, average lasting, good lacing. Nose is slightly liqueurish fruity, flavor is fruity, caramel, molasses, light glue, light licorice, spices, light herbs. Medium to heavy sweet, light bitter, light sour. Finish is medium lasting fruity sweet sour, light to medium hoppy bitter, medium alcohol warmth. Full body, sticky texture, lively carbonation. Not too heavy, quite sweet but not bad.
UPDATED: JUL 20, 2015 Aroma: Glue, alcohol. Taste: Complex. Hard to discribe. Fruity overall. Medium cardo and body.
Very little head but quite carbonated. Aroma is lovely, fresh, fruity. Taste is well balanced. Wouldn´t really guess the alcohol. Very drinkable beer. Definitely going to get some more.

Bottle, Wijnbar Herlingen. Reddish brown, small off-white head, vivid carbonation. Aroma bananas, vanilla, sourdough bread. Full body. Sweet banana taste.

Beers dont get much better than this. Pours amber, no real head but good lacing. Sweet malty vanilla taste. And 10% alcohol! to boot!
Nice foam. Aroma, fresh fruit, banana, pineapple. Palate, very balanced, smooth, nice bubbles. Taste, banana, fruits, balanced, wheaty sweetness, taste is not long enough.

A very complex brew! Very fruity with a tone of banana and pineapple in the aroma. Slightly parfume flavoured which goes well with the strong alcohol flavour. Fine balance between the beautyful dark nut/orange colour and the expectations for the palate.

Easily the best on-draft beer Ive ever tasted. Pours brown with a quick brown head and a relatively light but sweet, typical-Belgian nose. The flavor is too complex to do it any real justice; suffice to say its rich and multi-layered and disappoints in no clear ways. World class.

Golden amber color and a coppery slightly cloudy tone that was poured in its beautiful owner bowl.
Beige Cream with a dense foam of height about a finger, good consistency, but quickly dissipates. Mark the walls of the Trappist glass with beautiful ties.
The Aroma is a sideshow. Salta nostrils bringing a sweet ripe banana tender, fowl in a burnt vanilla or sugar, or as a sweet beautiful walnut or perhaps a traditional brown glace Portuguese (made from nuts of course). Emerging shyly, but effectively could tell aromatic fans of a powerful dark malt drunk in caramel, dried fruit, raisins and fleshy plums.
Taste brings in your body in a lively carbonation a revolution in his mouth and carries a sweet bitterness dry kind of bittersweet. With dark malts and caramel brown or perhaps a caramel sugar, caffeine has a light in the background. It is indeed your great fruity flavor, slightly sweet but never cloying, which becomes very complex, yet it is incredibly easy to drink. A delicious Panettone and light woody touch not get out of my mind.
Certainly a Licorosa beer, velvety, leaving a finish of red fruit and a spicy light alcohol. Moreover, the powerful alcohol is present at the end of the sip and heat the throat or even the aftertaste. A happy cheating by hiding behind a much alcohol aroma and unique flavor.
A remarkable character of beer and unique flavor that goes down smooth and tenacious.
A classic Trappist!
Неплохо& вид. Хороший вкус, крепко. Чувству& алкогол& Жжено, и в то же время мягко.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2016 Very quick deminishing head when pured in a glass. Nose is belgian yeast and some floral hints. Creamy mouthfeel, some alcoholic bite and bitterness while beeing sweet in the long warming finish. Not that much into the pale quads though...

My first time trying this famous beer. 750ml bottle, pours golden brown/amber with thin off-white head. Like the description says, main aromas are esthery banana, vanilla, sweet nutty, and toffee malt. Flavours of sweet caramel malt, rich raisin/prune. I understand what people are saying about it being too sweet, but I dont think that it detracts from the beer. Delicious and boozy, would recommend!

330ml Bottle from Arendsnest Proeflokaal, Amsterdam (6.00):
Great stuff from La Trappe here, this one really didnt seem like a 10% beer at all & this was largely down to the fact that the beer was so smooth to drink & the alcohol was almost completely masked in both the taste and the smell. Bottle. Pours a light brown with a large fluffy offwhite head. Aroma of caramel, candy, dates and raisins. Taste is semi-sweet. Hints of candy and raisins. Also hints of clove. Full body high co2 levels.
0.33 flaske. Aroma gjær karamell frukt eik. Smak gjær malt peanøtt frukt. Complex og flott. Kanongod. Co2 medium

En trois points... 1) Brune aux reflets violacés. Le nez est très levuré, avec une pointe de petits fruits rouges bien mûrs et sucrés. 2) En bouche, cest encore la levure des moines qui vole la vedette. Jai aussi bu une Tripel cette semaine et la signature de la levure transparaît de la même manière dans cette Quadrupel. 3) Peut-être lai-je attaquée alors quelle était trop froide? Peut-être lai-je terminée trop froide  le produit se boit drôlement bien et la bouteille descend à un rythme dangereux. Une Quadrupel avec la «légèreté» dune Dubbel.

Overall: Doesn?t smell much but could be my cold playing tricks on me. Too sweet for me, quite rich. Still a great quadrupel.

Murky brown pour with off-white head. Dark toffee nose, lots of malts, belgo yeast and slight booze. Full bodied palate. Malty, balanced, compex, pleasant. Very good. A step up from the main competitor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Drank from a bottle. Pours a thick, white foam and looks nicely tan. Fruity smell and a very complex taste. There is at least some vanilla and caramel in there.

Aroma: The smell is ripe with dried fruits, bananas. But also a tad alcoholic, sherry, acetyl (björnklister).Appearance: A brown beer orange colored, a small head, no lacing but good curtains.Taste: The taste is overpowering in the dried fruit area, figs, dates, but also raw sugar and madeira.Palate: Little carbonation, a very complex feeling.Overall: A lot of sweetness and taste in this one, a dessert in itself.Note: On tap, sampled at a beer tasting. Bottle at home bought in Munich, 3rd April 15. Aroma spice, banana, vanilla. Taste is clove, banana, spice, sweet malts, great depth, full flavour. Great beer, beats most of the Belgian examples, love Dutch beer

Intense reddish amber. Long-lasting thick ivory froth.
Sheer aroma of caramel, banana, apricot, bread, white flowers, even limestone.
Creamy, mildly sweet, strong and fresh. Very complex, with a long, flower-reminiscent ending. Excellent.

La Trappe Quadrupel amène une robe ambrée profonde avec épaisse mousse blanche. Ses saveurs chaleureuses et intenses sont trop bien équilibrés ! Tout de suite, je perçois des arômes de banane, vanille , caramel et de fruits confits, le tout bien épicé due à la levure utilisée et à lalcool.La Bouche offre les mêmes saveurs suivi dun arrière goût sucré/amère très plaisant finissant en beauté avec une final maltée et fruitée. Directement dans le style !!! meilleur quadrupel que jai bu jusquà maintenant ! Du Belge à létat pure ! PROOST La Trappe !

3/29/15 (Bottle) - Excellent copper dark brown pour with thick generous off white head. Generous scents of fruits, almonds, vanilla, caramel and malt. Pleasurable tastes and feel drinking, and a nice strong kick. Tastes included caramel, dried fruits such as raisins, malt. Great mixture and a great beer.

Robe ambrée translucide, un généreux col de mousse blanchâtre couronne le tout. Dentelle quasi nulle, le liquide semblant être bien liquoreux et mielleux. Les arômes rappellent le sucre dorge, vanille, baies confites, pruneau et une touche épicée dûe à lalcool se démarque également. En bouche, les saveurs sucrées attaquent rapidement. Caramel, sucre candi, muel, baies. Un côté citronné fait aussi son apparition. Les premières gorgées sont assez effervescentes et masquent un peu le goût. Laisser reposer quelques minutes après louverture pour en atténuer leffet. La finale fait ressortir des saveurs plus maltées, un peu de céréales. Une belle amertume sucrée sétire longuement et fond ressortir larôme de vanille. Le corps est bien rond, les gorgées crémeuses. Le haut taux d?alcool ne paraît aucunement. À la hauteur de la réputation des bières trappistes.

Cloudy dark brown color, small off-white to tan head. Dark fruit, brown sugar aroma. Hints of banana. Taste is really sweet, fruity, sugary, plum, fig, some sourness. Extremely long plum finish. Full body, soft carbonation. (Vrutak 0,33l bottle)

Even op temperatuur laten komen, vervolgens uitgeschonken in Chimay bokaal. Amberkleurig bier met donkere koperen gloed, en fijne beige schuimkraag die redelijk snel terugzakt. Bij dit bier is mijn voorkeur voor quadrupels begonnen, ook na het bezoek aan het klooster, de brouwerij en het proeflokaal in Berkel-Enschot, deze ligt slechts enkele kilometers hier vandaan! De geur is weer typisch trappist, Belgische gist en specerijen, wel krachtiger dan gebruikelijk. De smaak is zoet en complex, met tonen van gebrande mout, veel banaan, rozijnen met vanille en kruidnagel, samen met de nootachtige smaken van amandel en hazelnoot. De afdronk is lang, zoet met tonen van banaan en aangenaam bitter van de hop. Werkelijk een fantastisch bier deze La Trappe Quadrupel Trappist, zeker een van de vlaggenschepen van de Nederlandse bieren. Er zijn ook nog verschillende batches die gerijpt zijn op eiken vaten, ik ben bijzonder benieuwd naar de smaken van die varianten. Ook dit bier is weer zeer geschikt om enkele jaren verder te laten rijpen in de kelder, dit zal uiteraard weer een verdere verbetering geven in het smaakpallet van deze op zich al heerlijke quadrupel.
Strong caramel notes. Good head. The continuous fermentation gives it a slight roughness.
Banana bubblegum booze breaking bad, quadrupel dose of true sledgehammer tasting insanity.
Vanilje, honning, syrlig sødme, nordisk mjød, Skandinavien, frugtlig pære-fersken aroma
Jai un faible pour les quadrupel, et celle-ci est trappiste. Ça ne pouvait pas être décevant.

Bottle. Hazy amber with thick beige head. Aroma of malts, spicy, malts, fruity, banana, peach, caramel, honey. Taste is fruity sweet, caramel like, toffee. Full body with creamy texture and soft carbonation. Full of alcohol but although extremely drinkable.
La Trappe Quad. Ett øl alle må unne seg. Gir deg en fantastisk god følelse i hode som i munn
Draft st the maproom. Notes of raisen, dark fruits, caramel, and malts. Flavor doesnt quite match aroma, slight off flavor and silly words. Stuff shit, are you paying attention?

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2016 Copenhagen 28/2 2015. 75 cl bottle. Gift from colleagues - a fine one. Pours hazy amber with white head. Dissipates to thin lacing almost immediately. Aroma is tinged with alcohol - holding 10 % - thats not surprising but supplemented with ripe fruity sweetness. Apricot, plum and marzipan. Soft carbonation and thick oily palate. Taste is rather intense and strong. Heavily sweet with only light bitterness. Spicy and yeasty. Strong alcohol notes. A fine Belgian specimen.

Light for the alcohol content. Well balanced malt & yeast tastes. A hint of dried fruit & spice with a concentration on the clean taste. Excellent.

Rated by BrewTom

Farbe: helles Rot-Braun. Leicht trüb. Weißer Schaum, der schnell zerfällt. 
Aroma: süß, etwas Banane, Likör, Malz
Geschmack : im Antrunk süß, Fruchtsaft, Beerenlikör, malzig. Runder Körper. Alkoholisch und dennoch leicht zu trinken. 
Sehr stimmiges Bier für kalte Tage

Bottle 330ml. Cloudy bronze with medium creamy beige head and lots of sediments. Very fruity aroma (peach, pear), yeasty and milky, notes of caramel and dried fruits. Sweet flavor, lots of fruitiness, yeasty and creamy, notes of milk chocolate and caramel, some spiciness, light sourness, quite alcoholic with sweetish sticky finish. Moderate carbonation, creamy texture. Full-bodied.

Cerveza con una bonita espuma, cerveza con 10 grados de marcado regusto alcohólico es una cerveza Quadruple que deja un sabor muy intenso en boca, el alcohol no está muy bien integrado y se nota demasiado , cerveza para probar una vez, mejor la doble o la Triple de esta misma cervecera
Draft sampled at Olympic tavern. From notes. Malty with caramel and dark fruits. Some banana in the finish.
UPDATED: JUL 31, 2015 Pours a ruby red with a thin white head that settles in the middle. Aroma of cinnamon and nutmeg. Quite a malty backbone, cinnamon on the tip and a hint of port.

Rated from beer log from 2009 Belgian Trip.... 1995 Vintage enjoyed in Antwerp... Brown caramel in color, slight white foamy head... Aroma is powerful, very nutty in character... Flavor is amazing, not sweet but nutty, very easy to drink, alcohol content is amazingly well concealed from aging... Palate is extremely neutral, not bitter, not sweet, but kind of nutty... Very interesting beer, intriguing how this has aged...

Head disappears to a durable ring. Aroma is very close to witbier (sic!) and the beer tastes lighter than it actually is. Its warming and of sophisticated mouthfeel. In a blind test Id rather say its tripel than quadrupel.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with a thin head. Aroma is zesty yeast and dark fruit. Flavor is fruity and roasted caramel, but thin.
Nice deep amber color. Sweet, citrus tones. This beer is simply delicious! Warm for a nice autumn/winter day.

330cc bottle. Pour dark amber and very clear for the style. Cherries, orange and yeast. Also malty and caramel. It is lovely sweet with some hop presence. Great comfort drink that just fills your sense up.

Une trappiste exceptionnelle d'origine hollandaise. La seule a ma connaissance à bénéficier d'une quadruple fermentation. Forte, subtile et harmonieuse. J'aime !

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ladna srednio pecherzykowa zoltobiala piana,opada dosc szybko pozostawiajac jednak okolo centymetrowa warstwe do samego konca degustacji,kolor ciemno bursztynowy,w zapachu czuc slod,karmel,banany,smak bardzo zlozony,slodki,nasycenie srednie,bardzo dobrze ukryty alkohol ktory daje znac o sobie tym ze piwo fajnie rozgrzewa
Tot nu toe mijn favoriete bier, lekker volle smaak met een zoette smaak en een redelijk sterk alcohol percentage.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2015 0,33 hana@ Viisi Penniä. Kirkas meripihkan punertavan ruskea. Tuoksussa rusinoita, alkoholia, ylikypsiä vaaleita hedelmiä (mm.banaania), mallasta. Maussa ylikypsiä hedelmiä, alkoholia, vähän mallasta. Maku loppuu lyhyeen, pienoinen pettymys. Ehkä liian kylmää maisteluhetkellä? (6-4-3-12)
Uusi kokeilu 8.2. 0,33 pullo@ OPP. Tuoksussa makeaa mallasta, makeita rusinoita, vähän luumua tai taatelia. Hitunen humalaa. Siirappia. Maussa makeaa mallasta, rusinoita tummia hedelmiä/ marjoja, hieman leipää. Alkoholi maistuu, mutta ei pistävänä eikä spriimäisenä kuten hanasta. Ei tämä olekaan pahaa!

Bottle. 
Pours amber with a white head. 
Aroma of toffee. Sweet taste of licorice and plums.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2016 Visual âmbar escuro, espuma de média formação e boa persistência. Aroma carregado de malte, toffe, banana madura, caramelo, complexa. Paladar de dulçor intenso, baixo amargor do malte de maior torrefação. Corpo médio/denso, média carbonatação. Aftertaste persistente, uma bala toffe doce e alcoólica. Deliciosa.
On tap @ Haket Pub. Cloudy pale amber with a tiny white head. Malty and fruity tones. Malt, fruit, caramel and hops. Full body with a long balanced finish.

Bottle at home. Pours a clear reddish amber with an offwhite head. Aroma of raisins, sweet caramel malts, dark fruits, alcohol. Taste is sweet malty with quite some alcohol. Boozy dark fruits aftertaste. Not bad.
это пиво очень вкусно. я бы, конечно, рекомен& его всем. пожалуй& обратит& его. очень хорошо!
UPDATED: FEB 4, 2015 Piękny zapach. Alkohol świetnie ukryty praktycznie nie czuć tych 10%. Duża słodycz ale przyjemna w odbiorze
Ho dovuto passare diversi pub per ruscire a trovarla, ne è valsa la pena ed è in assoluto una delle mie birre preferite.

Bottle 0.75 l. Pours red color. Hazy. Medium white head. In nose banana and peper notes. In flavor also banana and peper with touch of caramel and bubblegum. On sweet side. Very drinkable for 10% alcoholic drink. Overall:good beer.

Kolor miedziany, klarowne. Piana obfita, szybko opada, ale pozostawia gruba obraczke i niezle oblepia szklo. W aromacie na pierwszym planie wanilia i przyprawy, dalej syrop kandyzowany, karmel, czekolada, estry owocowe. W odczuciu polwytrawne, jest lekka owocowo-karmelowa slodycz, dosc wysoko wysycone. W smaku mamy powtorke z aromatu, lekko karmelowe, sporo owocowych estrow i syropu kandyzowanego, niestety takze lekko metaliczne, za to alkohol dobrze ukryty, zwodniczo lekkie i pijalne. Goryczka niska, ziolowa.
Bottle. Brown with fluffy one finger head. Sweet dark fruit aroma. Dark fruit taste, sweet. Very good.

Draught at Yard House (Dedham, Mass). Goblet

I try not to rate beer at the bar/pub, so this is from memory from about an hour ago. My memory is crap, but I remember this being the best Belgian beer from the Yard Houses Belgian 6 sampler. I ordered a goblet of this after the sampler plate. The Quad was amazing. Aroma was somewhat sweet. Appearance was clear, amber, with white/tan head. Taste had an exceptional balance between sweet malts/sugar and bitter hops. Really enjoyed the hops on this, the bitterness was perfectly balanced with the malts/sugar. Nice and dry finish. Overall, wow, this was really, really good. Probably the best Quad that Ive had in a while. No fruitiness like Ommegang Three Philosophers, just a straight up Quad.

The first impression when you pour it into the glass is a sweet dark fruit and chocolate smell, very nice. The taste is really good, soft and little fruity, even though it is maybe quite carbonated. In fact, it tastes better a few minutes after pouring it into the glass. Ann¡yway it is a very good beer which deserves to be tasted.

Donkeramberkleurig bier met mooie schuimkraag.
Aromas van banaan, amandel, vanille.
Smaak is moutig zoet, licht gebrand.
Bitterige afdronk met een zoete nasmaak.

Aroma is dark fruits, belgian sugar candy, biscuit, vanilla, raisins and rich malts. Taste is a great collection of fruits like plum, raisin, dark cherry and apple. Very nice and chewy mouthfeel. Transitions into a very pale but well placed bitterness. Appearance is a medium dark cloudy amber with a medium pearl head that retains well.

Quadrupel facile da bersi, di colore ambrato torbido. Al naso salgono aromi floreali e frutta candita. Al palato appare subito dolce quasi a ricordarmi una Kwak....ma di un dolce che a fine bottiglia non cambia. dove sono i lieviti? in generale buona bevuta.

Bottle. Poured in a Leffe glass. Aroma is toffee malts, yeasty. Taste is dark dried fruits, prunes, raisins, candy sugars, some spices and some Belgian yeast/funk. Body is full, texture creamy, medium carbonation. Finish is sour and yeasty, with some burning alcohol.

Malty, yeasty, boozy, dried fruits.
Copper colour, off-white head, lacing.
Alcohol, malty, big sweetness, bit one-dimensional.
Big body, soft carbonation, anonymous finish.
Ok.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 Pours deep mahogany with a small frothy head. Aroma is a classical belgian bouquet with a reasonable level of intensity: light caramel, peach, raisins, banana and cloves, dried fruits and a hint of noble alcohol. Taste is based on the same notes as the aroma, the beer is rather smooth and warming, alcohol is present but in a good way. Balance is the key here, makes the beer extremely drinkable.
Lots of raisens and sweet fruit, taste is stale and skunked raisen... Bad bottle??????
Gylden brun litt tåkete med høyt beige skum. Karamell, kandissukker og røde bær. Fyldig, søt karamell, frukter og alkoholsødme i smak. Medium + kullsyre.
Very fine beer sugary and sweet no bitterness but a little too simple for me lack of authenticity.
UPDATED: MAY 28, 2015 Bottle at home. Pours dark amber, nose is raisins, caramel, banana, taste is similar, rich, sweet.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka. Bardzo bujna, drobnopecherzykowa, biala piana, opadajaca dosc powoli do obraczki, troche zostajaca na szkle. Przejrzyste, opalizujace, o barwie cieplego bursztynu, miodu, dosc jasnej jak na styl. W aromacie troche alkoholu, duzo owocow dosc zroznicowanych, zarowno suszonych jak i swiezych (banany, sliwki, wisnie, winogrona, rodzynki, brzoskwinie), rowniez slod, rowniez drozdze - w aromacie troche jak dubel tylko hmmm... szlachetniej? ;) W smaku rowniez duzo owocowosci nieco kwaskowatej (zestaw analogiczny do tego w aromacie) slodowosci, drozdzowosci, troche karmelu, troche miodu. goryczka niska. slodki. w ustach niczym szampan (to poniekad tez kwestia charakteru wysycenia, dosc wysokiego zreszta), tyle ze calkiem pelen, tresciwy. Ma sie ochote na kolejny lyk. alkohol - wszak nie niski - w smaku genalnie ukryty. Wysoka klasa, do ktorej niewatpliwie warto wracac. 7/4/9/5/17 -> 4.2Update 12.01.2015 - Butelka, warka do 09-2017. Jeszcze intensywniejsza owocowosc, nieco bardziej slodka. Co w efekcie poprawia odbior calosci. Jestem fanem. 8/4/9/5/18 -> 4.4Update 22.01.2015 - Butelka, warka do 02-2016. Mam wrazenie wyzszego wysycenia i slodyczy - nie wiem, czy to kwestia dluzszego lezakowania w butelce czy po prostu warki - 8/4/9/5/18 -> 4.3http://tiny.pl/ggmvg - 4.3Ta ocenka jest zawyzona, bo uwzglednia rozne mile fakty, np: dostepnocsc i cene :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Aroma has yeast, caramel, raisin and almonds. Taste is a bit bitter but has a long sweet aftertaste. Full of flavors like ripe fruits, nuts, caramel and some spices. Nice full mouth feeling but still very drinkable.
Good flavor, sweetness gradually comes to aroma and taste a bit of alcohol, but well

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2015 Excellent nose, noble and distinctive. Cloudy mahogany, first class colour, light beige head. Winter beer, but if you offer me a bottle during summertime - no problem at all! Complex, but yet shy liquid, restrain to shout its quality, which is so nice quality by itself. You can almost chew the taste. Gorgeous!

Aromat: typowo belgijski, estrowy, lekko bananowy, również karmelowy. Ogólnie bardzo intensywny. Dość mętne, złote. Piana początkowo wysoka, szybko opada do niskiej (ale nie zerowej), pozostaje na szkle. Smak również "belgijski", estrowy, owocowy, wyraźnie słodowy. Wyczuwalny alkohol, ale dobrze ułożony. Goryczka niska. Dość wysokie wysycenie i szlachetnie rozgrzewające odczucie alkoholowe, gęste.. Ogólnie piwo wybitnie degustacyjne i godne polecenia.

At Mort Subite Cafe in Brussels. Pours amber with a thick white head that laces the glass. Fruity aroma with banana, cloves, and caramel. Tastes of dark fruits, malty, boozy, and finishes slightly dry.
Dark golden with a medium beige head. Aroma is malt, yeast and caramel. Taste is malt, chockolate and dried fruit.

This one was bought by mistake by one of my friends. We had tried the Tripel a while back and he thought he had bought more.. but to our unanimous statisfaction, he had bought the Quadrupel.

330ml bottle served in snifter at room temperature:

Pours a foggy mohagony showing no carbs and topped off by a huge creamy white head with a slight tan. Lacing properties are crazy making the brew very appealing visually.

The nose is outrageously fruity and nutty with tons of banana, molasses and almonds. I got a strong alcohol backbone giving a brandy aspect to the nose. Sometimes getting the alcohol in the nose is not a positive trait but in this case I found it fitted just right. Its almost as if you were about to drink a winter warmer so it makes the brew promessing.

On the tongue, the beer is dense, effervescent, putting out tons of candied fruits and nuts. It breaks down into foamy and sweet liquorish dattes leading to an incredible warm finish lasting ages.

This is just a wow all the way. I recommend any Quadrupel fan to give this beer a try. Its dense, complex and yet incredibly delicate. Awesome product! Cheers!

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2015 The appearance is an excellent deep amber color that is very appealing.  Head started out a finger thick but with very poor retention.  Aroma is a sweet mix of ripe banana and vanilla.  Palate is quite good for a quad, very drinkable, a bit dry and bitter aftertaste.  Taste is a bit boozy, but mixes well with malts and fruit like banana.  It does improve I believe with warming, as i get much more of the banana and vanilla flavors.  so is probably best at 10-12c (about 55-53F)

Caramel, almonds, some spiciness, though not as much as others of the style. Maybe a hint of butterscotch as well (though it might be something else that I cant place). ABV is well hidden. Very smooth.

Pours amber with a large frothy off white head. Aromas of caramel, burnt sugar, rye bread, raisins, figs, slight muskiness. Taste is caramel, rye bread, banana, raisins, and some nutty notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

Riktigt god med fin utvecklas smak. Sjukt god öl.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,33 l bottle. Dark cloudy amber in the glass. Small head. Fresh berriefruits on the nose. Starts heavy, nearly oily, resin, dark fruits with sweetness, belgian yeast. But also alcoholic. Present malt in the background. Complex as expected. I enjoyed it a lot.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2016 Poured into a Trappist glass and maybe it was my pouring skills but I was somewhat disappointed at the lack of head. However, it was a nice hazy bronze/copper color with some long lasting lacing throughout. The aroma was pretty amazing. Malty, caramel and some fruits. The taste was not complex but still nice. I couldnt really put my finger on the flavor but it seemed like a mix of caramel and a mild lingering alcohol taste yet sweet and without a bitter aftertaste. I found it to be smooth and easy to drink. Its a great beer overall.

Un gout corsé prononcé, une amerture très agréable, une touche de caramel et un alcool qui vien sublimer le tout.
Un final plutôt amère .

Bottle at home. Beautiful hazy Amber colour, nicely lacing beige creamy head that lasts. Nose and taste with caramel, toffee, dried fruits like figs and dades and almond: barley-wine like complexity in the sweetness. Nicely spicy and herbal Belgian yeast character alongside really smooth (!) malts. Finish is sweet but short. No big alcoholic punch despite the high abv. Carbonation is too high for my liking (typical La Trappe), good body, soft mouthfeel.

Pours cloudy deep brownish amber with tall off-white head. Aroma of hazel nuts, muscovado, dried fruit, spices, slightly burnt notes. Taste is rich sweet, nutty and spicy, with just a hint of bitterness in the finish. Rich, creamy body with soft carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2016 Drinking blind from a 33 cl bottle (edition 2003/2004).
In the aroma apple juice, red wine, alcohol, cognac, oxidation. 
The clear (with yeast) brown beer has a small brown head. 
In the taste caramel, coffee liquor, black berries. .
High carbonated. 

Tasting blind from 33 cl bottle.A flowery aroma, with alcohol and almonds.The clear red beer has a small brown head.The sweet taste gives a warm feeling inside.Medium carbonated
5 4 6 3 14
Beautiful aroma. Pours hazy yellow brown with a good amount of carbonation. Tastes delicious. Hints of caramel. Has a very nice pallette.
Excelente cerveja Ale, strong mas adocicada. Aparência excelente, pouco olfato porem muito potente na boca. Nuances de banana.
Cor cobre, sabor intenso e equilibrado! Muito top!!!!!!!!

Aroma: High phenolics, spicy, pepper. High esters, banana, Light bubblegum, 
Appearance: Clear, amber body. Large, white head, lacing, good retention.
Flavour: High fruitiness, banana, plums, , High maltiness, bready. Light warming. Dry finish with lingering fruitiness, plums. Light bitterness, just to balance the rich maltiness.
Mouthfeel: Medium body. Medium-high carbonation. Silky, creamy
Overall: Wow! Increases complexity as it warms up. A really wonderful beer.

330 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
16E. Belgian Specialty Ale

From a 750 ml bottle at Il Maltese. Light ruby red/copper, slightly hazy, with a nice, creamy and persistent yellow-ish head. Very intense and powerful nose, lots of fruit esters, peach in syrup, dark fruits, chestnut honey, mature fruits (esp. pears and cherries), a light alchool presence as well. Quite complex overall. Pleasent warming sensation upfront, quite velvety and smooth, perfectly balanced between bitter and sweet notes. Toffe and dry fruits (nuts, almonds) in the aftertaste. Dangerously drinkable considering the ABV. Soft to average carbonation, medium to full body, slightly oily texture. Great.

I was fortunate enough to try this for the first time in the motherland of wonderful Belgium. The aroma draws you in immediately and the subtle yeastiness that is this quad is addicting if not inspiring. I was extremely pleased to find it on tap back home.
Maybe bad luck, but felt like water with a back taste of beer...is like all those i drunk from la trappe are the same just the alchool gets more...pity.. tried the different versions several time

Bottle 0.75.
appearance: dark amber, slighlty hazy, nice thick head but quickly decreasing in volume, creates decent lacing 
nose: typical belgian yeast, fruity and floral, goźdźik, bananas, malty, caramel, amaretto 
mouthfeel: medium but soft carbonation, medium to full bodied, smooth, throat warming alcohol
taste: complex, pleasant, sweet, low bitterness, slightly alcoholic, fruity, quite short aftertaste

The juicy liquid fruitcake palate includes dark fruit sugar, dried figs, faint banana, and a trace of biscuit suspended in a very creamy, moussey beer. First up is brown sugar followed by raisins and plums. Next is the licorice followed by a lingering herbal sweetness. The 10% ABV is not very noticeable. The beers tastes like it smells, which is refreshing. It pours a hazy dark tea amber under a 3" rocky off-white foam cap that slowly dissipates into clingy clumps of finely bubbled foam. The beer lines the glass with lace and upon swirling shows a hint of legs. Smell of date and prune was almost immediate along with black plum and some light Damsen nippiness. Also a lot of brown sugar and apricot sweetness. As you drink there is also a deep boozy aroma that sneaks into the nostrils and detracts from the taste somewhat, ridiculously feather-light, almost to the point of having a flattened body... while you dont overtly taste the alcohol, it certainly thins out and helps float the beer across the palate.

Question: What would Ernest Hemingway think of the above style of writing? Same as me, probably. (All quoted from a single page of another beer rating site.)

Anywho, this is a pretty good Trappiste, full bodied and heavy with a big dose of dark fruit. I would say that the alcohol is more up front than in the better Trappistes, but this is a damn fine brew. Consumed in a nice (nicer than their beer!) Stella Artois glass.
Pours and sits pretty. Smells like banana candy. Sweet and sour cherry flavour with rich, thick texture. Like over ripe fruit. Sweetness and volume of flavour hides the strength of alcohol.

Amber -brown colour. Aromas of caramelized malt, Belgium yeast and spices. Flavours of caramelised malt, Belgium yeast, spices, candy sugar, candied fruits. Round mouthfeel. Couleur ambrée. Arômes de malt caramel, levure belge et épices. Saveurs de malt caramel, levure belge, épices, sucre candi, fruits confits. Alcool bien camouflé, rond en bouche.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2014 From a bottle. Pours brown with a white head. The taste is really full. Fruity, yeasty, caramel. Top class stuff! They can definitely la trappe me with this beer in a room yea yaw!

Bottle @ home. 
Aroma of caramel, alcohol, some fruit. 
Clear amber with big off-white head. Tiny lasting. Moderate+ sweetness, light sweetness. Full body, oily texture, sweet alcohol finish, light+ carbonation.
I cant say that I was too impressed with this beer. In spite of many perfect features, theres something about that "tutti-fruti" flavour that reminded me cheap bubble gum from times of yore.
Mooie kleur en uitnodigende geur. Smaak is heerlijk zoet maar ook nog is met een mooie afdronk. Wat een top bier!
Bottle head of steam Huddersfield. Golden thin head. Aroma is yeast fruit banana. Taste same lots of pepper cream nice bitter finish. Great full mouthfeel. V good.
Brown cloudy with medium off-white head. Yeasty aroma with fruity and spirit notes. Sour-sweet fruity yeat taste with touch of bitter.
big time banana on the nose. Raw nuts, bread, sweet-malt.full body, thick feel. Sweet, warming, boozey finish. Really great stuff here.

Si presenta di un torbido colore ambrato carico; la schiuma è buona e abbastanza persistente. Al naso, oltre che allalcool e il caramello è possibile apprezzare altri profumi, come frutta candita (albicocca, mela, pesca), frutta rossa (ciliegie), marzapane e sentori fruttati. Il corpo non è così pieno come la gradazione alcolica poteva far immaginare; è poco carbonata, con una consistenza oleosa. Al gusto domina il dolce, con zucchero di canna, marzapane, uvetta, prugne, frutta sotto spirito. Un bel finale discretamente secco evita la saturazione da zuccheri, lasciando un tiepido retrogusto etilico e fruttato.
Strong but hides alcohol well. Banana and Clove notes. Pours beautiful amber color
Opaque amber, medium white head. Banana, vanilla, caramel on the nose. Bittersweet caramel, nice and warming bitter and slightly dry finish. Nice.

Appearance: (poured into a Chimay Chalice) pours a two finger thick, creamy, off-white head, slowly settles to half a finger of head, body is a hazy dark nutty brown-red.
Aroma: boozy, rich dark fruits, vinous, malt, roasted malt, hints of vanilla, apricots, plums, raisins, nuts, brown sugar, candi, biscuits, bread, caramel, hints of vinegar
Palate: Thick, chewy, lively carbonation yet creamy.
Taste: Rich, dark fruits, apricot, malty, boozy, slight bitterness, raisins, yeast, chocolate malt sprite like finish with hints of orange.
Overall: A gorgeous, rich complex dark fruity boozy beer with a fair amount of yeast. Sweet and vinous, elements of it remind me of cognac, particularly the boozy rich fruitiness.

Robe ambrée, très légèrement opaque. 
Saveurs de banane et de caramel dominantes. Arrière goût très fruité, avec des notes de miel. Très longue en bouche. On ne sent vraiment pas les 10° dalcool.
Une excellente trappiste.
330ml bottle from BePLUS, Xiamen. Pours hazy brown with a white head. Aroma of banana and malt. Sweet finish.

Whatever you mean about my rating I do not care ;) The bottle has dark pieces swimming inside in it (proteins?) Honey hazy colour and no foam. Bougth 11/14 and best before is 6/16. Aroma...not sure pears maybe...sweet fruits.Taste like sweet pear and other fruits. Caramel malts. Alcohol is well hidden but could not drink more bottles.
Aroma a maltas y caramelo. Espuma persistente. Buen cuerpo, maltas, caramelo, banana, miel, frutas ...muchas cosas, muy compleja. Amargor final moderado. Excelente.
UPDATED: NOV 22, 2014 Bottle from my supermarket. One of my favourite Trappist! Great amber colour (Aged version draught Quercus is better than this one)
Clear amber color with lasting beige head. Malty aroma of caramel. Taste is sweat caramel, full body with alcohol warming.

Bottle. Dark Brown Body with Lasting tan head. Aroma is fruity with some bananas and hints of alcohol. Taste is caramel some dried fruits and some yeast. Aftertaste is some alcohol with some bitterness. Nice one.

Bottle poured into pint glass. Beautiful dark golden amber color with thick fluffy slow dissapating head. Aroma has a slight banana scent. Goes down smooth, has a little banana flavor and a little burn from alcohol. Since Im more an IPA fan, there are many other options Id go for, but it definitely is a quality brew.

Una quadrupla da gradino del podio mondiale dello stile. Di colore ambrato, con intensi sentori floreali, con dolcezza dei malti, lascia un buon retrogusto dolce, con sentori di banana, mandorle e vaniglia
Clear liquid, large head. Aroma of caramel and fruit. Heavy body, soft carbonation. Taste is sweet and bitter.
En weer een geweldenaar van La Trappe. Mooie amber rode kleur. Weinig schuim en een volle zware smaak.

Pours clear dark amber/brownish with a small off-white head. Malty aroma of caramel, sugar, bit of dark fruits, clear banana, spices. Nice sweet taste. Bit bready, nice banana touch. Fruits kick in later on (plums, raisins). Some alcohol as well. Bit disturbing, clear bite on the tongue... The end is slightly bitter with that sweetness still overarching... Beautiful warmish kick in the aftertaste... Nice, but quite sweeter than many other quads. Medium bodied with a lovely creamy mouthfeel and a fizzy carbonation. Overall seen quite a nice beer. Not the most complex and balanced and it doenst hide its alcohol that well, but still a pretty tasty well-made brew. I liked it.

Aroma is full of many pleasant scents. Banana, clove, earth, candied fruit, caramel, musty yeast, biscuit, baking spice, and coriander. The flavor is sweet and with caramel covered biscuits, clove, slight bitterness, sweet candy, orange peel, lemon peel, and earth. The palate is medium full bodied, fizzy carbonation, and has a syrupy mouthfeel. The finish is sweet and brief. Great Belgian beer that I will surely have again.

Pours clear deep amber with one finger of off-white head diminishing gradually to a thin cap, moderate lacing. (4/5) Nose is dark toffee/caramel, raisins and dark fruit, banana, slight spice. (8/10) Taste is moderate sweet and peppery, finishing mild bitter. (9/10) Medium body, moderate sustained carbonation, lingering tart bitter finish with distinct alcohol warming. (5/5)

Excellent quadrupel. The ABV isnt even close to hidden, but it works well with the dark fruitcake flavours on the nose and tongue. The body is definitely on the light side of medium, I think partly due to the moderate sustained carbonation, and partly due to the sharp edge of the alcohol on the tongue. Not quite as mellow and perfect as the Westvleteren XII, the St. Bernardus Abt 12 or the Rochefort 10, perhaps (nor as interesting as Three Philosophers) but a solid performer regardless. (17/20)

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 16E). Bottle 33 cl - Batch 15:04 K24C14. AROMA: sweet malty profile with strong spicy and peppery alcohol notes. APPEARANCE: deep ambar and clear, with a somewhat moussy, ivory head with good retention and lacing. TASTE: sweet malt profile with peppery and perfumy alcohols. medium-low biterness with a somewhat dry finish. PALATE: medium-thin body with moderate carbonation. warming alcohol sensation. OVERALL: a strong belgian style ale with peppery aromas and flavors and not very much else.

Seriously good, this could become my new blood group. Beautiful dark brown smokey colour and taste, thick beige head with strong but pleasant yeast taste that dwindles. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle at home. It pours a dark/red amber colour, with a decent and persistent white head. Aroma is strong raisins, dark fruits, malts and some bananas. Taste is dark fruits, raisins and plums, sweet malts, Belgian yeast, very strong toffee notes and a strong bittersweet flavour throughout. It is full-bodied with decent carbonation and a little alcohol warmth. This is probably one of the best "Trappist" beers out there. Its a very complex beer.

Świetne piwo, alkohol ładnie ukryty, w aromacie ciemne winogrona, śliwki, wiśnie w spirytusie, rodzynki, lekkie goździki i zapachy fenolowe (przypomina dobre czerwone wino). W smaku natomiast jest dość słodko, ale jest to słodycz rodzynkowo-czereśniowo-śliwkowa, szybko kontrowana pestkową goryczką, delikatną owocowo-słodową kwaskowością a na finiszu wyraźna ostra przyprawowość i alkoholowo rozgrzewające uczucie w gardle. Czyli gęste, treściwe, średnio nasycone piwo o zdecydowanym zapachu i smaku.
Reddish/brown pour with little head. Cascading aromas of booze, raisins, wood, fig, astringent. Full bodied, sticky on the lips, with a massive flavour and aroma profile.

On tap @ Cloud Cult show. Nice Belgian aroma. Taste is Belgian, but dark like the appearance. Has a deep, woody, rye, sour, cracker base to is that is really solid for this style. You could tell me this was 3% ABV and Id believe you. Super good stuff.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 Regular small 330ml bottle (not the one in ceramic, like the picture) poured in a Chimay chalice.
I was missing to review this one. La Trappe is my "less favorite" Trappist, nevertheless, its not bad at all, of course. Moreover, this one, is a Quad.
A: Beautiful amber-little-cloudy color. Really. However, filtered, I guess. Which, somehow, disappoints a bit. Good carbonation, as expected. It creates a big lacing and foamy head
S: Nice fruity smell: Dark fruits (prunes are evident). Fresh malts
T: Complex taste: Sweet candy (or toffee) is the first to be noted. Followed by dark Fruits. Bitterness and alcohol in the end
D: Reasonable. Balanced sweet-bitterness. However, the high ABV can be noticed here. Recommended anyway. This is a classic Trappist, after all
[ BA Review @ 2/4/2010 ]

Julie likes it a lot smells like a hospital taste like burbon ale she gives a4.  Has a touch a banana

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

My first trappist quad. Blackcurrant-like dark red with too little foam, but a very nice aroma where a varnish of red berries bathes in prunes, alcohol and some vinegar. The taste is powerful, with some raisins, raspberries, prunes and something dark and authoritarian that I cant place exactly. Some alcohol taste, but it plays along with the rest and is thus well-fitting. Endurant after-taste, strong notes of soy, blackcurrant, raspberries, and maybe some aubergine. Quadrupel is good stuff.

Aromat pszenicy, owoce, guma balonowa (turbo), lekko alkohol. Kolor bursztynowy, klarowne, piana solidna, drobna, ładnie zdobi szkło. Mocno alkoholowe, czuć słód pszeniczny, nuty koniakowe. Piwo lekko wysycone, lekko ściągające, bez goryczki, rozgrzewanie w przełyku od alkoholu, ciężkawe. Ogólnie ciekawe piwo, ale za mocno czuć alkohol.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2016 Bottle of 33cl, in a Trappist "La Trappe" glass, from the fridge.

One of good trappist beer. Nice blond colour, with the usual but good taste of yeast in the beginning, followed by a taste of vanilla and caramel. Great palate and aroma.

So nice trappist, but not the best one.

Cheers !

Flaske fra vinmonopolet. Klar rødbrun farge. Høyt karbonert med Hvit skumtopp. Smaker gjær, malt, brunt sukker,plomme/rosin, krydder og banan. Også noe alkohol, som seg hør og bør med 10%. Særdeles god

dark plum-like fruit and brown shugar dminate the flavor and aroma of this smooth sipping quad. a little alcohol warmth, but its easy drinking for 10%. nicely done...long time wish list cross off :)"
Chestnut pour. Little head. Very slight malt and bourbon nose. High carbonation. Sweet molasses middle. Subtle bitter finish. Tasty but more malt than I prefer. Best quad ive had!
Bottle. Muddy brown pour with foamy tan head that fades fast. Fresh sweet aroma. Taste is balanced. High ABV is kinda hidden. Sour ending
33cl @ bottle. Fra le trappiste di questo tipo quella che mi ha convinto meno. In ogni caso una birra di qualità, indubbiamente.

Nossa! Mais uma cerveja perfumada! Essa é a palavra certa. Aroma doce e de banana, refrescante.

O creme se formou bonito e levemente amarelado, mas logo se desfez. Ficou uma pequena camada até o fim do copo.

A cor do líquido é de um âmbar tendendo para avermelhado. Bonito de se ver.

Essa é uma cerveja doce e intensa. O álcool aparece bem. Noz moscada, melado, porém sem nenhum sinal de caramelo. Tem algo de framboesa. A carbonatação elevada cai bem, preenche o volume de cada gole.

Poured from a corked 25.4 oz bottle. A somewhat hazy, amber-orange color with an off-white frothy head. Aroma is sweet and has a definite hint of banana. Taste follows the aroma with a medium sweetness to it. Like other Belgians the carbonation is almost fizzy. Medium body and a long finish that reveals a certain warmth and trace of vanilla. Best as the chill wears off and it nears room temp.

Birra che si presenta di un torbido colore ambrato, carico, che ricorda il mogano, mente la schiuma è quasi assente, a parte lorlo attorno al bicchiere. Al naso è possibile trovare profumi come frutta candita (albicocca, mela, pesca), marzapane, sentori floreali. In bocca rispetta i sentori, ma il corpo scarico le fa perdere consistenza. Comunque una buona Quadrupel
Pours amber with a lasting beige head. Not really intensive, sweet aroma, with hints of banana. Taste is banana, raisins, alcohol. Medium body.

330 mL bottle from SoHo Organic Market, Elizabeth City, NC. Reddish orange pour with a foamy light khaki head. Aroma of Belgian candi sugar, bubble gum, and faint floral hops. Taste offers ripe banana, circus peanut candy (weird, but this is exactly what it tastes like to me), faint chocolate, and booze. Sweetness lingers on the palate somewhat but I think the alcohol helps to lift this from clinging to the tongue. The end result is a very well done and balanced quad.
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en El Corte Ingles. Color ambar. Sabor a malta, levadura, alcohol, caramelo.

Ringed white head. smells of honey, banana, caramel, yeast and. Taste is sweet vanilla and banana and long lasting balanced sweetness . Thin foam which is ringed and remaning.Excellent beer and worth to taste.
bottle@ De Tolly Joogipood. pours hazy copper color with white head. Aroma is sweet, banana and fruits. Taste is malty, seet and little sour, banana, honey, licorice. Medium body.

Bottle 0.33l from albert Heijn supermarket Ghent Belgium.Pour it dark colour with medium white head.On the nose banana.Taste of caramel, dried fruits, banana, pinch of vanilla and yeast ofcourse.What to say perfection.

Bottle from a Maksimarket near Rakvere in Sept 2014. BB 02/2017. It is a hazy, dark amber with a red hue; the big, frothy and bubbling head retains and laces well. It looks beautiful! The aroma... a fantastic alcoholic warmth coming through... its doughy, biscuity, white wine acidic, spicy, caramelly, clovey... Complex and intoxicating! Taste is quite sweet and caramelly - at first theres some berry or fruit tartness, then gets more malty (dried apples, clove, vanilla), finishing quite boozy, grainy and dry. Medium to full body, active carbonation, sticky palate. Overall: a very enjoyable, crisp, spicy and boozy Quad.

Mainstream supermarket beer. 

Not that rich and finely balanced taste that youre expecting from beers like these. 

U can get better quadruples for the same price in the Belgian supermarkets.
It has a mild sweet aroma, long palate strong malt flavour with lasting sweetness, syrupy texture, medium carbonation with diminishing head.

Bottle, tasted 100ml during Beer 2014 festival tasting. Served very lightly chilled, too warm for my liking, and this probably hart my rating of it. 
Pours rich reddish brown with grayish head. Aroma of very sweet malts and sweet caramel, very complex. Very lightly carbonated with a very full thick body. Taste is sweet, with almost no bitterness and not a trace of sourness. Tastes very alcoholic and heavy, sweet liqueur, almost cloying (those flavors were probably enhanced by the warm serving temp). More flavors of choclate, dried fruits, dark malts. After taste is sticky sweet. This is a good beer, but was just too sweet, alcoholic and heavy - I will taste it again in better conditions.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2016 Belle couleur ambrée, légèrement trouble.
Au nez : caramel, vanille et houblonnage résineux.
Attaque puissante et alcoolisée.
Texture onctueuse.
Dabord le malt, biscuit, caramel puis une légère note amère de houblon résineux.

Peu complexe mais équilibrée et efficace.
Pours brown/amber with a moderate white head. Strong malty and yeasty aroma with sweet, banana notes. Flavor is malty with some notes of plums, banana, caramel and yeast.

Bottle from Monoprix, Nice. Hazy copper-amber colour, no head. Easy drinking for a 10% ale, but the strength hits you after a while, however its fine Trappist style which is slightly dry whilst still packing in plenty of flavour certainly masks this.
Outstanding quad. Brownish red appearance with a thick white head. Aroma of pepper, citrus, and dark fruits. Sweet caramel, raisins, licorice, and plums.

Transfer from BA review on 4-13-13-

 Poured from bottle into a chalice glass

 Appearance  The beer pours a slightly darker amber color with a small half finger or less white head. The head fades very quickly leaving only a spotty level of lace on the side of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma is biggest of a white grape smell mixed with a good deal of alcohol. This gives it a very white wine like smell overall. Unlike wine however, other subtle aromas of an earthy hop and some spicy smells of pepper and clove are mixed within giving it a slightly boozy and Belgian like wine smell overall.

 Taste  The taste begins mainly of a mix of a grapy and malty flavor initially. There are some flavors of an apple and cherry flavor mixed with these with the start of the taste, which seem to fade as the taste advances more to the middle and the end. Along with the dwindling of the cherry and apple, the breadiness of the beer lessens, producing a more dry and crisp flavor on the tongue. While all these flavors lose ground, the grapy flavor grows quite a bit stronger in taste and are joined by flavors of a more tanniny bitterness as well as flavors of alcohol. These flavors give the brew a more white wine like flavor which is combined with some flavor of a pepper and spicy nature as well as some earthy and pine hop tastes. In the end the combination of flavors produces a crisp spiced and hopped wine like flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel- The body of the brew is on the thinner side for a brew of 10 % abv with a carbonation level that is average to slightly above average. The body really suits the wine like flavors as well as the hop flavors nicely to produce a crisp champagne like feel, all the while keeping it a very drinkable brew even with all its alcohol and boozy tastes.

 Overall  A rather boozy and crisp quad with a whole lot of sparkling wine like characteristic. I was actually originally expecting something with more dark fruit flavors, so this was quite a surprise. It was rather interesting and nice and is certainly worth a try, although I think it is not really my thing ,and I think there are tastier quads out there.

Great colour
Full of aroma, full of flavour
Sweet but not too sweet
A classic!

amber gold colour with thin white head. smells of raisins, honey, banana, bitterkoekjes, caramel, yeast and malt. Taste is sweet vanilla and banana with a spicy kick, boozy alcohol, nice bitterness and long lasting balanced sweetness with a full intens mouthfeel and prickly lively carbonation. Delish

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2015 0.75 bottle. Slightly hazy, amber color with a strong reddish hue and a small, nearly-white head. A complex aroma archetypal to Belgian abbey brews including citruses, malts, spices, some weird-ass honey, bananas, quite strong notes of alcohol, some caramel, and dark fruits. Taste basically follows it with sweet maltiness, spices, fruits, synthetic honey, and citruses; alcohol strongly marks its presence - in this respect many other beers hide or adapt a high alcohol content thus producing a much tastier result, here it?s running wild. Full body, very creamy texture, and an average carbonation. Finish is milder, less intrusive, and more balanced - perhaps all of these qualities result from a more controlled alcohol presence, but nevertheless it works out quite well. Overall the beer is is really good, although I can?t help the feeling it would be even better if it wasn?t for the unhindered alcohol present in the taste and some weird flavor of synthetic honey.

Bottle from Super Brugsen - fuzzy amber pour with a persistent off-white head. Aroma and taste is sweet malty, caramel, nutty, barnyard yeasty, light banana, dark dried fruits, nice spicy bite on the palate, smooth mouthfeel and warming soft boozy finish. Gorgeous.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2014 Bottle 33cl. Brown with whitish head that fades. Aroma has sweetness and alcohol. Taste has alcohol too, but there?s a sympathetic sweetness too. But I cant help to feel like its a bit chemical. Maybe for cold winter evenings?
floral, alcohol, amber, hazy, sparkling, minimal head, medium sweetness, soft carbonation. Strong alcohol taste.

Bottle. Brown honey color with fluffy big head (disappears fast). Aroma of apple, yeasty, old wine like. Taste is full with different notes. Full-bodied beer (22%!). Nice long aftertaste, but anyway this beer is close to strong alcohol. Only small sips.

Aroma: prune, vanilla and malt
App: red brown with a tan head and sudsy lacing
Flavour: super sweet malt with caramel, biscuit, hunts of vanilla and fruit cake
Palate: lasting malt and vanilla 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Appearance- brown/ruby, quite clear, a one finger white head which quickly disappears. Aroma- raisin, marzipan, fruitcake, brown sugar. Taste- dark fruit, plum hints, raisins, a bit of booze, cherry, brown bread, nutty, medium to full mouthfeel, tasty finish. Very nice.

Botella de 75 cl de el c. Ingles, tomada en junio de 2001 (fecha de caducidad para 04-2002. lote 14:26J153) Color oscuro. Cuerpo medio a alto con 10 vol que se notan en todo momento. Aromas y sabores intensos. Bastante buena y para repetir.
Een goed voorbeeld van een lekkeren quadrupel de smaak is lekker zoet maar niet te zoet

Bottle. Pours slightly nearly clear dark amber with a medium, persisting, tan head, good lacing. Nose of ripe fruits, alcohol. Aroma is very complex, with malts; yeasty fruits, grapes, apple juice, sweet orange syrup, banana coming later; lots of caramel; some spices, vanilla, cinnamon, maybe some cloves too?; alcohol. Taste is deep sweet, with a medium bitterness to balance. Not cloying at all despite the sweetness. Very smooth palate despite the high alcohol content. Full bodied, syrupy, medium carbonation. Somewhere between a good mulled wine and an old port. And a maple syrup. Undiluted. Very, very long sweet caramel and fruity finish. Absolutely fantastic!

Bottle. Pours hazy amber, two finger off-white head. Highly carbonated and some yeast. Aroma is loads of dried fruits, raisins and belgian yeast sediment. Brown sugar. Taste is sweet, caramel, molasses and fizzy carbonation that makes it really drinkable despite the high ABV which also is notable in the finish. Could use some aging! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark amber with a little haze. A little off white head that disappears fairly quickly. Aroma of dark fruits, and a little hint of alcohol. Malty flavor with minimal bitterness. Boozy, pretty good.

330ml bottle bought at Gorgeous Wine & Cigar in Yuen Long.
Preparation: bottle stored at refrigerator at around 4°C; Popped at room temperature at 12°C (within recommended temperature range) onto the Chimay chalice.

Looks: Cloudy hazy amber brown colour with thin trace of dirt- like yeast sediments; One finger head and crumpety off-white foam which lasts for 2 minutes; Excellent sticky lacing with quite fizzy carbonation.

Aroma: Fragrant and sweet malt which can be smelt half a foot away, with strong fruity banana, silky vanilla, almonds (stronger as the beer warms), plums, light raisins, bubble gum, sugar, cream, light chocolate, very light alcohol, light Bel yeast and spices. Sweet and tempting!

Taste: Medium sweet amber malt, with strong plum, dark fruits, thick caramel, burnt toffee, banana flesh, strong molasses, light alcohol, spices, Bel yeast, lemon, strong bitter hops and sharp grass.

Body: Mid to light. Creamy and quite slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Moderately thick amber malt base with incredibly strong caramel which provide a base for layers of dark fruits, fruity banana, toffee and molasses for layers after layers of smooth, velvety sensation. Quite comfy and really entertaining!
