Booze and Sweetness: The 10% abv is hidden most of the time, very well-managed, never screaming and blended in well with the complex tastes. The molasses is very strong but never cloying, seems to bring out the best in the phenolic spices. Great!

Hoppiness: Spicy aroma, with equally strong in lemon, hop cones and grass in taste, a standout against most Abts or Quads. Bitterness is sharp and quite potent, a good balance against the caramel and molasses for an abrupt, strong sweet and bitter finish.

After Taste: Wet, sweet, creamy and fruity to mouth.

Comments: Taste and palate-wise, its closest rival is Sint Bernardus Abt 12. While the latter impresses with big fat and rich maltyness and intensity, this one features some clever layers of really fruity esters, thick slap of toasty caramel, neat sweet booze and strong bitter hoppiness to make a name of its own. Not as rich as I wished for, it still an impressive Quad. Highly recommended of course and what a nice way to celebrate my #800 ratings! :-)
cereal, chocolate, coffee, brown, clear, rocky head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish. One of the best in its style!
Bottle. Dark amber color. Good head retention. Banana aroma. Clean finish. Heavy beer that warms you up.

Aroma: Dried fruits, banana, sweet malts. Taste: Again dried fruits especially plum, spices and very classy alcohol aftertaste. Low carbonation, small head and average lacing. Price [Warsaw, Poland] 18PLN at Elephant Belgium Pub.

Bottle. Hazy orange-brown with a firm and creamy off-white head. The aroma is fruity, caramel-esque, of yeasts and spices. The flavour is sweet with ripe peach, nectarine, caramel, yeast, pepper. Nice, not complex, but nice.
Light malt aromas. Sweet, fruity with a spicy back bone. The alcohol is very noticeable but enjoyable.
Bottle/tap, dark beer quite strong, tastes heavy, perfect for winter days, strong flavours, a bit wooden, over all a very good trappist

Bottle from Brugsen. Pours amber with a good beige head. Malty taste with notes of fruits, caramel, alcohol, banana. The texture is oily. Creamy mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Nice bittersweet alcoholic finish with banana notes. Quite good
La trappe Quadrupel is behoorlijk zoet! Het biertje zelf aan uiterlijk ziet er wel mooi uit

Bottle. Pours a hazy amber with a small, white head. Banana in the nose. Tastes malty sweet, but with a nice edge of bitterness. Although 10%, it's nicely balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

APPEARANCE - Clear dark orange with a light brown 5-finger head that lasts.

SMELL/AROMA/SCENT - Sweet, but not much aroma overall.

TASTE - Brown sugar, very Belgian, very sweet. Herbaceous, piney. ABV not too well hidden.

MOUTHFEEL/PALATE/TEXTURE - Beer is light, well-carbonated, with a pleasantly creamy head.

VALUE - $10. - About average for a Belgian at a bar.

OVERALL/DRINKABILITY - Very light and well-carbonated for a Belgian quad. Would be nicer if ABV were well-hidden.
Ottima birra con un bel colore ambrato scuro e un cappello di schiuma non molto persistente, odore e sapore richiamano molto frutta secca insieme a delle note alcoliche importanti

Bottle - hazy amber with a bubbly beige head. Okay lacing. Aroma of banana and clove with some peach and pear. A little alcohol works its way through. Taste of banana, pear, bubblegum and sweet malts. Nicely warming. Medium body, medium carbonation. Amazing.
Een van de beste bieren dat ik ooit al geprobeerd heb. Echt een aanrader voor iedereen.

Appearance: strong tea color, with tall light-beige head. Aroma: brown sugar, honey, peach sweetness, dried dark fruits. Taste: some light coffee notes, again dark fruits, oily fruity sweetness. Very well ballanced. Alcohol (10%) very well hidden in taste. Gives warm nice aftertaste though.
Zeer volle en rijke smaak met een zachte schuim kraag en een mooie amber kleur

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2014 Drink cool (10-12°C)Eye: pours ruby/amber colour with nice white/beige but dissipating head.Nose: first and formost: banana; dry dark fruits (raisins, plums, prunes) but also maltyMouth: banana again, dark fruits, raisins, coriander.
Palate: banana, cherries, prunes, wholegrain bread and coriander.
Overall: not too bitter, not too sweet. very tasty with super smooth texture. a bit onsided on the banana side. Even though I?ll definitely have this one again!

From bottle in la Central de Cambrils. Great color, a bit reddish. Not much head in the original glass, therefore not highest appearance rating. The aroma is sweet and fresh at the same time. Very Belgian. Same for the taste. Rich, caramelish and quite soft I drink at ten same time. Almost perfect palate!

Bottle, 330 ml. Pours clear, light reddish amber with half a finger of off-white head, which dissipates quickly. Bit of stringy lacing is present. Plenty of sweet fruity notes on the nose: orange, peach, citrus, banana and apple are detectable. These rest on a base of rather sweet cereal malts, strangely reminiscent of cheerios. Slight spicy character overall, rounded off with and hints of smoke, almond, alcohol and cheesy yeast. Pretty spectacularly sweet taste, again reminiscent of cheerios initially with the malts coming through thick and fast. The same lighter, sweeter fruity notes as in the aroma make an appearance on the tongue, only joined by cherry and strawberry now. Aftertaste is cereal, caramel and a bit of yeast. Only real complaint Ive got about the taste is alcohol is just a little too noticeable, though just the right level of warmth is provided by it. No problems with the palate; body is full, texture is smooth, carbonation is minimal, goes down a treat. Might be the fruitiest beer that isnt actually made with fruit that Ive ever had, and yet somehow it never gets TOO sweet at any point. Aside from a little too much alcohol taste, this is a real winner.

Hazy orange with a thick and creamy beige head.
Aroma has fruity esters, mostly banana, and sweet malt.
Taste has banana, figs, chocolate, raisins, sweetness, spicy yeast and hops.
Full body, soft carbonation, round.
Banana dominates the after taste, some peppery yeast as well.

Nariz: El conjunto es complejo con aromas como banana, vainilla, clavo, toffe, avellanas, una ligera nota que recuerda el anís y un fondo de levadura 
Boca: Una cerveza sedosa de amargor muy fino, dulce y licorosa, en boca se remarca un poco la levadura, sensación cremosa de final prolongado
Vista: Semiturbia, cobriza con tonos dorados y oro viejo una espuma abundante y blanquecina

Bottle from Vinmonopolet Netstore enjoyed at home
Rusty red, big beige head. Smell of plums, dark fruits, caramel, dark malts, quite fruity yeast esters, vinous, quite complex. Heavy sweet, raisins, dark fruits, almost a hint of booze, caramel, hints of acids. Medium bitter, fruit peel. Complex flavors, totally a superb quad
Flaska från Systembolaget. Bärnstensfärgad och lätt vitt skum. Lätt smak av alkohol. Annars skumbanan och syra.
This clocks in at a hefty 10% ABV. Complex aromas dominated by banana and hints of vanilla. It has a thick sweet taste that follows right through the palate.
Amber color, light brown head. Aroma: spices, yeast, malts, fruits. Creamy mouthfeel - not too complex but I liked it - very ballanced. Kind a sweet with nice biter ending. Enjoyable.
330ml bottle, Tulip glass, Malty aroma, Golden-brown liquor, Bitter sweet and yeasty with dry aftertaste, Medium body, Creamy with off white head, Light carbonation, Hides alcohol content well :)

La trappe quadrupel trappist bottle from rome. Misty brown ale with a shortlived off white head. Nutty and sweet aroma. Taste is spicy sweet and strong with banana and almond flavours. Seems over carbonated to me with a medium body.

Pours dark amber, light brown; rather hazy; slightly tan, regular head - malty aroma, bread, yeast, alcohol, some fruits,banana - very balanced taste, light sweetness - full body, oily texture - long finish; sweet; banana

Amber coloured beer with a little white head. Aroma banana, bread, spicy Belgian yeast, cinnamon, caramel. Taste of caramel, fruity, banana, malty and yeasty with spicy and alcoholic notes, dried fruit. Moderate bitter and full body with an oily texture. The finish is sweet, and long with fruity and alcoholic notes.

Bottle, a bit of a gusher so the lumps got stirred up, still I got out a fair amount of clear orange-brown beer with a lovely caramel-banana and cream nose. Palate is rich and dry-sweet, with more fruity peach and banana tones and a warming alcohol edge.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2016 The beer that pioneered the term quadruple, and although the logic extension of the enkel - dubbel - tripel-principle, I still fail to see any distinction between this genre and barley wines and therefore recommend to include quads into the barley wine genre. Anyway: nice mousse-like, fluffy, yellowish, stable head and warm, deeply misty amber colour with a brownish hue; assertive aroma of overripe fruits and liqueur, impressions of candied oranges and dates, pear, banana, mandarine liqueur, marzipan, cloves, caramel candy, cinnamon, liquorice, cacao powder, cognac, white pepper; taste begins with a fruity and even sugary sweetness, quite sharp carbonisation and a smooth and supple caramel maltiness with nice chocolatey and nutty accents, aftertaste spicy with a mildly peppery hoppiness and warm alcohol of brandy and orange liqueur, not that well-balanced considering the fact that its effect is somewhat astringent; the sugary sweetness from the beginning also lingers a bit. I tasted this as an old beer once, in the original trappist version with according label, bottle and glass, and I cannot help to imagine it was better balanced and more refined in those days, as Ive heard more than one elderly pub owner claim in both Flanders and the Netherlands. Still probably the best trappist ale from the Netherlands, not counting that wonderful series of its oak-aged derivatives.

Bottle @ Bryggeriet, Ystad. Malty and yeasty with spicy and alcoholic notes, quite fruity, dried fruit, sweet and moderate bitter, full body with an oily texture. The finish is sweet, and long with fruity and alcoholic notes.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2014 Amber coloured beer a little white head.
Taste has a caramel flavor, fruity, some warm alcohol, banana. 
A good Dutch Trappistenbeer

UPDATED: APR 19, 2017 Amberkleurige trappist met oranje gloed. Heerlijk fruitig aroma van banaan en marsepein. Lekkere licht fruitige smaak met klein bittertje. Smaken van appelsien, kruidnagel, caramel en beetje kaneel. Warme afdronk. Volle romige smaak. Heerlijke trappist.

Pours a hazy very dark amber, but definitely lighter than most quads, quite a bit of rocky head. Nose is banana bread, raisin, spicy Belgian yeast, cinnamon, caramelly quality, maybe clove. Taste matches nose, banana, raisin, very bready, sweet, spicy Belgian yeast, . Very effervescent and bubbly on palate, hides alcohol well. I like it, objectively it's good, but I do prefer other Belgian quads. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Mekong, Richmond. Pours a hazy light brown color. Head fades to bubbles on rim of glass, no lacing. Aroma is malt, yeast, bread, caramel, molasses, raisins, figs and slight cinnamon. Flavor is same, round and malty. Delicious and full bodied, sweet finish.
Bottle, pours a deep amber with a white head, taste is sweet with malt, fruits, and some spice, medium bitter aftertaste, very good quadrupel

Ar: bananas and lots of them little bit caramelly / Ap: amber to burnt orange, very cloudy, thick tan head / T: sweet with a nice long bitter finish / P: Medium body, slightly oily and creamy, fizzy and lots of bitterness and alcoholic warmth / O: Personally, first ever crack at a quadrupel and wow its a complex beer, heaps of aroma but the hoppy bitterness is cancelled out nicely by the sweet malt and alcohol. Surprisingly (dangerously maybe) drinkable, very good.

Flaske 330ml fra Vinmonopolet Tromsdalen. Mørk gyldenbrun. Høyt luftig skum som varer og etterlater seg litt lacing. Beskjeden pepperaroma. Smaken er jordbær & annen tørket frukt. Antydning til mandler. Bra - men litt tungdrikkelig.

330ml bottle from Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours vivid amber with beautifully sweet nose of vanilla & caramel. Taste is smooth & balanced with candi sugar and sweet malts that belie its strength, in a similar way to Gulden Draak 9000. Medium bodied with a touch of spice. Great quad.

The body has a dark crimson amber color with bright ruby highlights and good clarity. It forms a small light tan head on top that fades out fast leaving little to no lacing. Its nose has some fruity, raisin like estery notes with some honey like sweetness and dark sugary notes. The flavor starts out somewhat thin on a medium body with a sweet candy and honey like malty base. It has some simple mild fruity notes with raisin as the stand out. The presence of alcohol is very mild and adds some brandy like complexity to the finish. Hop flavor and bitterness is not noticeable. The texture is slick and thinner than I would expect for a Quad. The carbonation is light and somewhat fizzy.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2015 Fris fruitig zoet aroma. Quadrupel die fruitig smaakt doet aan bessen denken. Vol qua smaak in de mond doet denken aan wijn/port met caramal, prettig geheel in de afdronk. Zoet met een licht bittertje. Sprankelend. Net als de andere La Trappe toegankelijk te drinken. Mooi in balans. Lang warme nasmaak.

Versata nel bicchiere la birra presenta una discreta schiuma, che svanisce però rapidamente. Gli aromi di caramello, prugna, dattero, vaniglia, e frutta secca sono importanti. Già dal naso si avverte la dolcezza e lalcolicità, forse eccessiva, di questa birra facendola risultare scarsamente bilanciata.

Mahagóni színű főzet rendkívül gazdag aromával, melyben rágógumis, érett gyümölcsös jegyek keverednek tejkaramellás, likőrös zamatokkal. Különlegesen telt ízekben bővelkedő, igazi csemege. Embertelenül jól sikerült alkotás.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2014 ASPETTO: tra ambrato scuro e pelo di volpe. Abbastanza limpida. Schiuma fine, non tanto abbondante e non tanto persistente. AROMA: chiarissimo sentore di banana, che sovrasta un po gli altri. Caramello. GUSTO: si ripresentano i sentori aromatici. Forte banana,del caramello e una punta di liquoroso. Carbonizzazione abbastanza bassa, anche se un po si sente. Corpo strutturato. CONCLUSIONE: Un ottima trappista! Molto dolce e che sorprende. Unico avvertimento: attenzione a trovare labbinamento giusto, altrimenti rischia dopo un po di diventare stucchevole.

Bottle at the Brouwcafe, Scheveningen. Poured a slightly hazy medium amber with a long lasting frothy white head. The aroma is rich sweet treacle toffee and banana. The flavour is moderate sweet, light bitter, with a smooth mellow malt resin, fruit, alcohol bitter palate. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation. One of the very best Trappist beers IMO.

Bottle, 75cl. Pours dark amber clear colour with creamy, stable light beige head. Aroma is rich, berries, plum, cherries, bread dough, banana, honey, cloves, Belgian yeast, malt, caramel and alcoholic easter. Flavour is initial burnt biscuits, malty and notable alcohol. Ripe fruits; banana, figs, plums and other dark, ripe fruits. Heavy caramel, booze, spicy and candy sugar. Medium-full bodied, thick and warming alcohol along light bitter finish. Average carbonation.

Vierte color ámbar claro con media cabeza de espuma beige que permanece en la copa ; aromas a caramelo, mango, albaricoque y licor. En boca entrada potente y maltosa; abundan las notas a especias y frutos secos con cuerpo y carbónico medios y el alcohol bien integrado; pos gusto dulce y maltoso con escaso amargor, buena cuádruple trapense con excelente relación calidad precio.
Clear dark copper. Aroma is sweet bananas. Taste adds cloves. Nice beer. I would love this in the winter.

Piękna piana. Aromat bananów i goździków. W ogóle zarówno z piany jak i aromatu nieco podobne do piw pszenicznych.
Intensywny, dość słodki smak, dużo alkoholu, mało wyczuwalny chmiel, wysycenie średnie. 
Naprawdę zacne piwo do degustacji.
A highly alcoholic beer! Banana and clove aromas, taste sweet,medium to full body and a silky feel, very pleasant for me.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2016 33cl bottle bb10-2016, sampler from source 2013. Revisited classic. Pours a honey amber and just as viscous. Aromas of pear, banana, honey, nuts smoothly give way to a first honey-sweet, then fruity almond apple, before a fair amount of complementary hops set it for a mid-long elegant finish. Mellow dessert beer even in high summer, although never really a go-to favourite. // Revisited 2016-7 at tasting: has this been dumbed down over the years? Mainly a honeysweet banana liqueur now, some almond, vanilla and maple thrown in for maudlin measure in between the fusels. Feels cloying and too simple for its 10% compared to quite a few yeast-active Weizenbocks.

Bottle @ home. ramato scuro tendente al marrone con riflessi rubino. velata. Schiuma beige abbastanza fine poco persistente. Aroma intenso, molto alcolico, fruttato di ciliege sotto spirito, banana , lievito belga, zucchero di canna. gusto dolce amabile, alcolico, fruttato banana e amarena, al limite del vinoso. sottile tostatura che ricorda la liquirizia. Calda, corposa, abbastanza equilibrata, armonica.

Bottle 750ml. A light cooper beer with a frothy head that fades away quickly. Aroma is of bananas and nuts. Taste is bitter, well-balanced and it has a medium to high carbonation. I think it also has an alcoholic finish. Overall an excelent beer.

Old rating rerated 05.06.2014, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet fruity, dried fruits, yeast, grass, banana, citrus, almond cake, bubblegum. Taste is slightly sweet boozy, sugar, grass, alcohol, yeast, dried fruits, hay, almond essence. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel, high carbonation. Nice enough.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2014 Bottle. Pours really nicely, color is hazy amber (little darker), beautiful foam head that sticks to the glass. Aromas are hearty but sweet, mostly fresh apples (Jonagold), hint of dried apricots, generall smell of spices. A deep whiff also reminds of hairspray, due to the alcohol (little boozy). Not overly complex, but very nicely executed. Taste starts fruity and creamy, mild peppers, you can feel the alcohol build up in the mouth. Nice experience. As the alcohol swells the taste develops into a faint but discernible cherry-like sweetness. Beautiful and very well balanced. Aftertaste is apples again. Warmth from the alcohol combines nicely with the aftertaste. Absolutely nothing wrong with this one, would gladly have another!

Robe ambrée aux reflets pourpres et coiffée d'une épaisse mousse
Arôme doux, notes liquoreuses de fruits macérés
Douces et fruitées. Rappel le Porto par ses saveurs fruitées

Kolor bursztynowy. Piana beżowa, głośno syczy przy nalewaniu, bardzo szybko opada. Aromat mocno owocowy: śliwka, wiśnia, jabłko, banan, trochę jakby fermentujące owoce oraz karmelowa słodycz i odrobina nut kwiatowych. Smak na początku przypomina mocne wino, dużo dojrzałych owoców oraz słodycz, w trakcie i na finishu mocno wyczuwalny alkohol, który jest dość dobrze wkomponowany. Wysycenie wysokie, faktura nieznacznie oleista. Dobre, mocne piwo, doskonale rozgrzewa.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo. Colour of dark honey, slightly cloudy with foamy white head. Aroma of malt with sweet fruit, apricot. Medium body, slightly creamy. Fruit tastes linger alongside the alcohol and malt, with raisins, plum and berries. Lasting peppery finish.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2014 Dark brown color, with rich carbonation. Beige persistent foam.
Smell of berries, ripe plum and some cherries. Hops are also present. very Intense caramelized malt taste, with shades of peach.

25 may 2014, tap. Light ruby, clear, no bubbles. Nose is very sweet, fruity, almost fermented bread dough. Med body and moderately fizzy. Rather doughy, very rich, lots of alcohol, rock candy. Pretty good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle pour. Hazy copper with a light brown head. Very bready taste. Bitter from start to end.

Bottle pour. Hazy light copper with large creamy head and good lacing. Medium smooth body. Complex taste with bread, banana, spices. Slight bitter aftertaste, but holds a hint of original taste for long lasting flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
0,3l fles gedeeld met bryanvdv onder de biggengrill, aroma van amandel en banaan mondgevoel is dun en alcohol is wel aanwezig smaak is erg zoet.

Bouteille de 330 ml. Dégustée le 10 juillet 2005. Bouteille meilleure avant fin novembre 2004 donc a peut-être commencé à se dégrader avant la dégustation. Bière brune voilée. Mousse très peu, col mince et éphémère. Assez effervescente, bulles fines à moyennes. Odeur de cognac, de caramel et dalcool. Assez forte, sucrée, un peu amère. Alcool ressort mais pas trop. Manque un peu de caractère et de saveur à part lalcool.
One of my all time favourite go to Belgians - outstanding depth and belgian funk. The Oak-aged are even better

Amber, recht hell für ein Quad. Viel Banane in der Nase, Pflaume, etwas Holz, ganz wenig bubblegum. Am Gaumen dunkle Früchte, banane, schöne säße, malz bei einer angenehm schaumigen vollmundigkeit. Sehr gutes Quad.
Lys brun med lavt/medium skum som faller fort sammen. Aroma av banan, belgisk gjær og malt. Smaken er banan, tørket frukt, malt og gjær. Noe tørr på tunga. Banan og gjær er dominerende i smaken. God!

DAA; Pours copper with a large creamy, leaving lacings off-white to tan head. Aroma is malt, yeast, berries, sour, sweet and dried fruits, spice and nuts. Taste is moderate sweet, sour, light to moderate bitter, complex and lasting. Warning, warming and delicious. Body is medium to full, texture is oily to creamy, carbonation is soft to avarage.
Bottle from polet. Amøber color and off-white head. Aroma of banana, caramel, the taste is very complex malty, fruit, candis and some spices. Full body, creamy? And some bitterness in the end.

Aroma is yeast and plums. Pours a rich amber color, with a thin white head that faded to a thin cloudy haze on the surface of the brew, with thin lacing. Taste is burnt biscuit and citrus, with noticeable alcohol on the finish, but at 10% this did not surprise me. Intrigued, I drank on. There is bananas after the initial booze taste, and definitely the smokiness of finely roasted malts. Would gladly drink again, maybe with Cornish Hen meal ;) Just upped palate to a score of 5. Reviewed this while drinking, finished ten minutes ago, and taste on my palate is toasted biscuits and honey, little butter. This brew just keeps getting better!!
UPDATED: JAN 1, 2015 Egy finom sör, Rita is szereti. Nem lesz a kedvencem , de szerethető. Kicsit talán átüt az alkohol benne. Itt 4,5 EUR, otthon olyan 800 Ft.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2014 Hazy deep amber color, average sized white head. Full body, soft carbonation. Aroma is malt, yeast, dark fruits, spices. Medium sweet taste, light bitter. Strong banana and yeast in aftertaste. Very good.
0,75l bottle. Yep, strong and forceful. Delicious flavor and beautiful pour with high, stable head. Great and undoubtably drinkable.

Pours a nice dark brown/amber color with a thin head. Aroma is sweet fruits, banana, bready, caramel, and a slight warmness from alcohol ester. Taste is much maltier than the aroma. Bread and caramel up front, a slight burnt note (interesting), raisin, banana, honey, molasses. Overall a great beer, very drinkable and warming.
Bottle, 330 ml at Tolkiens House, Zagreb. Pours dark amber with lacing off white head. Malty, spicy and fruity aroma. Fruit and malty sweet flavor. Full bodied.

Bottle, bb 1-2017. Pours hazy amber with a white head. 
Aroma: raisins, sweet apples, banana, slightly alcoholic, light metallic notes. Taste: raisins, plums, figs, raspberries, molasses, honey, banana
Full bodied, lively carbonation, creamy, medium sweet (but never overwhelming), light bitter, medium long finish. Excellent quad.

Bottle.
Nice clear amber pour, small white head. 
Malty nose. Taste is malty and sweet, pretty much what you would expect. 
Medium body, average carbonation.
Clear brown of color with a beige head. An aroma of prunes, raisins, spice, sweets, candy, metallic and weak anis. A flavor of syrup, caramel, raisins, leather, spice, candy and metallic.

Bottle ordered from Beers of Europe, drunk at home. Hazy orange-tan with about 3-4 mm of head. Smells of raisins, candy apples, toast, caramel, orange peel... Very complex & Im getting a lot of things thrown at me. Taste is sweet, woody and fruity moving to crime brûlée. A slightly unbalanced bitter finish, and a thinner mouthfeel than expected, but these are my only real complaints. A nice beer to round off a hard day.

On Tap at the Yard House, Meridian, ID Clear rich redish amber. Nary a head, but a thin skin around the edge, Pitted fruit, plums holiday spice and cinnamon. in the aroma and flavor. Malty and rich, lots of caramel banana maltiness. A bit of an ABV burn at the end. Bananas Foster ?

fabulous beer that never fails! 
the alcohol in the perfume that feels both very fruity in flavor!

Bottle. Light hazy amber with a large tan head. Dark dried fruit, brown sugar, caramel, cocoa, over ripe banana, warming alcohol. Full body, sticky texture, soft carbonation, medium/heavy sweet and bitter. Long light sweet finish. Pretty soft but also a bit sticky.

0.33cl. color ambar oscuro - marron, con espuma persistente. aroma a maltas tostadas, frutos maduros, pasas, ciruelas, en boca es dulzona, se nota en punto de alcohol, con toques a caramelo, galleta, pero con un toque amargo que la equilibra.. en definitiva una gran cerveza, de mis trapistas favoritas

I think this is my favorite Trappist beer. It looks beautiful, the color looks very tasty and makes you wanna take the first sip, the head is very thick, made of very small bubbles and lasts for very long, leaving very nice layer of lacing afterwards. THe aroma is mostly malty for me. The taste reminds me mostly of bananas and the barley malt can be felt too and gives a nice smooth feeling that lasts on the palate for a while. There is just enough bitterness to prevent this beer from being too sweet and dull. If you just want to drink it casually and enjoy the taste, you can use a chalis made for Trappist beer, but if you wanna do it as I did, experiencing the color, the head, the aroma and taste, without being hasty, Id recommend a sniffter or a tulip.

On tap at Garricks Head, Victoria, Canada. Copper, white head. Nose of dark fruit, very little alcohol, heavy malt. Flavour is smooth raisin/currants, molasses, deep malt. Very little alcohol. Deserves to be considered a classic.
Pours a nice rich copper color. Sweet on the nose, with notes of vanilla, banana, and nuts. This follows on the palate, and finishes sweet.

Cervesa que sha de prendre amb calma, en cada glop es desobreixen coses noves.
Cerveza que se tiene que tomar con calma, en cada sorbo se descubren cosas nuevas.

Botella de 330ml. Copa Cáliz de cata. Color ámbar amarronado brillante con tintes ámbar profundo a contraluz. La tupida corona bronceada presenta una retención discreta. Aromas intensos de malta caramelo, alcohol, caña de azúcar, especias. hierbas y notas fenólicas. Entrada gentil de maltas dulces y moderamente tostadas, con sabores de toffees, galleta y un calorcillo envolvente. Cuerpo medio/pleno y carbonatación suave. Sensación en boca viscosa y aterciopelada con divertido toque picante en el paladar. En el el intermedio afloran notas afrutadas, de fruto seco y sutil madera que, junto al bajo amargor, devienen en prolongado y dulce final. En el retrogusto se perciben sabores de albaricoque maduro, pera y manzana horneada que preceden a recuerdos de licor de avellana. Sabrosa, deliciosa y de trago agradable.
330ml bottle. Tasting Chalice glass. Bright brownish amber color, deep amber tints to the light. Tan head is close & shows discrete retention, Intense caramel, alcohol, cane sugar, spiced, herbal & fenolic aromas. Kind sweet, slight toasted malty upfront. Toffee, biscuit flavors as well & involving heat. Medium to full body. Soft carbonation. Viscous & velvety mouthfeel. Peppery & funny palate. Low bitterness, fruit, dried nut & subtle wood notes are shown in the middle & linger into a long sweet finish. Ripe apricot, baked pear & apple flavors followed by memories of nutmeg liquor on the aftertaste. Flavorful, delightful & pleasant drinkability.
Excelente cerveza, color ámbar, fácil de beber a pesar de su qlta graduación, aromas a caramelo.

Pours a beautiful hazy copper with thick off-white head that quickly disappears. Smells of apple, citrus fruit and sugar cookies. Taste is raisin, apples, woody and some bitter dandelion on the middle palate and lingering with more apple in the aftertaste. Crisp and a bit light on the palate. Overall lighter and more floral/fruity than most quads I have had, but solid in its own right.
Light head, light red amber color. Dark caramel and apple aroma, rich taste, date and brown sugar notes. Great goto quad.
UPDATED: APR 16, 2014 Rating #940, tørret frugt, karamel og alkohol. Blommer, bær, karamel, chokolade. God bitterhed. Tyk og blød.-- rated with beerbasher
Not very pleasant aroma of fruits and alcohol. Medium head disappearing to thin layer. Ruby hazy body with unapetizing flakes. Mostly alcohol in taste with some fruits and some alcohol bitterness.
Lichtbruin bier met weinig schuim. Smaak licht zoet en hoppig bitter, caramel en chokolade en vanille. Lange afdronk. Topbier !

750 ml bottle into chalice, bottled on 5/8/2013. Pours moderately cloudy orange copper color with a 1-2 finger dense off white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big raisin, plum, fig, pear, apple, banana, clove, pepper, candi sugar, toast, biscuit, light caramel, molasses, herbal, floral, and yeast earthiness. Incredible aromas with fantastic complexity and balance of fruity/earthy yeast and moderate malt sweetness; with great strength. Taste of big raisin, plum, fig, pear, apple, banana, candi sugar, toast, biscuit, light caramel, molasses, herbal, floral, clove, pepper, and yeast earthiness. Fair amount of earthy yeast spice on the finish; with lingering notes of raisin, plum, fig, pear, apple, banana, candi sugar, toast, biscuit, molasses, herbal, light caramel, clove, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity of fruity/earthy yeast and moderate malt sweetness; with an awesome malt/yeast flavor balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a very smooth, crisp, and lightly slick mouthfeel that is insane. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warming after the finish. Overall this is a world class quadrupel. All around incredible complexity and balance of bright fruity/spicy yeast esters and balanced malt sweetness; and extremely smooth to sip on for the ABV. An insanely delicious offering.
Draft. Dark Amber color. Nice lace. Good body, with nice Belgian flavor. Raisin, a little candi sugar in the flavor. Delicious!

Relly good beer !  







  





  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Couleur ambrée sombre, bonne mousse. Super parfum abricot malt. Gout de sucre candy avec bcp damertume. Bonne pétillance. Fin assez longue amère;
Belle couleur ambrée, riche et équilibrée. Gros hit dalcool, arômes fruits secs et malt. Excellent
Pours a dark colour, retains its head well, taste is candy like with a heavy alcohol finish
UPDATED: MAY 28, 2015 Gai?s, dzintarains ar diezgan noturigu putu. Jutams alkohols dzerot. Smaro patikami, bet diezgan vienkarsi, garso tapat. Vispar labs, vareja but liel?ka bu?ete

Dark reddish amber, very beautiful, fine beige head. Smells of sweet fruits, malts and a bit of yeast. Taste is sweet fruits again with some toastiness, caramel and a pleasant vinous note. Rich finish with some spiciness. Excellent.

Cloudy amber body with an off white head. Aroma is sweet fruit, some dry fig and raisins. Taste is heavy sweet with a very light bitterness. Full bodied, thick texture. Some slight spiciness. Nice beer.
Bottle. Dark caramel with sediment. Figs, candi sugar and caramel. Similar flavors.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, sehr fruchtig, reife Früchte, alkoholisch. Geschmack stark fruchtig, dunkle überreife Früchte, leicht röstmalzig, alkoholisch.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2015 33cl bottle. BBE11/16. Smooth, creamy, yeasty and powerful. Strong rye aroma for some reason. Pours thick trappist, with creamy head. Pure enjoyment, but when compared with the best has a bit less body. Superb beer in general. Everybody will find something new in this one.
Early November 2014: Tap at Drink Baark TLL. Same as bottle. Slightly less fizzy. Still perfect.
30.12.2015 Batch BBe 07-2018 Overly fizzy, thin and quite dull. Down from 3.9 to 3.1. Sorry.

bottle , clear gold color with white head. taste are pleasantly bitter and bit of caramel with some kind of hidden fruit aroma. its a bit sweety taste to hide alcohol. finis is dry bitter with dried plums and alcohol. good quadrupel

Even though I can buy this in the nearest supermarket for 1,30 doesnt make it less tasty. Not much to explore on the nose, but it explodes with flavor in the mouth. One of the very best Quadrupels around and its... available:)
33cl from abbatia.pt, trappist glass. great beer, full bodied great color, taste and good foam head, caramel and roasted maltes, fruity good carbonation long finish,

75cl. bottle. Pours a murky amber color with a one-finger white head. Aroma of fruits - banana, malt and yeast. Taste is like the aroma - very malty and fruity. Full bodied. Very fresh and a good thirst-quencer considering the high - but well hidden - alcohol content...which does come out in the finish. Perfectly carbonated. Very good quad.

Light malt aroma. Clear golden amber colour with excellent head. Light malty flavour with great warm finish. Med body with light carbonation 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Copper reddish color, huge white head. Fruity aroma of banana, apples, cherry, malt, yeast, some spice and floral notes. Taste has caramel, malt, spice, some hops and fruits - mostly sweet with mildly dry bitter finish. Medium body and fizzy carbonation, hint of alcohol. Not very complex for a quadrupel, but quite enjoyable belgian ale.
Gold pour with a nice foamy head, aroma of banana, malt and wheat. Taste is of alcohol, marzipan, and malts. A very sweet beer, not much hops evident in the taste. Delicious

Flot gylden med helt hvidt let men blivende skum. Sød krydret næse. Bitter smag vel balanceret med sødme og toner af sherry. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Clear dark brown pour, slightly frothy head and an aroma of raisins and alcoholic plums. Flavor is also a nice meld of plums, raisins and bready & boozy on the finish. Solid quad.
Trials smell like brandy also taste of strictness very well. Appropriate beer to drink slowly.

Bottle. Reddish brown colour, quickly disappearing head. I failed to pour mine without lots of ugly looking particles. Aroma is very surprising: of raspberry syrup or of strawberry. Also some honey, caramel. Quite much alcohol, but its not unpleasant. Medium sweetness. Good, but lacks the wow factor.

750 ml. corked bottle. Tasted in a La Trappe glass, pours a small head that fades soon, but leaves a good lace. Smell of earth, barn, dark fruits, caramel, spices, raisins. Full body, sticky and oily. Taste of dark fruits, caramel, spices, raisins, some liquorice, dates. Alcohol is well hidde. Great.
Bottle. Hazy copper colour, white head. Very smooth and round taste, nicely balanced. Some toffee flavour, raisins. Slides down the throat like honey.
Ótima cerveja quadrupel. Aromas de caramelo, tofee, smoke, floral. O álcool ressalta no sabor.

330 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy brown almost reddish purple color with a medium sized foamy off white head. The aroma and flavor has ripe fruit, caramel, candi sugar, Belgian yeast, caramel malts, raisins, plums, and figs. Medium bodied, coating mouthfeel. Nice, complex beer.

Bottle at home. 
Hazy dark amber color, white head. 
Complex nose, candis sugar, pine, spicy. 
Medium body, sweet, sugar, alcohol? Noble hops. 
A real belgian :)


:)
Bolton Brew.

From the corked, caged 750 ml. bottle stamped 12:12-K02D13. I bought this about five months prior to rating this. The color is copper-amber with a modest, lingering cream colored head. Loads of floaties and I love that. I thought they were carbonation bubbles. Decent dark malt, yeast, and dark fruit character. Low hop and alcohol profile. The body is full but also a tad astringent or acidic. It is not a smooth texture. The taste also has a decent dark fruit character and a lingering bitterness. The booze expresses itself more in the taste than on the nose.
UPDATED: AUG 24, 2014 A delightful trappist beer from Holland. A rich flavour and the appearance is great too. Always a good choice.
One of the best trappist beer ever from Belgium!!! highly recommended!

Tried at Wilson and Washburn during Omaha Craft Beer Week. The strongest of the special beers. Its flavor is full, mild and pleasantly bitter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Olfactif: Cerises, pruneaux, raisins secs, cassonade, jujube. On y décèle également du caramel et un soupçon dacidité. Très complexe, mais les arômes subtils de raisins secs et de fruits disparaissent assez rapidement. 
Visuel: Ambrée / cuivrée avec de légères particules. Une mousse épaisse, effervescente, rocailleuse, qui descends un peu trop rapidement cependant. La mousse colle moyennement et laisse quelques traces. 
Gustatif: Le caramel et le toffee se présentent en premier laissant ensuite la place à une légère acidité et à une finale effervescente et subtilement houblonnée. Sa texture ronde et caramélisée,enrobée dalcool chaleureux, lui confère un aspect réconfortant à souhait. Son effervescence vive et sa légère acidité, complexifie davantage lexpérience buccale. Par contre, sa palette de saveurs me laisse perplexe; il y manque un peu de variété. Un élargissement serait souhaitable. Néanmoins une bière extrêmement agréable.

A strong beer with a brown color and a white head. Drank it at the La Trappe brewery in the tasting area. Tastes a bit like wine and has sometimes a sweet flavor but the first moments of touching your tongue could be a bit bitter. The beer tastes as a strong alcoholic beer (feels stronger then Rochefort 10 and WV'12). Tastes rougher then those both. 
A good beer.
Een heerlijk maar zwaar bier. Een lekkere volle smaak en goede aroma. Een bier waar je lekker voor moet gaan zitten en rustig van moet genieten.

Review 300. 330ml bottle, poured into Kasteel chalice. A: Dark amber, almost opaque, large, thick tanned head, good lacing. S: Prune, cranberry, molasses. T: Fudge, molasses, plumb, long biscuity finish, brilliant hiding of the booze. M: Outstanding, light body, smooth, well carbonated, seemed to glide into the mouth. O: Deserves a place at the table with the other perceived top Quads. Might have lacked a tiny bit of depth, but made up in other departments.

Nice aroma of belgian beer: barnyard and some yeasty fruitness followed by some malty caramel and warmy hint of alcohol. Beer is bottle contidiones, i poured some sediments to the glass, but it is still quite clear, with deep copper color. Small, stable head, with some lacing. Taste is sweet, bready with bitterness from alcohol. Unfortunelly, alcoholic flavour is strong and it is the main disadvantage of beer.
Sweet, with some raisin tones and spices. A odd one for sure, surpassed by its bigger brother the oak aged quad.

75cL bottle poured into a goblet. Honey, pear, and apple cider are the notes that come off the initial pouring, although the honey and pear seem to slide off into the background if not disappear altogether. After the initial pouring, white grape and raisin take over with lots of sugary, syrupy, sweet caramel. Blackberry and root beer notes fill in some nice background notes on the nose. Deeper down, theres a banana bread-like aroma with a slightly roasted touch. For as complex as the aroma is, the appearance is a bit of a let down. It pours a syrupy, murky copper brown with a very, very light, soapy head that fades to practically nothing; although it does leave some sparse and scattered lacing on the glass. The initial taste on the tongue is almost overwhelmingly sweet. Its a very malty, syrupy, cloying sweet, but it does mellow out. Its still a high / medium-high level of sweetness, but some bitterness pokes through, along with a slight alcohol touch. Once it settles, the taste is best described as a citrus-like sweet and sour (and bitter) with a caramel syrup topping. Its a full bodied beer that feels slick, oily, and sticky on the mouth; its flat as far as carbonation goes. Some lemon and herb qualities come through on the tongue, along with some roastiness and root beer flavors; but ultimately, its the caramel syrup flavor that dominates the tongue. Theres a bit of a vodka-like alcohol note that comes through in the mouth, but its a mellow, high-quality vodka. A resin, or maybe grainy, quality comes through on the finish with some black licorice and an alcohol warmth. The finish is dry, sticky, and slightly astringent with a mostly raisin, white grape, and banana nut muffin flavor lingering.

330ml bottle shared with jeevan. Pours hazy amber, nice white head. Aromas of banana, booze, clove, almond, yeast, spice. Taste has sweet and spicy notes. Interesting, good quad, in a tripel kind of way.

Very bubbly head it has a nice color to it taste like a kwak I had but fizzier

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours mahogany with some red embers and small fleeting head. Beautiful and bold fruitcake aroma - full of raisins, bread and almonds/marzipan. Medium/full body. Has a spritzy, bouncy palate that defies its visual lack of carbonation. Sweet fruit kisses the tongue before belgian yeast and soaks the mouth leaving a very light & short bitter finish. Crafted immaculately.
UPDATED: FEB 14, 2014 Eerste beoordeling. Na een La Trappe blond gedronken. Tot nu toe de lekkerste trappist van brouwerij Koningshoeven welke ik gedronken heb.

Poured into a goblet out of a 750ml bottle.

Pours a clear light brown with a one finger fluffy white head. The color is actually lighter than I though it would be. Really good head retention but just ok lacing.

Aroma is on the spicy side with somewhat of a fruitcake note to it. I also can pick up quite a bit of bread and grain, more so than in other quads. 

The flavor is on the lighter side for the style. Lots of bread grain from the pilsner malt that is not obscured by the yeast esters. Unfortunately, the lack of yeasty notes limits the complexity a bit. Alcohol is completely hidden but the mouthfeel is a little stickier than I like.

Overall, this is definitely a great quad but not top of the line for me. Probably my third or fourth favorite trappist quad.
UPDATED: JUN 18, 2016 Pours a light brown. Aroma of dark fruits and some spices. Tastes of raisins, figs, brown sugar. No hint of the high alcohol.

Aroma: light caramel malts. Appearance: dark brown/black, small white head. Taste: medium to heavy sweet. Palate: low to medium carbonation, sweets continue. Overall: great Quadruple, not a bad palate at all. Bottle at the Dovetail, London.

Ive never rated this? On tap. Big, super creamy head. Almost nitro texture. Very fruity. Mildly sweet and estery, mostly bright fruits. Not the usual dark fruits of a quad. Alcohol content totally undetectable. Enjoyable but nothing spectacular.

bottle. Pours lighter brownish-red, minimal head. Raisins, yeast, banana, butterscotch, light smoke. Lightly bubbly and buttery mouthfeel. Very different than the other trappist quads, but still very nice.
Aroma nach Trockenobst und Pfirsich. Relativ wenig restsüß, starker Kandiseinschlag.
Excellent Belgian quadruple. Great beer wonderful aroma of fruit and spice. Packs a punch with the 10% abv. Would recommend this to beer snobs

A bit of meh here. It's good -- except way too much smokiness. As if a bit of Liquid Smoke was added during the brewing!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle from LCBO. Toronto, Ontario. Poura a cloudy brownish colour with a thin layer of off-white head which disapates quickly. Very minimal lacing.
It has a sweet malty, dark fruit aroma. Its a sweet tasting quad which hides the alcohol well. (10%) It has notes of brown sugar, plums, fig, raisins and well balanced midly bitter finish. It has the right amount of carbonation, medium body, sweet palate.

330ml bottle, pours a clear dark red brown with a bubbly off white head. Aroma is dark fruit, berries, marzipan, a bit of dark chocolate, rich and full bodied, the finish is short with a well balanced bitter finish. As it warms this beer tastes better and becomes more complex. A classic, excellent quad.

Pours dark amber with white, big head. Aroma of caramel, dark fruits, plums, a bit of honey. Maybe a bit of bubble gum, not certain about though. Solid body with high carbonation. Alcohol is potent and gives a great warming sensation. Good, rich beer, although not really in my taste.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2014 33cl in a La Trappe glass. Pours a quite bright orange colour with a white head. Powerful aroma of honeyed fruits (particularly orange) and alcohol. Flavour is dominated by sweetness and fruits - I much prefer an ABT style Quad. Very similar in style and execution to Gulden Draak 9000 although this being the original that is probably more of a testament to the quality of the La Trappe beer than coincidence. The alcohol is overwhelming and to me seems unnecessarily boozy.
Pours a murky chestnut with a creamy white head. Quite a lot of alcohol on the nose. Taste is yeasty.
Bottle. Clear amber with a white head. Aroma and taste is banana, yeast, apricot, caramel, dark fruits. Medium to full body, sweet warming finish.
Bottle. Pours clear hazel with light, persistent head. Immediate taste was malt, fruit and bitterness, followed by banana and caramel. A complex beer and very enjoyable. Didnt notice the high ABV.
I love me a good quad... and this is a good one. Surprising bitter, but the classic fruitiness and slight sweetness in the finish... love it...

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2014 awesome beer! pours a beautiful light red, with a thick lacing head. very bubbly. aroma of toasted malts and toffee. the taste is again, sweet with toffee but balanced well with bitterness. very impressive mouthfeel.
Simply a great beer, all aspects considered. Full in mouth, good flavors, great head...
UPDATED: APR 3, 2014 Good beer purchased from LCBO in a 750ml bottle. good beer, dry fruits, warm finish, with 10% alc. volume, it is hidden rather well making it very drinkable.

Bière cruivrée avec des reflets rouilles, belle mousse pétillante qui se fait entendre et retombe vite comme pour du champagne. Nez de caramel et de banane. Sucrée et liquoreuse, goût prononcé de banane venant de la levure, légèrement boisée, lamertume apparaît en finale. Très bonne bière bien quun peu trop sucrée à mon goût.

Sweet malty nose, bread, brown sugar, syrup, dark fruit, caramel, citrus; hazy dark amber, tiny frothy beige head, vanishes quickly, thin foamy rim remains; sweet roasted and slightly bitter taste, hint of coffee; full body, creamy texture; sweetbitter finish with spicy, peppery sharpness in the finish, alcohol.
Really good beer. Spicy, dried fruity aroma and taste. Warming finish. Very drinkable.

I love a great Quad---smooth and sweet. A little bitter in just the right places. I would recommend to any Quad enthusiast. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very rich malt aroma. No hops on the nose. Alcohol is present but not overwhelming. Great clarity and huge head as is expected from a highly carbonated import from Belgium. Soft white head fades fairly quickly which is to be expected due to 10% ABV. Nice light amber colour. Very malty taste, sweet but alcohol is detectable. Taste is very reflective of the aroma. Creamy mouth feel and good body make this a satisfying, dangerously drinkable beer.

Pours a cloudy ruby red, with s massive pillowy white head. Aroma notes include Sherri, plum, and figs. The body is very fruity, with notes of Sherri, plum, liquorice, breads, and yeast. Not as rounded as other quads, but still excellent.

33cL, bottle. Home. An orange brown hazy beer with a beige fine-bubbles large head. Head not eternal... but that will do. Beautiful lacing. Dominant pear aroma with caramel, alcohol. Definitely fruity note. Makes me think of a fruity candy with alcohol. Welcoming sweetness with light bitterness. Full body. Average carbonation. Sweet finish with small bitter note. A great beer. More welcoming than warming beer, if you follow me. Of course, you can feel alcohol but this is well-balanced with the fruity aroma.

Kaatuu trappistipikariin hieman oranssihtavan ruskeana ja melko sameana, noin sormen paksuisella vaahdolla. Hajusta löytyy vahvaa omenaisuutta ja heikommin luumuisuutta, aprikoosia ja mausteista hiivaisuutta. Yllättävän raikas quad. Maku jatkaa hyvin paljon samaa linjaa: vahvemmin kuivattua ja tuoretta omenaa, kuivattua aprikoosia, kuivattua luumua ja lopussa iskee mausteinen hiivaisuus kevyellä hedelmäisellä vivahteella. Suutuntuma on täyteläinen ja tukeva, sekä hiilihappoinen. Alkoholi pysyy täysin piilossa, vaikka hivenen tuntuukin. Yllättävän raikas ja omenainen quadrupel, joka hieman häviää monipuolisuudessa ihan parhaille tyylin edustajille.
Wow strong and forceful. This beer is amazing. Delicious flavor and beautiful pour!!!

Pours deep brown with thin cloudy cap. Taste is a fruity sucker punch that fades like the last good kiss you had. Fantastic flavour profile with a lot of moving parts that lesser brews would fumble. Alcohol is a slow & subdued burn. A fantastic sipper in this Canadian deep freeze.
Brown wit beige head. Nice malty and candi sugar aroma. Light sweet and smooth with lot of old fruit flavour.

Poured into a St Bernardus goblet. Pours deep hazy brown with decent one finger head. Very sweet aromas of raisins, dates, malts, spices and alcohol. Tastes sweet of caramel, plums, malts, Belgian yeast, light pepperiness, alcohol. Sweetness tapers off in the finish but not to anything Id describe as bitterness or dryness. Mouthfeel is fairly full bodied and creamy. Quite good but not as complex as many of the other Trappists or top quads. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very sweet aroma, which does not translate (thankfully) in the flavour. Some black fruits and caramel. Slight aftertaste of bubblegum, unfortunately. I have a strong eisbock feel with this beer. It misses the body of a real good quadrupel and I get a lot of alcohol over proper taste.

Backlog. Sweet ripe fruits, bananas, yeast. Warming alco with also raisins and cognac. Very smooth and pleasant. Alongside with Rochefort 10, just a bit behind.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Excellente bière , léger goût de caramel et peu dingrédients , bu au pub Édouard ...

Smells nice, raisins and brown sugar predominate. Smells very sweet and somewhat light. Belgian yeasts/spices also show themselves. Light golden color with very very long lasting white head. Very sweet tasting upfront, sweet malt, sugar, raisins, finishes quite dry and a bit of a caramel aftertaste. Quite light tasting and light bodied, alcohol well masked. Not very complex but enjoyable (if slightly too sweet for my taste). Highly carbonated.

Pours a nice brown with thick foamy head that retains well. Aroma was sugar candy and light malted grains. First sip is sweet and smooth. Finishes clean and can hardly notice the alcohol content. Overall it tastes like candy with a bit of wood-flavours. Excellent brew.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2015 Ruikt goed. Troebel, donkerbruin. 10%! Lekker. Pittig. .zoet en erg lekker iig! .....

Herzien van 4.0! Blind geproefd: wat donkerder, erg helder. Ruikt zurig, niet lekker. Enorm zoet, quadrupel oid? Niet mijn ding vandaag, meer wat voor bij de open haard.

Pours dark copper, a light head. Some herbs on the nose also some sweet notes. Burnt sugar, caramel, fruits and a hint of chocolate on the palate. Wonderful. (Rating backlog, tasted on or around 02/0213)
Bottle. Lots of alcohol in the aroma and taste.Sweet and fruity taste. Overall: 15/20.
0,3l Flasche. Beste Bier on La Trappe: Dunkelbraun mit hellem Schaum, tolles Aroma nach getrockneten Früchten; Im Antrunk etwas süßlich, sehr malzig vollkommen ausgewogen. Grandioses Bier!
Red and golden with nice yellow foam. Malt, candy and alcohol in the aroma. Candy, malt with alcoholic bitterness in the aftertaste. Medium body high in carbon. A nice one

Nice heads, which unfortunately diminishes rather soon. Wonderful, and slightly unclear, cooper colour. Aroma of dried tropical fruits, figs, tokaji and candy sugar. Some alcohol sweetness. Round mouthfeel. Perhaps a bit on the sweet side.

Flaske delt med importør Ovesen, en fin aktivitetsdag på Holmen: vidunderlig aroma med kandis, modne plommer, bitterappelsin og alkohol. Det klassiske belgiske skummet svinner raskt, men aroma, smak og munnfylde bare varer og varer. Blir varm i magen og mild i sjelen.
On tap at the Town Crier in Toronto. Flavourful and easy drinking with a strong hint of red licorice. An enjoyable quadrupel.

Draft to taster. Looks alright; light for a quad though. A hazy deeper golden orange with off-white lacing. Smells solid; Belgian yeast and dark fruit with a fairly sweet backbone. Tastes like it smells with some caramel too. Nice and smooth on the palate. Enjoyable.
Buena cerveza quadrupel para el otoño o para disfrutarla en las largas noches de invierno en compañia de amigos
Cerveza ambarina de espuma blanca. Olor afrutado, a uvas dulces. Sabor muy dulzón, a miel, azucar, uva, con bastante presencia alcohólica en el fondo de la boca.

The strongest of the special beers. Its flavor is full, mild and pleasantly bitter. Quadrupel is presently available in the autumn, is bottled by the year and is perfect company for those long winter evenings.
Fles 75cl. Goudgele kleur. Witte schuimkraag. Eerste smaakimpressie : wauw!!!!!!! Zoetig, bittertje. Heerlijke quadruple!
Nice, clear golden color. Strong salmiac smell. Sizzling carbonation. Also salmiac taste. Lacks complexity.
UPDATED: MAY 8, 2014 Dark amber with fizzy head. Aroma of dried fruits, specially sweet plum. Medium body, fizzy palate and champagne-like bubbles.

aroma: malt, quite sweet, wildberries (dried plum, raisin), strong aroma; appearance: absolutely no foam, disappointing appearance, doesnt look inviting; taste: very sweet, dried fruits like plums, raisins etc., cinnamon, biscuit, strong and thick body

Pours a cloudy orange with little head. A fragrant beer, almost perfumy, with spicy sweet notes. Taste is burnt brown sugar with a nice berry like tang. Light on the palate with good carbonation. Hides the alcohol well until you finish the bomber.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Color deap amber to Reddish brown. Smell of dark fruit and ripe bananas. Taste in a word, heavenly! Nice dark fruitiness, dark cherries, raisins, Plums, grapes. Very sweet like exquisite candy. A little alcohol burn but not too much. One of the best Belgians I have tasted.
33 cl bottle at home. Aroma: fruity, ripe bananas. Appearance: amber, clear, nice white head that lasts. Medium to full body, medium carbo. Taste: midely sweet. Palate: creamy, nice finish. Y
Bière noire très puissante, proche de la Rochefort 10, pleine de fruits cuits, très longue, un peu sucrée.
Aromas of juicy dark fruit, dark candi sugar, and spicy phenols. Clear ruby with a fading off-white head. Off-dry, fruity with some earthy cocoa notes. Medium bodied, sticky.

The color of this beer is an opaque brown with a medium white head that fades fairly quickly to a ring, and the aroma blends Belgian yeast, caramel malts, and booze. The taste is mildly sour and slightly sweet, and the palate combines a lively carbonation, a medium body, light texture, a finish that is mostly abrupt but is malty while it sticks around.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2014 Light amber golden with massive creamy white head. Sweet dried fruit smell along with roasted malts some alcohol. Plums/raisins at first and then comes along the warmth of the alcohol. And then a fabulous bitter sweet aftertaste. Medium to full with nice fizzies. This is one beautiful quadrupel trappist. Not because of its complexity but more because of the amazing balance it has. Really smooth and extremely drinkable.

Bière extrêmement bonne, gout de mielbtres prononcé, fruit rouge en 2ème bouche, un régal de bière, douce et savoureuse, du grand art trappist , la meilleure trappist que j ai goûter.... Felicitation pour ce délice...
Nice lacing on creamy foam head. Light carmel color. Fantastically mellow flavors. Hints of banana

A dark amber hazy body that also has large single particles floating around. The large head has a light tan colour and leaves some lacing on the glass. Nose has caramel, raisins, dark sugar and some floral accents. Taste is sweet with caramel, raisin and prune notes. The finish is long and dry. Carbonation is lively with large bubbles and the palate otherwise is quite rich without being too cloying. Very nice and easy to drink.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2013 In fles. Mooie amber kleur met een mooie kleur schuimkraag die snel verdwijnt. Smaak impressie: volle smaak. Lekker bittertje en ietwat zoet. Kortom een goddelijk biertje oftewel drink hem!

33 cl bottle. Aroma: fruity, ripe bananas. Appearance: amber, clear, nice white head that lasts. Taste: midely sweet. Palate: creamy, short finish. Overall: I really like it, it got better from start to finish.

Bought a bottle at the supermarket. The beer has a dark amber color and a nice cream colored head, CO2 level is excellent. Fruity aromas of banana and tropical fruits, with lovely notes of almond and vanilla. A beautiful combination of soft sweetness of raisins and subtle burnt of the malt. It also has the fruity notes of banana and apricots. The warm intense flavor is full and well balanced. The finish is lightly burned and pleasantly bitter with a sweet aftertaste. A really nice quadrupel, one of best beers in Holland.
Good strong trappist. Big bold flavor and not overly boozy considering the 10%. Has everything you expect from the style but not much more. compared to e.g. a rochefort 10 it lacks caracter.

Bottle. Semi-foggy, brown. Big light brown head vaporates quickly. Aroma has ripe fruit and wood. 

Taste has orange, nut, malt and apricot. Very rounded with a bit bitter aftertaste. Alcohol is pretty well hidden, coming through just a bit after the middle.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2015 0,33 bottle, BB 06.2016. Aroma is very intense: yeast, sweetness, fruits, plums, banana, very faint hint of dryness. Pours hazy amber-copper with nice white head. The head stays for a long time. Taste is very fruity and sweet with noticeable bitterness and rather strong alcohol. Finish is long sweet-bitterness. Medium carbonation. Overall: nice and interesting beer, but the taste of alcohol hides a lot of nuances that may be there. Rating: 8:4:7:4:15=3.8

BB 10.2016. Less alcohol, more balanced, very fruity and sweet with some nice bitterness. Aging at least a year or two improves this one a lot.

Rating from 4.2.2008: Sehr schön süffig-vollmundiges Bier, dem man seine 10% kaum anschmeckt. Schön rund-süßlich, leicht hefig, schön langer milder Nachgeschmack. Nicht herb! Sehr schönes Bier! --> 12.15

Pours cloudy brown in color. Lingering creamy head, strong hints of fruit in the aroma. Complex taste of banana, figs, dark fruits and yeast. Overall the fruits stand out the most giving it a rather light taste for a Quadrupel.
On tap in Delirium Monasterium. Ruddy amber in colour. Fairly classical strong Belgian in style, quite yeasty, malty, full flavoured and sweet, and yet decent balance. Not overly boozy, its good.

Tasty. Pours brown, beautiful aroma notes of candi sugar and figs. Flavor is complex, but not too heavy. Dark fruits, Belgian yeast, and caramel are noticeable. Shocked to see that it is 10% ABV. Excellent sipping beer.

Butelka 0.3L. Bursztynowe z dużą ilością pływających kłaczków. bardzo bujna krenowa piana przy nalewaniu ale znika w niecałą minutę (pewnie wina wysokiej zawartości alkoholu).
W aromacie można wyczuć banany, przyprawy, alkohol, karmel, aromaty kwiatowe, owocowe. Ogólnie aromaty słodkie, złożone, bardzo przyjemne.
W smaku dość podobnie słodkie kwiatowo-owocowe z wyczuwalnym alkoholem ale nie przeszkadzającym.
Ciała dużo, wysycenie średnie do wysokiego, perliste.
Na finiszu lekko słodkie z alkoholowo-chmielową goryczką.
Niezły trunek na jesienne chłodne wieczory.
Dark fruits, caramel, a little sugar. Well, actually everything you can ask for in a Quadrupel is in there. Like to drink a cold glass of water with it because of the strong taste.

Cerveja de aroma adocicado e com malte. Quando desce se sente sabor de frutas, pêssego e outras frutas doces. Sensacional.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cloudy red brown. Huge sweet bubblegum and candied banana aroma with hints of caramel, brown sugar, and alchohol. Very sweet flavor with dark caramels, brown sugar.

A nice sweet smell of fruit, caramel and flowers. An amber color with a small white head. The taste is sweet with a good flavour of caramel, nuts, yeast, apricot, figs and some earthy. It also have a little hint of alcohol, but not enough to spoil the taste.

Small bottle from Evergreen Discount. Dark fruit, Belgian yeast, candy sugar, caramel, light chocolate and light alcohol. Pretty nice as it warms up. Medium to full body with a smooth feel, light carbonation and a warming finish.

Dark amber with small fluffy head. Banana, mango, slightly woody, cream, tea, dark sugar. Quite fruity. Taste is sweet, with a tart fruit touch, and a nice bitter finish. Mouth is medium, average carbonation. Nice beer, but as far as trappist quadrupels go this is not among the best.

Zaskoczyła mnie dość jasna barwa tego piwa jak na styl. Ten jasnobrązowy napój jest dość złożony, choć mógłby być jeszcze bardziej. W zapachu drożdżowe, nuty owoców suszonych (rodzynki) i świeżych (śliwki). W smaku treściwe, rozgrzewające, nieźle schowany alkohol atakujący znienacka, dość łatwo pijalne jak na styl, karmelowo - owocowe ze sporą dawką przypraw. Trunek szlachetny, choć nie z najwyższej półki.

Amber colored Dutch beer, really nice taste. Quadrupel is strong and not recommanded to drink a lot of this beer on a night.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle BB 2015. Clear dark red, sparkling, really big foamy white head. Smell - alcohol, berries, very malty, nail varnish. Body - not too foamy for a quad, touch of carbonation, medium body. Taste - smooth malts, jam, balanced and integrated sweetness, alcohol adds a bit of tingle but its not at all sharp. Overall, this is a very good quad. Enjoyable.
Great beer, a wonderful quadruppel!!! Roasty, cereal, cereal, cereal, roasty, toast, citrus, roasty

On draft at Bier Markt Toronto. Pours a murky, translucent, caramel colour with a half-finger, off-white head that thins to a film.Aroma is big dark fruits. Raisins, vanilla, and a pitted fruits.Taste sweet but balanced very well. Dark fruits blended with mild vanilla, caramel, and peach/apricot. Mild fruity/spiced aftertaste.Medium-full body with a medium carbonation. A touch slick in the mouth but still clean, creamy, and with an effervescent carbonation. Very nice mouth feel.Overall I?m really liking this. Awesome aroma, taste and texture. Will buy again for sure. Cheers!
Bottle from Albert Heijn. No idea what to say... Like a dandelion and burdock spiked with vodka and opiates?

Backlog purge. 750 mL bottle that I had had lying around for years. Dark mahogany pour with a fizzy tan head. Aromas of spiced figs, maple syrup, chocolate, grapes. Flavor follows, rich sweet toffee, fruitcake, prunes, figs. Really nice quad.

Parallel taste with La Trappe Blond. Upon pouring, the off-white solid foam filled the 20cm tall glass to the rim and retained well before slowly diminishing to be a thin ring around the edge of the glass that produced scattered bits of very fine lacing. Visually unappealing. It produced a clear dark amber coloured liquid that was well carbonated with lots of small bubbles. Aroma of malt with strong hints of clove. Compared to the Blond this one is very sticky sickly sweet with touches of plus alcohol bitterness. Light to medium body. Light sweet finish with taste of alcohol as well as cloves. Worth trying.

How have I not rated this beer? I have drank it countless times. Oh well, here goes nothing. Brown pour with a white head. The aroma is awesome. I get a good dose of caramel and molasses as well as some candy sugar. The flavor is similar. I get a lot of brown sugar and caramel notes, as well as some dark fruit - cherries and grapes. There is also some candy sugar notes in there, as well as some alcohol. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Awesome beer.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2013 My first quadrupel and I like it a lot.
A special La Trappe taste :)
Next one please!

Poured a hazy brown with tints of amber. Beige head, little lacing. Aroma of caramel and spice and dark fruits. Flavor is immediately woody, sweet, caramel, dark fruits, smoky, and much more. Every sip has a new flavor quality. Not boozy. Creamy mouthfeel. A very complex drink. Finish is quite sweet with no bitterness.
Poured dark brown from the bottle, aromas of pitted fruit, and yeast. Flavors followed suit, light caramelized pitted fruit, a tad sweeter in the aftertaste than I like, but solid none the less.
Last one in the La Trappe tasting. Quad Ive had before but first in a while. Pretty nice. Definitely fortifying. Quads can be a little much but this is sipping pretty great.
Mahogany colour with small beige head. Aromas of banana, sweetness. Taste is again sweet (caramel), coffee and thick, oily. Exactly right level of carbo. Alcohol well hidden. An excellent beer.

Perfect for the autumn in amsterdam. Bottle at 10 degrees. Dark and punchy but perfectly placed. Caramel herbs and wood. Did not get the bubblegum often quoted but interesting and warm. Very enjoyable

Bottle - pour reddish brown with a thin head. Straight up hit of bubblegum, fruit, coriander and doughy yeast. Some sweetness from the alcohol up front then thing slowly dry to a lingering bitter finish. Nice mouthfeel creamy with slight carbonation.

Great looking beer, dark amber with a persistent thin creamy head. Boiled sweets and bubblegum aroma that disguise any other smell. Taste is sweet with some malt thrown in. Slightly bitter after-taste. Far creamier in texture than other quads. Velvety on the tongue and dangerously drinkable.

Herbaceous/Bubblegum/Banana on the nose, alcohol notes.

Lovely dark amber color, though not as dark as some other quads Ive enjoyed (St B, Rochefort). Lovely fine lacing.

Boozy, leathery, dark fruit notes on the tongue, faint presence of an unidentified but familiar hop. Slightly spicy. Bubblegum flavor is present in the taste too, but more of a background flavour. 

Mouthfeel is nice; slight carbonation that feels pleasant on the tongue and a lovely suitable thickness for the ABV.

Excellent beer.

Dark color.
Aroma of yeast, dark fruits etc.
Taste of alcohol, dark fruits with a metallic aftertaste. 
Very strong. Not the best Quadrupel but its still a very nice beer.

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2016 The aroma is like heaven: peach, banana, strawberry, bread, caramel and a significative mix of spicy phenols. Very clean golden color with a white long lasting white head.
Medium bodied (FG = 1016), balanced between sweet and bitter with a sour hint given by the yeast. Its the only quadrupel which is not dark: an unique beer in its style.

Klar bärnstens brun med snyggt brun-orange skum. Doft: Sött råg bröd, banan, hemma gjord söt frukt sallad, belgo jäst, övermogen kiwi. Smak: Sött lite juligt bröd, banan, och så vidare dvs. mycket samma som doft. Rund och jäkligt trevlig.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2016 Pours a clear amber with a nice white head. Complex and fruity aroma of apricots, figs, dried fruits, malt, caramel, banana, toffee, yeast, spicy notes. Body is full. Very sweet and sugary, with a touch of alcohol noticeable. Syrupy and sweet, but I like this Quad. Its a little more fruity as opposed to malty/spicy than most examples of the style.

Had this off a tap in Amsterdam trappist bar in town, was so good and creamy. The bartender would not give a third beer, he said too strong for a woman. I told him I am American not Europian woman so my tolerance is higher but he still would not give me a third beer, I was so disappointed. But this a great beer with smooth taste of coffee and caramel chocolate finish.

Bu en bouteille de 33cl dabs un verre Trappe Quadrupel. Une couleur ambrée et une mousse qui descend vite haut taux dalcool oblige.
Une bière vraiment appréciable, car malgré la haute teneur en alcool elle est très peu alcoolisé au goût, on trouvera donc une petite pointe de fleur doranger en début de bouche et une fin caramélisé du plus bel effet.

Poured a massive cream colored head. Flavor of alcohol was strong. Bright mouth feel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma is a sweet citrus, nutmeg, taste has some mild dried apricot and malt sugars. Full bodied smooth and crisp. This is probably one of the few quads I could drink a pint of because all its characteristics are fairly subtle. Nice.

750ml c&c bottle (labeled Koningshoeven Quadrupel Trappist Ale) shared thanks to dmac. Unkown vintage. Pours a flat dirty amber brown color with no carbonation. Aroma is boozy, with notes of sweet caramel, dark fruit, and spices. Taste is flat, oxidized, boozy, caramel, dark fruit, and spices. Not good!

This is horrible. Opened flat as can be, poured a totally lifeless ugly brown. Aroma is super sweet, almonds, wet nuts, sugar, figs, dates, prunes, plums. Body has no carbonation, syrupy and hot. Flavor is dates, nuts, brown breads, sugar and alcohol. Meh
Une des meilleurs bière que jai gouté, à boire entre 8 et 10°c elle a un bon gout fruité et on ne ressent presque pas ses 10° dalcool. Je recommande aux amateurs!

aroma of apricots, banana, alcohol, rum, leaves, cherries, cucumber and caramel. palate is oily. taste: coffee, caramel, metallic, sweet, banana, wet wood, alcohol and a bit of smoke, rum and hints of cloves in the finish. color: amber. 
a very nice beer, strong but very pleasant to drink!
Nice aromas with Raisin and raspberry notes. Malty taste. Alcoholic in mouth. Good beer

33cl en pression, proper glass.

Nancy, France 

Appearance: amber orange with small tan head and lacing.

Aroma: caramel, alcohol, yeast, fruit 

Taste: sweet, some bitterness.

Palate: medium-heavy body. Oily texture. Average carbonation. Very long finish. 

Overall. I favorite out of the bottle, first time on tap. Id love to try them Side by side, but I think i like the bottle better. Still a really nice drink.

Dark brown, creamy head. Sweet notes on the nose continued in the taste. Soft caramel, slightly buttery, a tad too sweet overall. Medium aftertaste not adding much to the palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A strong and decreasing flavour, going to a soft aftertaste, maybe too alcoholic.
Hazy amber color with small head. Aroma yeast and dark fruits. Flavor is sweet, yeast, malt, fruits. Delicious!
Perfect. This beer is perfect. It has the exact right amount of carbonation, it is perfectly balanced, sweet, alcohol, bitter, dance in perfect harmony.

Bernsteinfarbig, weisser cremiger schaum, aroma leicht alkoholig fruchtig (banane), geschmack leicht nach banane, honig und caramel, süsslich im abgang/nachklang, kaum herb

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Oh this is lovely. A dark, dull, copper colour with a thin lively white head. Lively carbonation. A malty, roasted chestnut, raisin, dark fruits aroma. The taste is sweet, dark, fruity. Banana, slight fig taste. Its thick, like syrup and full. The alcohol is very well masked by the vibrant flavours.

Very well rounded.
Sample at a tasting. Amber/mahogany body with almost no crown at all. Dried fruits, plums, belgian yeast, sugar, roasted malt. Well made but too sweet for me.

Strong aroma of malt, raisins, prunes, dark fruits and Belgian yeasts. Well balanced between residual sugars and alcohol. Ive sipped 0.75 l bottle for the whole evening - this beer is extremely drinkable. Even though the its 10% strong with very oliy palate its still tempting you for another sip. I like how it was slowly releasing its aromas and taste along with raising temperature.
The finish is sweet, malty and fruity with hints of earthy tones. Very friendly quadrupel.

AR: Caramel aroma. AP: Dark orange caramel color, white head. T: Medium sweetness, light bitterness. P: Full body. O: excellent beer, alcohol is hidden but present ! One of the best quadrupel beer !!!

Bottle, I think about a year old. Pours with a big ruby soft soapy head and color, good lace. Aroma is fresh red currants, bread with a bit pepper. Flavor is candied currents, spice, pepper, slight yeast, lots of malt, bitter orange ed. Feel is lively, silken, dense, opens up my nose, tingling long finish. Really very nice and full of distinct character though not so deep and complex as I was expecting.

Deep orange colour, with a medium white/yellowish head, nice lacing. Smell gives sweet liquorous notes. Taste is fruity, red fruits, cherry, and alcohol too. Not really bitter, well, quite sweet I would say, but in a perfect way! perfectly balanced.
Full bodied, oily texture, with some alcohol burn, but controlled. 
Thats a great beer.

33 cl, flaske, 10,0 %, nydt på Café København, Hillerød, 5. oktober 2013.
Flot rav- og karamelfarvet Quadrupel med offwhite farvet skum, middel boblende, på ca. 2 cm.
Dejlig duft af tørret frugt såsom abrikos, vinøs duft. Smagen indledes lettere syrligt, hvorefter sødmen kommer i samspil med en bitter alkoholtyngde. Sidstnævnte er tydelig, men smagen er rund og fyldig. En øl med lang tydelig eftersmag, hvor sødmen er der, men aldrig bliver overdøvende. Middel kulsyreindhold. En nydelse i Slow Driking! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Brown. Lots of fizzy, white head. Raisin, sugar, alcohol, malt, burnt sugar, earthy aroma. Sweet. Thick mouth feel. Warming. Very good!

Malty with perfume fruitiness. quite yeasty. Nicely balanced, bit too sharp alcohol bite - so good luck to zenkis.. if its is matured +1 year, should be good. Sweet with some bitterness for balance.
Hmm.. really nice brew.. would be great if not that perfume
Tastes alright. I wont get this beer again though even though I think its alright. A
UPDATED: JUN 25, 2014 The taste and aroma are strong and complex. You can feel fruits, raisins and caramel. Strong beer, but alcohol is masked. Totally recommended

This is heaven in a glass. Rich, complex, fruity uber-Belgian flavor. Hints of banana and caramel- in a good way.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at the World Beer Festival - Columbia on 01/22/2011.
Clear copper body medum frothy off white head
Sweet spicy malt with fruit and sugar.
Very sweet spicy flavor with lots of sugar fruit and molasses
Med body high carb
12oz bottle pours a hazy gold with a tan head. Sweet bready malt aroma. Taste is the same. Great beer

Shared a 33cl bottle from the local supermarket. Pours a dark amber colour with nice tan lacing. Aroma is toffee, malt and light alcohol. Medium carbonation and full body. Flavour is a mix of bitter and sweet, without notice much where one starts and the other ends. Great beer!

On tap at Csakajósör, Budapest. Clear, golden brown colored beer with medium, white head. Fruity, tutti-frutti odor with yeast. Candy sugar, fruits, banana aroma. Much alcohol, but it doesnt desturbing. Yeast, malt and sugar. Medium sweet taste. Creamy texture, medium to full body, average carbonation. Fruity, alcoholly finish. Sweet beer.

0,33l bottle. Copper color with nice lacing. Aroma is fruits, yeast and spices. Taste is sweet with fruits, raisins and spices. Alcohol is also notable. Its very nice beer with complex aroma and taste.

Couleur ambre foncé et opaque avec un col beige stable. Larôme est des fruits, de malt et dépices. Le goût est très similaire, mais très légèrement sucré, et lalcool est très bien caché pour un tel haut ABV.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2013 750ml bottle, poured into a beautiful La Trappe goblet, cloudy dark amber, with a small creamy beige head that leaves a lasting lacing. A complex aroma of apricots, dark fruits, figs, banana and spices. A strong and also complex taste similar to the aroma, very smooth and somewhat sweet. Low carbonation a creamy mouthfeel with a medium-high body. This is one of my favourite quadruples, should not be consumed cooler than 10 degrees celsius, because then you really miss out on the flavour and can slightly taste the alcohol.

I like it! Pours cloudy dark amber with a thin white head. It?s got lots of flavour with a pleasant bitter aftertaste. It really packs a punch. Even my girlfriend likes it and for a 10% beer that?s an achievement.

Color café oscuro, con delgada pero solida espuma. Cuerpo robusto, con notas de maltas, frutos rojos y frutos secos (almendra). Vainilla y maderas en el aroma y un fuerte retrogusto a alcohol y un sabor ahumado irreconocible. Una cerveza con mucho carácter, producto de tradición trapista de Bélgica.
Nose is complex, a hint of malt, a hint of citrus, and a bit of fruit. Excellent taste, with a great fruity finish.
Poured from a cold bottle. A golden orange color, slight white head. Malt and alcohol aroma. Clove, alcohol and bread taste. Yummy.
Mooie laag schuim die snel weer verdwijnt. Heftig aroma, cirrus en rood fruit. Amberbruine kleur. Krachtige zoete smaak, de eerste La Trappe die me bevalt, lekker!

750ml bottle. Lots of complexity -- wheat, yeast, dark fruits, caramel, florals...but also a small hint of something tinny, medicinal and amoniac. Would have rated much higher without that (admittedly very slight) off flavour. Failed to meet my lofty expectations.

Tap at the Refuge in San Carlos, as part of a quad flight.

Surprisingly light colored pour. Delicate dates and caramel; much lighter mouthfeel -- practically delicate -- compared to the other quads. Very nice.

A little too much alcohol taste and first impression was disappointing. After a few sips, however, wakes your taste buds to life and a reasonably stable Quadrupel emerges with nice sweet caramel undertones.
Picked this up at Randall's in St. Louis. Great beer. Bubblegum and dark fruits. Raisins and plums. Slight alcohol. But overall great.

33cl bottle.
Tan head, quickly small but persistent.
Nice Amber color; once opened strong aroma of banana, caramel and bubblegum, after a while alla disappears leaving a cough medicine aroma; initially taste melon and banana, then sweetness go up (too much imho) along with alcohol and medicinal taste... Disappointing!! Medium carbonation. Final is sweet without bitterness.

Nice...always wanted to try this Trappist. Opened up while cold and got pure bubblegum from the tulip. after letting it warm a bit the flavors got so complex as to not even be able to pinpoint.
