Almonds, banana, rock candy, sweet bread. Alcohol was not overwhelming. Good malt. Still trying to figure out that initial taste. Not a lot of funk. Would for sure drink again but its 50 cents more than StBerardus Abt12 which rules the roost IMHO. Buy and enjoy.
(bottle) hazy dark amber/light brown. Sweet aroma of dark fruit and yeast. Tastes like fizzy raisin juice.
Buena cuádruple, muy muy suave en el paladar, no se nota el alcohol y tiene ciertos sabores a frutos secos delicioso. He repetido ya varias veces ;-)
Strong quadrupel with a mild mouthfeel and some notes of fruit. Basis is sweet, with off course roasted malt and a modest bitterness.
30cl bottle at home. Hazy dark amber with a nice white head. Banana, dried fruit and some caramel. A strong sweet beer with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Medium body with medium/high carbonation.

(750mL bottle from the LCBO cellared 2-3 years) Pours a clear mid-weight black tea colour with a head of reddish-tan froth, no real lacing. Aroma is fruity from both malt and yeast. Candied pear, fig, brown sugar, slightly vinous, banana esters, bit of dough and a mystery tang. Flavour very malt-sweet to start: pear, caramel-apple, fig, banana, at mid-palate theres a bit of a dry toasty character, doughy yeast, kind of banana bread-esque, slightly nutty. Sweet malt core carries through to the finish, alcohol heat definitely noticeable despite age. Body is full and oily, carbonation active at first but softens nicely with time, does not really hide its ABV too much. This is a good quad, a little on the lighter side in fruit profile but the relative dryness is appreciated, a nice sipper.
Amber color with tiny off white head. Banana yeasty nose, the taste starts the same but develops in to a dark fruit sweetness. Complex, malty. The booze is hidden. This grows on you.

Aroma of apples and pears. Amber color with blotchy head. Tastes like apple pear juice with alcohol. Medium body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
God God God God God God God God God God God God God God God God God God God God God God God God God

This pours medium brown color with a fizzy, off-white head. This has a very full body with banana and yeasty flavors. There are lots of complex flavors that deliver a very good brew. Very well made and well worth the try.
Lys amber farve med beige skum. Lukt av frukt, malt og honning. Smak av frukt, malt og honning. Bittersøt avslutning.
Tynt sittende skum, gul brun farge. Frisk duft av humle, citrus og frukter. Frisk smak av honning og citrus men en fin ettersmak.

Draft. Very creamy like texture. Slight alcohol after taste. Amber red color. Very estuary like. Figs are definitely prevalent. Tastes like funky baked bread in a good way 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A case of brewers overreach: theres just too much of everything, too many flavors, too much alcohol, too much sugar, too many aromas, all battling it out... Interesting, though, and I like a brewer to take this kind of ambitious approach. They might consider a more ambitious design for the label, too, the fake medieval calligraphy looks tired.

Dit bier is reeds lange tijd mijn absolute favoriet. Er nu een neutrale beoordeling over schrijven zal dus niet zo eenvoudig zijn. Allereerst het aroma. De geur van La trappe Quadrupel is scherp en uitgesproken zoet met een subtiel banaan accent hetgeen wijst op de hogere gisting. Het bier nodigt uit om te proeven, zowel qua geur als qua uiterlijk. De amber kleur is vrij transparant en mits gebruik van het bijpassende glas krijg je de perfecte schuimkraag. Het mondgevoel is verrassend aangenaam, zacht bruisend. De textuur van het bier draagt ertoe bij dat de smaak lang draagt op papillen en achteraan in de mond. De smaak is vol, zacht zoet met toetsen van banaan en een discrete fruitige ondertoon die doet denken aan rode vruchten. De smaak is in perfecte harmonie met het aroma. De afdronk is vol en rijk en doet je verlangen naar de volgende slok.Voor mij is la trappe quadrupel één van de betere trappisten, met en zeer unieke doch toegankelijke smaak.
A bit sweet, and I found the alcohol taste quite blatant. Still, it was delicious, but I wouldnt pay $5 a bottle for it again.
Cloying, thick, banana bread beer...a shame considering the complexity of the aroma. I am not impressed. I will say however that they did mask the alcohol quite well.
Nice, very strong and complex beer. Caramel and bread. Light sweet taste at the end.
Caramel, bread, nuts, toast, floral, spruce, butterscotch, clove, smoke, quadrupel and 10%	of alcohool
sweet, strong smell. dark brown color that looks thin for the ABV. Strong taste in back of tongue, with lasting flavor.

Amazing beer so rich and creamy and beautiful to look at with its orange/red glow. It does the same thing that decadent dark chocolate does to you. Its an orgasmic thing. It touches your soul in some way. Holy, inspired, majestic. flavour is rich and finely balanced. Malty sweet, slightly burnt, and pleasantly bitter with a sweet aftertaste and offers aromas of banana, almond, vanilla and others.
Mooie roodbruin bier met een volle schuimkraag. Geur is zoetig met kruiden. Smaakt zoetig en iets zwaar met carameltonen.
Candi on the nose. Sweet and wonderfully round. Utterly balanced. Sweet carbonation slowly fizzes out on the tongue

Appearance: Clear copper/amber, finger thick ivory head.
Aroma: Initial note of pear, then strong banana, touch of prune, fig, raisins, fruit cake, yoghurty, vinous and slightly biscuity.
Taste :Medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, cognac, warmth of alcohol, banana and hint of caramel.
Palate: Full body, thick texture, prickly carbonation, quick dry astringent finish.
Comments: Superb, I wish I had bought more than one! Left a glass lace.

Bottle. Pours an Earthy Red colour.

Taste. I can taste bubblegum, banana custard, bitter orange and a general spicyness.

Overall. A very good beer, certainly not for the amateur beer drinker.

Pours with a amber red color and small white head which quickly disappears. Fruity sugary aroma with touches of yeast. Smooth taste, feeling of alcohol nothing overwhelming. Overall not bad but there are definitely better Trappists.

Bottle. A slight gusher. Deep reddish brown copper with small head. Aroma of rich fruits and spices. Taste is spices, rich fruit malts, some alcohol warmth and a touch of sweet sticky toffee. Quite a bit of carbonation and a touch oily. Nice.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Heerlijk biertje. Beetje zoet maar toch verfrissend. Heel mooie kleur en aanzicht. :-)
This wonderfully delicious beer is the one that got me interested in good beer. Revisited last night on tap at Luca's Italian restaurant... and it remains my favorite Quad.
poured into a chalice.... hazy light brown with average head and lacing... smells of plums and sugar.... smooth and not extra boozy. great beer

Poured from a bottle into a trappist glass, it is a nice reddish brown in color, nice velvety head, the aroma is very nice fruity with possible fig, raisin, caramel, feels very smooth feel of the carbonation. Nice warmth of alcohol it really is a pleasure to drink. A really wonderful beer.
Pours light brown with large bubble head. Flavors of bananas, vanilla, bread, ginger with healthy alcohol warmth on the back end. Good, but not my favorite Trappist.
Bottle, rated from backlog. Dark amber with orange-beige head. Aroma and taste: dark fruit, malt, caramel with light hops in finish. Really nice quad

Some sediment present inside of a red amber colour. Muted aroma but there is some belgian esters, bannana peel and malts. Boozy beer with a yeasty and banana flavour profile but I find this one this, especially for the style.

Pours a copper beer with a not very long lasting white head. Smells pretty good.  Sweet tones. Taste starts a bit to sweet for me but changes into something better. Dont like the texture and the carbo.
Pours dark copper, brown colour with off white head. Aroma has some sweetness in it, caramel, dar fruits. Taste is the same, taste of bread also. Medium carbonation, well balanced.
Trinity Hall - Not bad.  Definitely something you take your time with.  Very strong.  Not for amateurs.

750ml bottle. Dark amber pour with lots of suspended particles. A lot of yeast esters and deep sweet maltiness. The palate has lots of stewed fruit and the yeast still plays a big part in the flavour profile. Finishes slightly warm.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2013 Colour: Amber
Nose: Fruit (apricot, orange), chocolate, sweet coffee notes. Nice.
Flavour: Sweet malt (biscuits) orange peel, herbs, alcoholic.
Finish: Long, somewhat bitter, alcohol
Verdict: Fantastic Trappist. Complex, great mouthfeel.

Bottle. Pours hazy dark amber, looks lighter than other quads. Dried fruits, banana and caramel aroma. Sweet with typical quad flavors and light alcohol presence . Mouthfeel is thick and sticky. Great quad.
Bottle at home. Smells like a sugar candy stick. And some fruits. Light head. En for me to mutch carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2015 330 ml bottle
Amber-orange beer with off-white dense persistent head. Hazy without yeast, murky with it. Aroma has banana, sugar, yeast, apple and dark fruits. Flavor has caramel, dark fruits, banana and apple. Palate is quite full and foamy. Finish has medium bitterness. Aftertaste has yeast, candyish sweetness, dark fruits, toffee, herbs and light tartness. Adding the yeast makes it taste more like yeast and fruity. Also seems to add alcohol taste, which otherwise feels all around. Decent. A lot paler and lighter than other quads. Still enjoyable.
33cl bottle. Pours cloudy amber with thick head. nose has fruit and malt.  sweet sticky fruity taste with lots of alcohol but not unplesant.  smooth mouthfeel.

750ml bottle.  After about a year and a half in my cellar, I cracked this behemoth open.  Pours a hazy reddish orange with some sediment floaters.  Aroma is sultana raisins, light orange peel, golden syrup, mineral notes, ripe banana, yeast, caramel, and hazelnut.  Smells like dessert in a glass.  As for taste.  Whoa.  Sweet, with dried fruit, Lyles Golden Syrup, dark maple syrup, alcohol, spice, light earthy notes, yeast, and a vegetal note in the hot finish.

Ambrée légèrement trouble, dépôt en suspension, belle mousse qui se termine en un col fin. Fine amertume, petites notes de fruits rouges, caramel sucré, un rien dépices, alcool peu présent malgré son ABV. Assez subtile et bien équilibrée!

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2013 Pours cloudy amber with minimal beige foam,  lasting not long. Aroma of berries, malty sweet,  maturation thing, alcohol pungency a bit, yeasty but not like dubbels, astringent, above medium body, thick mouthfeel. But overall im not satisfied cause this seems like good belgian strong ale,but quad to me is more darker, yeasty, fruity patterned, with complex flavor. This one is more like enlish old ale ir belgian strong ale. 
update: tried also frop tap @La Trappe brewery - totaly different beer - dominant yeasty, fruity patterned, with dubell or quad characteristic sweet sugary, syrupy or caramely backbone, complexity in flavor, shorter - really quad like except I suppose it must be dark one. Well anyway - it was good.

Bouteille très jolie comme toute la série de La Trappe puisquelle est uniformisée.
Nous sommes aujourdhui face au grand chef sioux : la quadruple. 10 % abv au compteur,
attention il va faire chaud sous le tepee !!
Liquide très joli, sur une couleur ambre profond à roux.
Clarté limpide, milliers de bulles fines partout dans le calice.
Mousse beige claire de très bonne texture, crémeuse.
Arômes sur la levure, les céréales, une pointe dorange, puis de la prune, figue, poire cuite,
et une petite pointe dépices des Indes (noublions pas que la bière vient de Hollande, mais
très près de la frontière belge, à côté de Tilburg).
1ère bouche à la texture suave, aux saveurs très construites, partant dune terre de moisson,
pour aller vers le blé mûr, avec une pointe de coriandre. Arrière-bouche un peu épicée.
2ème bouche avec une pointe de girofle sur du bois et des fruits mûrs. Saveurs pleines, larges.
3ème bouche crémeuse, complexe au goût, forte mais avec une rondeur de céréales.
Arrière-bouche un rien poivrée.
Longueur avec du malt à whisky, de la muscade et coriandre, un rien de girofle.
Levure douce, splendide, lisse, tendre.
Alcool magnifiquement dosé, lent et calme, mais chaud sur la longueur.
Finale où la bière se développe pour souvrir comme une fleur, et livrer tout ce quelle 
contient dans sa fabrication.
Cette finale est le propre de toute grande bière. Les quadruples sont dans lobligation,
par leur cahier de charge, de répondre pleinement à ce critère. Sans quoi, il ne faut même
pas parler de quadruple, mais de brunes, même si le degré dalcool est élevé.
Pour cette Trappe quadruple, tous les critères sont respectés, et même au mieux quun
pauvre humain puisse le faire, fut-il trappiste !!!  Ite missa est.

Draft to goblet
Bubble gum, caramel, and orange. Hazy reddish amber with a thin off white head with a bubbly center. Taste is sweet, almost cloying, and yeasty. This is medium bodied, silky and oily. This sure kicks a punch.

Poured into a goblet. "19:14" and "K17L10" on the bottle, if that means anything.

3.5 A: Murky orange mahogany color. One finger of creamy off-white head. Retention is okay for the ABV and a short ring of lacing is left.

4.5 S: Wonderful nose on this. Earthy and fruity - prototypical of the region. Dates, figs, plums, prunes, raisin, and tobacco. Light pepper and clove yeastiness. "Clean" earthiness. All the aromas blend together really well. Quite impressed.

3.75 T: Tastes like the nose, except that its much, much earthier. Usually I wouldnt mind this, but it distracts from the fruitiness. Fruits mentioned above with a light spicy yeastiness. Still good.

4.0 M: Lighter medium body. Pleasant, spritzy carbonation. Smooth.

3.75 D: Tasty beer. I was in the mood for something just like this.

Serving type: bottle

01-31-2013 07:08:56

Bottle at Kaisla, Helsinki. Pours reddish brown with a medium-sized head that leaves lacing. Sweet aroma of raisin, ripe fruitiness, caramel maltiness and a little spiciness. Taste is medium sweet and very malty: malts and yeast provide the flavours in this ale. It is full of sweet malts and fruity and yeasty notes - especially caramel and raisin are strong. Delightfully full and smooth palate. A hint of alcohol in the long, rich finish doesnt ruin much - this is a top quality beer with rich malt profile and a balanced, full palate.

Superbe robe ambree surmontee dun col genereux alimente par une bonne carbo. Des aromes fortement fruites tirant sur la poire. Une belle rondeur en bouche peut etre un poil trop sucre. Le final est vraiment sur les esther mais le tout est vraiment une biere dexception.

330ml bottle.pours a dark caramel/copper/orange with very thick cream coloured head. aroma is sweet and rich. of toffee and caramel with fermented fruit. taste is brilliant. really thick and treacle like. has to stay in the glass for 15 mins though before drinking. really silky smooth. bitter and sweet at the same time with such a minimal taste of alcohol.

What a quad should be. A crisp Trappist Quad. The color is a light amber. Delicious bit of yeast flavor. You have a trace flavor of the alcohol. Let this beer warm to about 45 to 50 degrees to let the aroma out.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,33 l bottle   BB 08/15. 
caramel, chocolate, roasty, citrus, herbs, bubblegum, raisin, vanilla, red-brown, hazy, frothy, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, sticky, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

The body has a dark copper colour that is slightly hazy with some bigger particles. The egg-white head isnt big, but after it has settled as a very thin layer its fully lasting, and the lacing is excellent. The aroma is very strong, sweet and complex. I get delicious notes of Belgian yeast, dark dried fruits, spices and caramel. Moderate to heavy sweet taste with a moderate bitter everlasting finish. Strong flavours with lots of caramel, dark dried fruits (but not as dark as other quads, not as intensely raisiny), dark candi sugar and pleasant vinous notes. Also honey and spices in the back. Perfect mouthfeel with a full body and oily texture. The carbonation is lively, but the bubbles are so infinitesimally small that it still feels lovely smooth. A stunning quad! 
[33 cl bottle, gift from espenra (thanks a bunch, mate!), enjoyed 2 years before BB date]

Murky brownish-amber. At the start of the glass the alcohol seems poorly hidden, but it seems to improve as it goes on.  Smells tasty, like brown sugar and some fruit. Has that funky belgian Trappist yeast flavour. Raisiny sweetness, which fades into a bit of sourness and ends on a bitter note. Not my favourite quad, but not too bad, definitely gets better as it warms up... and as the alcohol takes effect.
Een amber kleurig biertje. Sterke smaak met een.soepele afdronk. De alcohol.is best aanwezig. Lekker biertje!

Bottle 0,33L. Hazy amber colour with a finger of creamy beige head and lively visible carbonation. Nice aroma of caramel, herbs, dark fruits, brown sugar and roasted malts. Medium to full body, oily texture, moderate bitter taste and heavy bitter aftertaste with dark fruits feeling on tongue. Alcohol warms a little, but its not overhelming.

Pours a nice brown-amber with a foamy tan head and lacing. It has a great aroma of dark malt, apricots, plums, and raisins, along with a faint alcohol background. The flavor is dark fruit and malt up front, followed by a slight honey-like sweetness and a balanced, earthy, sweet finish over a medium-heavy body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A dark red beer. The nose is of nail polish, not the remover, the polish. Very pear-droppy. An aggressive burst of alcohol and brown sugar. Some nice dryness though. Milder but also sweeter as it warms. Some tight bubbles but a really silky finish.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2013 Appearance: deep orange with some amber and gold shades as well, very clear, has a very thick dense beige head, lots of lacing, looks great Aroma: plum, raisin, alcohol, lemon, coffee, molasses, sweet, very aromatic Taste: plum, molasses, raisin, some hops come thru at the end Palate: soft carbonation, very heavy mouthfeel, leaves a bitter aftertaste Overall: I enjoyed this a lot, its aroma stands out, its high abv so keep that in mind
Rerated on 12-1-13. Bottle has been in fridge a while and says 16:03 and K26F12. Beer is very cloudy with particles floating in it. Color is brown or very deep amber. Pours with an average head that is off white in color. Smells of raisin, gingerbread, plum, pumpkin, green apple. Taste is of plum, raisin, alcohol, slight bitterness in aftertaste. Has a very heavy mouthfeel, not much of an aftertaste. Number rating represent second tasting.

Appearance: really nice head to the beer, does not dissolve quickly, nice amber semi translucent color, very dense head with a good amount of lacing, two inch head with a nice foam top
Aroma: malty and wheat key note
Taste: strong malty taste at the beginning then it slowly dissipates, complex flavor and the flavor changes through the sip, can tell this is a higher alcohol beer but the alcohol flavor is very tasty, leaves a good aftertaste
Palette: tingles tongue, slight bitterness 
Overall: a great beer and has a ton of flavor, can tell this beer is brewed with experience


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from czar at blind tasting. An orange-amber with a resilient white head. Aroma is mostly....uh...plastic. Flavor is caramel, sugar, barley candy. Finish is, sadly, cough medicine and strong (read: almost fake) cherry. Medium body, average carbonation. Highly disappointing, the low point of the abt/quad blind tasting, for me.

Descent beer, I have to however that with its very high scores i was expecting more and I think that affected my opinion of this beer. All around it was a good beer, thick bodied, complex flavor, but I found it to be far too sweet for my taste.

Direkt från kran prövningsrummet vid klostret La Trappe! Jag gillar egentligen inte den här typen trodde jag, brukar föredra besk och "sträv" öl, men .... Den här milda, mjuka, mustiga ölen utan någon som helst beska var fantastisk! (Kanske miljön hade något med det att göra)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

@ ABT blind tasting. clear copper-red with a small off-white cap, some retention and lacing. perfumed and plastered caramel, some phenols, boring lager fruity esters. soft carbonation, medium body, sweet, decent grassy-herbal and lightly spiced finish. kind of failed..
September 2010. From bottle. Poured copper color with an offwhite head. Sweet aromas of dark fruit, brown sugar and spice. Semi-sweet finish.

Pours a semi cloudy dark amber brew with a big white head with good retention, aroma is heavy sweet and low bitter with spices, anise, prunes, and banana, robust bodied, flavor is heavy sweet and low bitter, sweet finish.

Bottle - pours cloudy amber with off white light foamy head.  Nose of malt, cherry, booze.  Taste of sweet cherry, boozy aftertaste, slight dry finish.  Very smooth and carbonated mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2014 From bottle. Dark translucent amber color.  Aroma of plum and brown sugar. Really sweet taste of molasses, fig, brown sugar, but I like sweet. Smooth aftertaste compared to alcohol content.

330  bottle. Pours a dark copper with medium persistent head. Aromas of heavily roasted malts, brown sugar, dark fruit, and spices. Flavors of burnt sugar, sharp resin, banana/yeast and multiple spices.

2013/04/19 - pours a translucent orange/amber color with a thin off white head. Aroma is yeast, plums, banana and raisins. Taste is similar to nose with sweet, dark fruits up front and an oaky, warming, boozy aftertaste. Mouthfeel is thick with sooth carbonation. A disappointing Trappist quad.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at bar. Light brown color, white head. Sweet taste with plum, earthy notes, honey, ripe fruits, herbs and cinnamon. Nicely balanced body, the high ABV is very well hidden. Sweet finish with fruits and herbs. Magnificent quadruppel.

Pours orange amber with a beige head. Aroma of traditional belgian beer-candy, ripe plums, concentrated candy (flagermuse), almost synthetic feel to it, weak floral notes, toffee, raisins, banana and dark sugar. Taste has that same belgian beer-candy with a lot of sweet stuff going on. Not that cloying and almost no hint of alcohol. Nice.
Glass bottle dated Oct 17, 2012. Dark brown colour and ample head. Raisin and banana,  sweet caramel. Alcohol comes through but not offensively. Very complex and enjoyable, as most quadrupels.

Bottle . 
Pours dark blonde , not nearly as dark as expected 
White layer of foam 
No smell 
Way to high carbo ! Sugary , sweet , malts , not complex like a quad should be . dissapointing ..

Pours semi-red brown, but clear. Thick white head. The aroma is sooo much candy! Banana, dried fruits, flowers and caramel.. A little perfumed though. The balance is not overwhelming. The perfume is in the taste as well, but some rum and more caramel comes to my mind. Well hidden alcohol, but probably because of the really intense candy!

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2013 A hate to say this as i am a Tilburgenaar but this is one of my least favourite Quads...way too sweet and the sweetness is not balanced at all! fresh(2012) bottle though but still
Well. Sweet, very sweet, lots of fruit, but the sweetness is not balanced out at all. Hoped for better.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 75cl bottle. Shared with Mathieu87. Tasting of the 12 first La Trappe Quadrupel Oak Aged variants, together with the original beer (La Trappe Quadrupel).
Appearance: amber beer, large stable head.
Nose: sweet, hints of bananas, some liquor even.
Taste: sweet, bananas, malts, caramel, rather fruity.

Appearance: Nut brown with a cream colored head.
Aroma: Brown sugar, alcohol and dried fruit.
Flavor: Lush, sweet caramel malt with dried plums, figs and spice.
Palate: Full bodied with moderate carbonation.
Overall: Flavors just keep unfolding. An immensely satisfying Quad.
From my own database, without comment. Will update when I re-rate this beer.

30 March 2013. 330 ml bottle. Caramel (light brown) colour and a thick off-white head and a lot of lacing. Notes of malt/sugar, fruit, yeast, spices and alcohol. Moderate sweetness and light bitterness in the taste. The alchohol gives it warmth. Full-bodied with a creamy and somewhat fizzy sensation in the mouth.
300313. Bottle at home. Pours hazy dark brown with a small head. Aroma caramel, dark sugar, plumes. Sweet overtall taste. Not Bad.

Bottle pours a hazy burnt orange with a full tan head, lighter than most quads. Good retention, nice lacing. Aroma is a bit like wine, peach, grapes, some alcohol. Taste is very sweet Belgian yeast, cereal, banana, dark fruit, and a hint of alcohol on the finish. Tasty at ten percent alcohol.

Bottle, Monoprix, France. Pours golden caramel, with a large white head. Aroma is fruity, honey, sharp alcohol, some toffee and dough. The taste is fruity and sweet, some toffee, light alcohol. The aftertaste is kinda herbal and grassy, slightly bitter, some fruity notes. It also has a certain taste of bubble gum. Its pretty good, but not my fave of the Trappists.

Bottle. Aroma fruity, grapes, strawberries. Colour is lightly hazy darker amber. Taste is mostly fruity, but also light chocolate. Finish is fruity and a bit of alcohol. Good, but not particularly impressing. I will probably try to re-rate asap.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2013 Amber coloured beer with a creamy froth. The smell of banana, butter and a fresh undertone. Sweet with bitter tones. 

Update
Today 27-9-2013, the 75cl bottle edition 2008 tasted. The label says good until dec 2008.  This edition is really improved by the extra maturing. So I disagree with the "good until date". This version scores to my opinion 4, 2.

Aroma fortíssimo de caramelo e malte. Sabor adocicado, com lembrança de caramelo, um leve toque de álcool, canela e especiarias. Belo corpo, linda espuma, cerveja saborosa! Arrisco a dizer que a melhor degustada até hoje!

Pours a hazy auburn color with stood head that fades very slowly with ample lacing. Aroma of dark fruits, some malt, caramel sweetness and spices with a hint of alcohol. Taste of malt, fruity, caramel sweetness and spices. Distant bitterness and a dry finish. Fairly moderate body, smooth with a complex character that is enhanced as it warmer. Good beer for the style. Well with checking out
Dark brown colour. Thick head and good retention. Caramel, malty flavour. OK beer but largely unexciing.
Bottle. Pours a hazy dark amber color with a slight reddish tinge to it. Nose has some dark fruit elements to it with some subtle maltiness underneath. Taste is a tad sweet to me. OK.

Head: beige foam. Colour: dark brown. Aroma: malt, fruit, laurel. Taste: licorice, chocolate, bitter sweet. Palate: full, medium CO2, medium bitter finish. Overall: very nice.

Dark amber with a thick, lasting, frothy, lacy off-white head. It hugs the glass. Smells a bit of cloves, yeast, alcohol, caramel, malt with light raisins and a perfume or apple organic element. Full oily body with soft nice carbonation. Tastes of toasted malt at first with sweet biscuit caramel with orange, plum, and raisin in the centre and then moves to a bitter lasting alcohol filled finish with yeast. I would think that after some time the alcohol and the yeast would cancel each other out. For the moment, it seems a bit strong. Well balanced but it needs a year or two to even out.
bottle pour into a trappist glass.  Feelin the Dutch love here.  micro carbonation

A tasty Trappist quad but definitely not the best in show. 33cl bottle from QVID.be, cant recall the price but approx 1.90, exp date 01-2016.

Aroma is beery, carmelly, complex ..too complex for my little head.

Pours with a frothy white head and fills the chalice belfry slowly fading to thin blotchy head familiar to all Trappists. Definitely a lighter colour that the Abt 12s from Belgium.

Taste is very warm  and winters, smooth and drinkable. Its not my favourite of the genre, but its a fine beer and readily available in the Benelux, more o than even St Bernardus.

Very complex tasting beer. Dark clear amber color. Good lacing. Minimal head. A nice beer for a winter afternoon. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very nice beer, full palate, fruity and pleasant sweetness. Nicely ballanced.
Had a few ounces in a sampler glass, so not the best rating.  Cloudy orange and beautiful.  Aroma and taste are sweet and fruity.  Very sweet taste.

Bottle:Aroma with notes of caramel, malt, candy, alcohol hints of herbs, light fruitiness.  Amber color, off-white creamy head with good lace. Sweet malty flavor, notes of candy, sugar, alcohol, caramel, bitter hops. Merdium bitter, herbal finish.

Dark red/amber coloured beer with a large creamy head. Aroma of malt, hops and grass. Fruity tones of citrus, orange and with a hint of caramel. Taste of banana, caramel, and some alcohol in the finish. Also some darker fruits. Smooth and creamy, full body. A really good beer.

Smells of Pears and figs and beautiful fruits. Looks like a brandy or whiskey almost. It was a little too smooth for me (almost like a pop that has went flat). i would have liked some more bite but it was honestly the best beer I have ever had. My first Quadrupel actually.

Bottle. Appearance is a coppery amber color with a cap of beige foam and bubbles. Aroma is a blend of caramelized sugars, raisins, grapes, spiced bread and yeast. The taste offers up a heavy dose of caramel, Belgian yeast and candi sugar upfront followed by a mix of dates, figs, honey and toffee. Also some oak and alcohol notes throughout each sip. Mouthfeel is thick and creamy with moderate carbonation and a dry, dark sugary finish. Overall, an enjoyably sweet and rich Quad with plenty of flavors to chew on.

Pours amber-gold with a diminishing, fizzy head. Aroma is of citrus, vanilla, fresh cut grass, and fruit esters. Taste is sweet, with dark fruit, caramel, nuts, honey, and alcohol. The beer has a creamy consistency, with light carbonation, full body and a long finish with alcoholic warmth. Very nice!
Bottle. Pours hazy amber with profuse but airy off-white head. Clear aroma of malt and fruit. Sweet, malty and caeamellish flavour with a fruity note. Pleasant, sweetish finish. Yum.

Pours a deep amber in colour with a nice ruby red tinge, mostly clear but with plenty of floating sediment and a small creamy tan head. Aroma is heavy in fruit: apples, grapes, peaches along with a strong floral scent. Taste is sweet throughout, but not overpowering with an underlying bitterness. Full body, lively carbonation, smooth on the palate. Overall an exceptional quad, really glad I aged it for several years.

Deep murky orange with brown muddy hues.  Craterous off-white head.  Aromas of dried oranges/tangerines, slight dark fruit, prune, sweet biscuity bread, yeast spice, and a touch of alcohol.  Flavor is more dried fruit/dark fruit, slightly acidic, and finishing with a sweet baked cinnamon bread, yeast, and spice.  Sweetness lingers, yet a fairly well-attenuated, mildly dry finish.  Tacky, sticky mouthfeel with some residual fruit acidity.  A good example of the style.

Aroma: fruits, nuts?, caramel?, bread?; Appearance: dark amber, hazy, big strong, off-white foam; Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, light sourness, little bit of alcohol; Palate: full body, smooth feel, little oily, soft(+) carbonation, long dry finish with alcohol warmness; Overall: very good, which I consider as a dissapointment ;)

11.2 oz bottle pours a hazy amber color with huge fluffy off-white head.  Aroma is full of bananas, cloves, prunes and bread with a bit of honey.  Taste is slightly sour at first with a sweet finish.   Body is medium to full with lively carbonation yet a creamy mouthfeel.  Alcohol is present but well hidden,  An excellent Belgian quad.

completely smooth and refreshing with a lil sweetness and a great finish def a good beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at beer bistro.  A bit sour. Somewhat spicy. A decent Belgian beer               

                                     

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Strong fruity aroma mixed with a hoppy touch, strong alcohol taste with a finish of molasses and minor sweetness, clear golden appearance

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

~Aroma of dried banana, prune, fresh soft bread and clove.
~Pours a hazy amber color with lasting creamy off white head.
~Spicy clove flavor that is well balanced with dried banana and bready flavors.
~The mouthfull is amazing. Like biting into a fluffy cloud. Full bodied and very fluffy. High CO2, very soft bubbles.  Sweet bready clove finish.
~Damn fine brew.  Wish I could get this fresh from the brewery. Well done.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2014 Ive been looking forward to trying this for some time.  Superb, lightly spicy aroma with caramel malt and hints of honey.   ABV well hidden. The light spicing in the nose is much more obvious in tasting.  Rich flavor but too sweet, although this settles to a very fine aftertaste.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2016 amber colour; (due to the high alcohol content) minimal off-white head; aroma of candy sugar, banana and fruity notes; taste of brown sugar, dry fruits and banana with well hidden, though present alcohol; great quadruppel

33 cl. bottle.Copper colored body, lively, bright; head is moderate sized, off-white, small bubble. Moderate effervescence and creaminess, high persistence. Excellent lacing. Aroma is powerfull, malty. Banana, bread and caramel; a little of resin, black sugar, flowers, toffee, vanilla, bread... Very deep and complex. Medium to full body, very creamy. Medium carbonation; leaves a sweet and very nice sensation finish. Taste is sweet, tasty, fruity (banana, caramel, licorice). One of my favourites.

Bottle from monoprix.  Smells like sugar or maybe pears. yummy! Red with lots of bubbles.  Tastes pretty good, but boring.  Maybe like caramel.  Its certainly not bad, but not great.  medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish.

Its ok I guess.  For 10% beers, there are  a lot better.

330ml bottle. Pours slight hazy amber/hint of orange with a thick, very short lived white foamy head. Aroma is esters, hint of malt vinegar, Flavour is red apple, red grapes, sour pear, yeast, brown sugar and banana. Medium and full bodied with a long complex finish. Alcohol warmth builds throughout. Lovely syrupy texture and low carbonation. Delightful beer.

Excelente Quadruppel trapista, essa breja dispensa apresentações! Cor âmbar, com intenso aroma remetendo banana, frutas secas e cravo, ótimo corpo, bem equilibrada. Paladar com amargor médio e gosto frutado, porém com drinkability espetacular. Uma cerveja sem igual!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: MAR 1, 2013 Légèrement amer, cette quadrupple laisse un arrière goût agréable et aromatisé pour longuement profiter de cette bière. Idéal à savourer quand il fait moins beau.
Light hazy amber colour with a beige tiny head. Noses of basement aromas, hay, sweet malty. Light fizzy and medium bodied. Texture is oily and the finish is lasting pleasantly on the palate.
Eerste slok is wat sterk, donker, best heftig bier. Daarna wordt het wat zoeter en heeft het een prachtige nasmaak. Een erg vol biertje met mooie vanille tonen.
Amber brown colour, white head. Low carbonation. Taste of figs, banana and raisins. Balance between sweet and bitter.
Draft at BierCraft, Vancouver. Medium tan, estery nose, slight head, lacing. Medium body, long and complex finish with hints of white fruit. Really nice.
Brown sugar and raisins in the nose with a touch of earthy hop.  Brown with a foamy off white head.  Balanced between full malts and earthy bitterness.  Medium plus bodied with a balanced finish.
UPDATED: AUG 9, 2013 Draft at BXL East. Pours rich dark brown with small off white head. Aromas and taste of dark fruits and yeast.
On tap in Sao Paulo. Dark brown with a full, off-white head. Bready malts and dried fruit (banana, fig) aroma. Nice mouth-feel. A well made quad.

Bottle 75 cl. Cortesy of Rex Talionis. Pours hazywith a small head. Really yeasty but smooth with some nuts in the taste. Aftertaste is nicw sweet and smooth. Smooth is the right word to describe this awesome beer. Rex Talionis suggested that this tastes little to raisins and dades i agreed and then didint since i dont like raisins. A great beer after gauloise.
Bottle at sampling session. 2008 or 09 vintage. From notes.  Banana sweet nose. Sweet but some good balance in mid palate. This one has matured and maybe is right at its peak.

Bouteille 750 ml. 10%. Couleur ambrée foncée, moucce brune mince. Arôme de malt, levure, agrumes, poires, un peu de bananes. En bouche, raisins, alcool, fruits noirs mûrs, pain. Finale, fruits noirs, alcool, sucre. Très bonne.

Tap at the Birch Norfolk VA. 2011 version. Pours clear strawberry amber. Medium yellow foam dissipates quickly. Spotty lace. Nose is sticky candy, twizzlers, candy store, gold raisins. Taste is pretty cloying, papery, one dimensional. Sorry, cant get down with type of beer anymore. Fiancé refused to drink it.

Pours a medium copper color with a two finger foam that settles out fairly quickly. On the nose there is a big dose of banana bread, sweet brown sugar, light warm spice and a bit of fig too, The palate is a lot of the same and my mind keeps going back to the banana bread flavors... chewy spice with a mild yeasty backbone leads to a pretty clean focused finish. Not bad but doesnt stand up to some other quads in its price brackett.

Lively carbonation, slightly cloudy red/orange with beige foam. 
Strong nose already apparent while pouring, banana and fruity with in the background hops. 
The taste reflects that banana fruitiness in the first sips though it doesnt take long for the pretty strong alcoholic attack to come through. Reminds me of a very powerful tripel-like taste, overall quite sweet in a fruity, rather than sugary way. 
Theres a distinct alcoholic afterglow, the banana remains but is less outspoken and a bit more of the tripel characteristics lingering (quite bitter and hoppy), not such a long lasting aftertaste. 
Sort of an ultimate tripel but not what I would expect from a quad when comparing to the likes of Chimay Bleu or Rochefort 10

A little too sweet for me. Bugger of a cork to remove. Little to no head or foam. Might go great with a steak.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours an average frothy off-white head that fully diminishes. Body is hazy and sparkling, with amber color. Aroma contains molasses, lemon, dough, banana, raisin, plum, tawny port, brown sugar and alcohol. Flavors goes from light acidic to sweet to light bitter. Complex, balanced, mmmmmm!

Rusty reddish brown with big head and good lacing.  Highly carbonated.  Smells of raisins and cherry with some alcohol apparent and malt lingering in background.  Some dark fruit sweetness up front with cherry that mixes with alcohol giving a cough syrup taste followed by phenolic and fuesal alcohol.  Some rum quality perhaps with a warm bready aftertaste that envelops your mouth.  Medium mouthfeel with stickiness that holds one.  My least favorite Trappist beer because of phenolic and alcohol taste.  Somewhat generic. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bbe 01-2012 , sweet malty aroma, plums. normal head which dissappears fairly quickly, fizzy, brown/purple colour. taste is light sweetness. body is surprisingly light,  slick feel, soft carbonation, short sweet finish.

alcohol is noticable on the nose and finish but doesnt disturb.
330ml bottle at home. I really enjoyed it. Dark orange color with white head. Aroma is yeast, nuts and spices. Nice thick taste.

Bottled somewhere in the beginning of 2011, this brew has a really enticing aroma. It is full of caramel, spices and alcohol. Taste is sweet but not cloyingly so. Alcohol warmth is really subdued and makes for a dangerously drinkable beer. Balance is toward the malt side but it may be because of the age on the bottle. A+

Dark amber beer with a big foamy head. Aroma is banana bubblegum, medicine and urinal with some slight Belgian yeast mustiness. Taste is surprisingly full, with all kinds of dark fruits in there but there is a growing sweetness which lingers on the tongue, and an alcohol warmth on the throat. It is quite nice overall but very sweet. It would pair well with cheese or chocolate.
Nederlands enige Trappist. Vol van smaak, fijn, veel gist, veel banaan. Goed bier.

0.33l bottle. Dark orange body, off-white head. Aroma of banana, dark fruits, yeasts and caramel. Tastes like banana, caramel, yeast with a decent level of spicyness. Long lasting aftertaste with noticeable alcohol. It really tastes like a very good weizenbock for me. I love it.

Bottle at tuulensuu, tampere. Hazy reddish brown color, small white head. Aroma of suryp, banana, plums, alcohol. Nice full body taste, plums, banana, low-medium co2, hint of alcohol, sweetness. Definitely nice trappist.
Mooie robijnrode kleur, goede kraag. kruidachtige smaak (geen idee wat precies) beetje dun in de mond, maar zeker een van neerlands beste bieren. Bier om verliefd op te worden!!

Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Deep and clear amber in colour wit low but steady head. Nose of fresh yeast. Taste of rich yeast, low malt, light honey and brown sugar. Very easy to drink, very delicious, intensive and enjoyable.
Bottle shared with  McTapps. Nice nose of yeast and vanilla. Pours in amber with medium head. Tastes sweetish with some alcohol. Good and quality one but not a rocket (as usual from the trappis).
Amber. Big, fluffy, lasting head. Ripe fruit, belgian yeast and spices. Alcohol well masked. Great beer

Amber color with big off white head. Aroma of butter,  malts, citrus, nuts, floral, a bit ginger may be. Taste is sweet, light sour almost no bitterness. Medium body, lively carbonation, oily texture. Pretty good beer.
Good taste. Not astringent at All. I belive there is some Out, I could be wrong. Makes it very smooth. The sweetness is not very Strong. Complex beer with a good evolution. Totaly worth it.

33 cl bottle from De Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Enjoyed at home. Large fluffy beige head on a clear, sparkling copper colored body. Spicy, wooden Belgo yeast notes, orange, rock sugar and dried fruits on the nose. Rich and pungent aromatic sweetness and alco warmth. A fruity bitterness comes through midways to balance it nicely. Grows smoothly in the mouth. Full bodied. Delicious to swirl around in the mouth and smooth to swallow.  Long and powerful finish with lingering flavors and finally a dry dry tongue.

Pours moderately dark golden brown colour with medium head and decent lacing. Fruity yeast aroma with burnt caramel a touch of citrus. Wonderful. Creamy full body. Pleasantly sweet with a slightly burnt taste. A lingering finish that leaves a touch of warmth in your mouth.

750ml bottle from the LCBO. Wanted to tryout my new Westvleteren glasses with a nice Quadruppel - 11th best Quad, as opposed to #1 Westy which I'll leave for Christmas.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad
This is by far the best trappist ale Ive had to date hands down.  I cant give any negative points about the brew. Straight up tens and fives in my book!

Bottle. Dark amber, copper, hazy. Nose is full of belgian yeast, candi. Caramel, some raisins. Body is med, a bit oily. Cola.  A smooth nice belgian quad. Lots of candi and yeast. Feels almost like drinking a starter of wyeast 3787.

Appearance:  Hazy orange in colour, nice creamy white, visible effervescense.
Aroma:  Earthy, fruity aromas, oranges and herbs, some vinegar like alcohol vapours.
Flavour:  Very tangy fruit flavours, some burnt toffee supports the fruity profile, balanced well with a bitterness that really impacts the back of the tongue.
Mouthfeel:  Woody texture, nice alcohol warmth, medium body, long lingering finish, malty at first and then bitter in the aftertaste.
Overall:  Wonderful belgian quad, great fall beer for those shorter evenings.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2012 @FlesL 500cl, diep rood/bruin met minimale kraag.
aroma van gerstemout, hop,en banaan
smaak: medium zoet, medium bitter, licht zuur, vrij sterk met tonen van banaan, gerstenmout, toffee, caramel, vanille
redelijk zoet en redelijk volle body.
zeer duidelijke aroma en smaak van banaan te herkennen. lang licht bittere zoete afdronk, prima bier
Light brown, nice head. Smell and taste: Honey, glue, sweet, malty, caramel, a bit chocolate, biscuit.  Full body, sweet aftertaste, oily texcture.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2013 330ml bottle. Sweet, fenolic aromas, malty and caramel ones. Pours amber, hazy, with huge white head, creamy, vanishing, good lacing. Medium body, high carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is caramel, malty, very carbonated, some astrigent, with a sweet and warm aftertaste. Well balanced. Enjoyable.

I know so much about Belgian beer. This is a cross between a tripel and a dubbel with added abv for bite. Fun to drink cause it gets you pissed. Turns out Ive drunk 10% beers 2 nights on the trot on school nights. Roberto Ross has nothing on me. Reffed a football game for people who find it difficult to learn new things tonight. Was tremendously enjoyable.
Sweet fruit and caramel aroma.  Pours a dark amber with white head.  Vanilla, citrus, slight alcohol warmth.  Clean finish.  Very nice but a little lighter bodied than I expect from a Quad.

330ml bottle - Sparkling red-brown colour, thin white head that laces through. The aroma is caramel, vanilla, orange and booze. Light body and a creamy slick alcoholic palate. No hop bitterness. Fruity sweetness hides the alcohol. Nice warmth at the end.

Reddish brown colour, firm off-white head. Aroma of banana, alcohol, malts, yeast and berries. Malty sweet, sweet alcoholic flavour. Light liquorice root. Full body. Finish banana, alcohol, sticky sweet malts and bay leaves.
Nice, strong quad, setting the benchmark for the style.
(33cL bottle @home)

Bottle shared by jayhawk73. Thanks Jeff.

The beer appears a rusty orange color. Moderately hazy with a light tan head that leaves ample lacing on the goblet. 

The aroma offers fruit, yeast, malt, citrus, berries. While the aroma is pleasant enough, I find it very uncharacteristic of a Belgian quad.

A tad sweet, with plenty of fruit and yeast. Alcohol really emerges in the flavor, a bit more than I prefer. Sweetness grows as I make my way through the beer. Lingering alcohol presence.

Medium to full bodied with relatively high carbonation. 

I have had every Trappist quad multiple times, and this one is my least favorite. Still, a decent beer and worth a try.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-13-2011

33 cl bottle. BBE 09/2012.
Originally rated on 20090517. (8-4-8-4-16)
Pours slightly hazy dark amber color with a huge frothy head. Aroma of spices, lots of fruits, both ripe and fresh, the fresh fruits are quite surprising though. Yeast, mild toffee notes and anise on the nose as well. 
Flavor of malts, caramel, spices, some yeast and toffee also, hints of vanilla and anise with a wooden, licorice finish. Smooth, almost creamy palate with a mild sourish finish. Ages nicely and manages to keep the fruity appearance strong. Nice.
4346

Small bottle. Opaque amber/orange body with a medium head. Sharp aroma of raisins and hairspray - this is not a good start. Taste is obviously dominated by alcohol because the body is so light. "Full" and "mild" would be the opposite words to describe this beer. Overly boozy taste of figs and candies. Not enjoyable to me at all - the Dubbel was thin too but at least it was reasonably balanced.

30cl. Bottle. 
Poors hazy amber with nice creamy head. 
Aroma caramel, ripe dark fruits, peach, loads of fruits. 
Taste complex sweet en bitter even some sour, amazing. 
Mouth-feel creamy. 
Such a great beer!

Uma cerveja dona de uma aroma único, porém seu paladar não foi o dos mais apreciados por mim.
Por ser uma trappista seu gosto na minha opinião é muito frutado, mas é claro que não deixará nunca de ser uma trappista completa.

Vintage 2010 from Novare Res in Portland, Me. Pricy but real nice.  Nose is sweet dark fruit, mostly raisin with some plum. Taste is a complex blend. Sugars, caramel, raisins, prunes and Burnt sugars I guess I need to age all my quads, for at least 2 years. This is a great brew without question.

Bottle.BBE 05/15. Pours a translucent dark, ruby red with a large, beige head that falls down to a film on top of the liquid. Aroma is apricot, peach, loads of marzipan, phenolic, dark dried fruits - loads of them. Taste begins a lot of caramel, some marzipan, light peach. The dark dried fruits rule the middle with caramel. Spiciness is big on the drying finish. Long aftertaste. Palate is full and quite stingy. An excellent beer, especially with cheese.

Looks brilliant - a deep red brown with a tight off white head. Strong aromas of dark fruit and citrus. Taste is dominated by dried fruits, apple, plum and orange, with a deep sweetish caramel background note. Light carbonation and a crisp finish lift the whole thing. A really excellent beer.

Nice aroma of mixed fruits and peel. Head stays with some lacing. Taste is alcoholic, buttery, acid, pear drops.
Bit of an alcohol burn in the finish, with banana and toffee.
Best out of the Trappes so far.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2014 Beautiful amber orange color, with fine white head, classic aroma,the taste is oriented in yellow fruits notes, strong equilibrate sweet-bitter final, medium carbonation. One digestive beer.

Beautifully complex aroma of yeast, purple fruits, brown sugar, and bubble gum. Thick head lasts and lasts with tight, small bubbles everywhere. Taste is a mix of raisins, brown sugar, roastiness, caramel, berries, booze, and bread. A very fine quad - not too acidic or alcoholic in character - just the right balance. May like this better than St. B, but not as much as Rochefort. Would love to do a blind taste testing someday!

#473
Dunkles Bernstein mit viel zu schnell verschwindenden Schaum. Ein schön blumig-malziges Aroma mit beeriger Fruchtigkeit. Der Antrunk ist vollmundig, aber für satte 10% Umdrehungen sensationell "unspritig". Geschmacklich ausgewogen zwischen Hefe, Malz und langem, leicht bitterem Abgang. Hier dominiert weder die Süße noch die Würze, alles wirkt gut aufeinander abgestimmt. Das La Trappe Quadrupel ist eines der wenigen hochprozentigen Biere, die eine gute Süffigkeit haben.
	
Test vom 19.11.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 10,12,9,10,10,10 - 10,15

La Trappe Quadrupel has a thick, creamy, beige head and an opaque orange-brown appearance with thick lacing and tiny streaming bubbles. The aroma is strong- fruitcake, dates, figs, raisin, sweet bread, cinnamon, a yeast zing, and other indeterminate smells. Flavor is the same, with an accompanying alcohol pickup and little hop bitterness, it any. The is an alcohol burn in the back-sip. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy, and La Trappe Quadrupel finishes semi-dry, sloppy, and somewhat drinkable. This is a sipper, not a gulper, no doubt. Overall, I love it and strongly recommend it! RJT
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2015 At Bistro Campagne.  Medium amber color. Rich and substantial beer but not too syrupy. Fruity and mildly boozy. Nice. Serving:bottle

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2013 Poured from a 300 ml bottle.
Colour is dark orange - light brown against the light with some rows of bubbles rising to the surface. One finger, brownish head that goes away fast but some of it remains on the surface of the beer to protect it. 
Very nice, strong smell of sweet fruits.
Taste is also sweet and fruity, with the high alcohol barely noticeable.
Quite thick in body and quite carbonated too.
Overall a magnificent beer!

Bottle. Dark brown color with a medium sized off-white head. Malty aroma with apples, dark fruits and sweet caramel. Flavor is quite sweet with caramel malt, spices, toffee, dark fruits and some alcohol. Medium to full body.

750ml bottle. Pours with a generous beige head. Plenty of action in the glass. Lovely orange gold tone (Lovibond 16). Aroma is sweet caramel and spices. Taste is much more sugary and sweeter than expected. Gives way too an alcoholic aftertaste. Not unpleasant but not as balanced as I'd figured. Great palate.

750 mL bottle. Pours a deep hazy mahogany color, a patchy almost gray head. Sweet dark fruits and yeast on the nose, plum pudding.  Surprisingly smooth on the palate, full bodied and slightly syrupy.  Nice hoppy finish, slightly soured. Really enjoyable stuff, a happy medium between weight and complexity.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nose of banana syrup, burnt sugar and caramel. Slightly bitter, a little bubbly and a lingering taste on alcohol at the end. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap in "La casa the la cerveza" in Madrid. Hazy brown colour with a nice creamy head. Aroma consists of caramel, some tropical fruits maybe, some candy sugar and belgiam yeast. Flavour also brings along oak, wood and a more presant caramel taste. It has good a bit sharp mouthfeel at first, but then it smoothens up soft, suiting carbonation. The alcohol is not notable in the aroma nor the flavour. I can sense some bitterness in the aftertaste, really good. Overall a top scoring beer in my opinion.

Szavakkal leírhatatlan mennyire tökéletesen zseniális ez az isteni nedü!
Még soha nem ittam hozzáfoghatót!
Igazi mestermunka!!!!
Poured from the tap. Cloudy medium brown with minimal head.  Very good trappist with aromas and tastes of alcohol, dark fruits, and bread.  Excellent
Pleasant beer.  Pours a dark caramel color with little head.  Has a pleasantly bitter taste that has hints of prunes, figs, and caramel.  Smells of strong yeast and malt.

When there beers come here we only get the 750ML corcked bottles. $6.80 so cheaper then some other bottles this size and some a bit smaller can coast more sometimes. Smell is sweet,fruity,syrupy,boozyish. Poured in a tappist challice glass 2 finger soapy head orangy red pale to light cant see throw but in front more pale orange and I can see carbination. Taste is mabye some plum and apricot but eather way its some fruityness,sweetness,malt(sweet malt?)a little spice at times mabye and a tad boozy. Feel a little warmth from it. Some sips are allright for this style of beer and some sips are gross. cheers. Its allright and you can tell its a stronger one.

Pours a deep auburn with good foamy head. Smells of bready malt, yeast and booze. Is a sticky beer, probably from the use of Belgian candied sugars. Exquisite ale with properties similar to port; a good after-dinner quaff. Tastes of prune, black cherry, tart, sticky sweetness, boozy yeast and an obvious inclusion of big aforementioned bready malt. A well balanced beer. I liked the original version better than the oak aged Quad that La Trappe offers for almost 2x the price! Always seem to come back to this one. One of my favorites.

Bottle 0.33l,  in a trappist glass. Good example of a trappist quadrupel, Dark brown color with small thin white head. Full aroma with caramel notes. Lively  carbonated with a medium body. Highly Recommended.
Bottle 0.33l from Germany. Colour is dark brown with white head. Aroma and flavours are malts, plums, fruits and bananas. Very drinkable and soft.
Pours amber with almost no head. Spicy and yeasty aroma. Hop and caramel taste.

This is one of the Belgian styles of quadrupel that unfortunately falls outside the umbrella of Trappist, yet it is ever-deserving of the gratitude and acclaim that those fabled 6 bring in.  The aromas is fantastic, exuding hints of overripe bananas, alcohol-soaked nut bread, cocoa, and boozy vanilla.  The taste follows this up perfectly with a flavor profile of dark, fermented fruits, treacle, banana-yeast esters, sherry, bready chocolate, port wine, dates, and decadent port wine, among many others (you could spend an hour picking new-found flavors to add to the description of this beer).  The finish is coating, yet not cloying and of a perfect length with a slight hint of drying, bitter hops along with some dark chococolate, and a figgy presence that leaves the palate waiting anxiously for the next sip.  The mouthfeel is sumptuous and has enough carbonation and life to not be over-bearing.  Overall, this is a phenomenal quadrupel that belongs on the same pedestal as Chimay Blue and other heavy Trappist favorites.  A dizzingly phenomenal brew - A+
Sampled at SMÖF 2012. Pours copper with a big white head. Smells sweet candy malt. Tastes nutty candy malt, abit sweet and bitter.

Bottle at home (from Noel Cuvelier) 23/10/12.
Clear dark amber/brown with an off white head that soon thins to a very small pond.
Nose of toffee, dark fruits, plum, prunes, dates, brown sugar, whiff of booze, banoffee pie.
Tastes of sweet carmalised sugars, dark fruits, toffee. Alcohol is evident but well disguised. Plums, malt and a touch of spice.
Fuller end of medium bodied with soft carbonation leading to a sweet slightly bitter finish.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: My favorite stlye of beers! Out of the bottle the beer pours cloudy mahoganny brown color with a small thin white head. Aroma has abundance of toffee, mild spicy notes and a hint of yeast as undertone. Delicious taste of carmel and dried fruits. Medium to full bodied, lively and even a bit stingy carbonation and smooth creamy mouthfeel. A big time toffee finish. A fantastic beer! If you dont enjoy this beer you have a poor taste in beers. Or you drink too much MGD64 and watch too much NACAR:) lol

Look: Very clean reddish brown body, big off white soapy head. Smell: Spices, candi sugar, yeast, roasted malt, some fruits. Taste: Just like the aroma, caramel, little toffee, small hop bite to round up the brew, very sweet like added sugar. Feel: Full body tight soft carbonation. Overall: This comes off to me as a bit polished for a Quad. The taste follows the aroma, nothing wrong with that. Yet I was looking for a bit more complexity being a Quad and not a run of the mill BSDA. This is a fine brew nonetheless, but there is no rawness or funk to keep your taste buds guessing. I do like the hop bite this brew provides but it is short lived. This Brew is Worthy.

Clear Dark brown. Two finger foam. Basement fine spicy notes. Peppery sweet tipbtaste long dry finish. Great Classic brew.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2012 Pours a dark brown into the glass with an off-white head. This one looks filtered. Lots of malt and yeast on the nose as well as dried fruit. Wonderful palate with lots of malts and almost a date-like flavor as well. Rich and robust. 10%abv and well-hidden at that. Great beer.

Spicy and yeasty to the extent where the secondary wheat beer type fruit aromas are pressed to show up. Medium copper, fine suspension, permanent manilla color head. Surprise taste thats more sweet malt than hop. Still, it packs a bitter sting, as it is very booze laden. Creamy, foam palate feel often associated with the style is present here. All the classic elements of Belgian strong beers mixed in here.
Dark amber, no head; faint orange citrus aroma; rich, spicy, packed with sweet citrus flavour; slightly oily texture; warming, boozy finish; good, but didnt strike me as anything really special.

(From notes 9 Oct, 2012) Bottle. Clear amber, with a nearly white (grey?) head. Aroma is fruity, sweet and yeasty. Interestingly there is some banana in there too! Carbonation is low. Creamy on the palate. The finish is sweet with a bit of alcohol. Very good stuff.

not sure how I havent rated this up to this point. No idea on the age of this bottle but at least its the newer label. Long persistent beige head. Nose holes find the beginnings of burning sugar, golden raisins, licorice / cinnamon blend, solid sweetness that borders on being over sugary, dates - not the kind that take your money and time without getting naked, baked apples.. long smelly goodness. Talky organ locates sweetness, hint of sugary alcohol and a burn that never gains lift-off. Oh man... the fake piano intro to Van Halen - Dreams is just sickening. How did they follow Get Up with this hung of garbage love song? nutmeg, dates, light yeast (bottom of glass), much better before the dregs. Medium finish with some mouth coating. My cat just snorted at me due to me ignoring him.
(bottle) hazy amber colour with medium white head; aromas of bread, fruit, dried fruit; balanced flavour with long light bitter/dry finish

Lots of fruit but not heavy. Light and crisp despite the full flavour. Deep amber colour and lasting head. Very drinkable even at 10%

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Beautiful deep golden colour. Scent of figs and dates. Slightly bitter taste up front with an aftertaste of honey and maple syrup. Not too heavily carbonated, with a mild-heavy body

Huge frothy head when poured. Smells of spice and fruit. Lighter color than I would expect from the style, but a pretty amber. Tastes of figs, raisins, plums and pears with some spice on the finish. Light bodied for a quad, but a nice bite at the end. Good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2013 Amberkleur, goede kraag. Ruikt wat naar meloen, caramel, vanille. Smaakt  lichtjes naar banaan, caramel en mout maar heeft geen uitgesproken smaak.  Ik vind m veel te zoet en vlak. Heeft wat weinig body  voor zon zwaar bier.

Poured golden/amber with a slight haze, thick head. Aroma of dark fruit, some esters and caramel malt. Medium body, flavour of sweet malt and fforest fruit. Sweet malty. slightly roasted in the finish.

Pours a hazy golden brown on tap with swirling off-white head and decent lacing. Aroma of dark, fruity esters, a bit of caramel and grain malts, and a touch of booze on the back end. The taste follows, but mostly the fruit and alcohol coming through. Good stuff, but other trappists are better.
UPDATED: AUG 6, 2013 Massivt färgat skum. Bärnstensfärgad vätska. Söt doft av russin, karamell, fikon och dadlar. Alkoholen ger en fyllig munkänsla.
Bevuta a stomaco vuoto alle 21.30.....non ha prezzo!!!!!! Consigliatissssssssimaaaaaaa
Bottle. Pours cloudy dark golden with average white head. Aroma is spices, fruits, alcohol, banana, caramel. Flavor is spices, malt, alcohol, banana.

750ml bottle, New Zealand, stemmed chardonnay glass. Pours a murky dark hazelnut with a few ruby highlights, with a nice lasting off-white creamy head. Nose is molasses, prunes, dates, candi sugars, a little port, some alcohol. Taste is an initial light sweetness transitioning to quite a heavy sweetness in the middle and finish. Palate is medium to full, verging on the syrupy, yet with lively carbonation which makes it a joy to sip. More warming alcohol, stewed fruits, biscuity malt and cinnamon sugars in the long finish. Wonderful on a winters night.
Nice dark brown coloured beer with a descent slightly brown head. Full malty and yeasty aroma. Flavour is malty and sweet and a bit alcoholic in the aftertaste. (Bottle 33cl)

330 ml bottle @ Beer Hunters. Pours cloudy mahoganny brown colour with a small and lacing white head. Aroma has abundance of toffee, mild spicy notes and a hint of yeast as undertone. Delicious taste of toffee and dried fruits. Medium to full bodied, lively and even a bit stingy carbonation and smooth creamy mouthfeel. A big time toffee finish. A fantastic beer: really caramelly and well-balanced.

The 10% alcohol was very pronounced .  The bad thing is the beer did not have other characteristics to support the alcohol. Finish was almost a little metallic. Label says you can taste the silence maybe they shouldve of talked just a little bit.

Bottle 330ml. Pours a white layer, large bubbles. Settles, but still quite lively carbonated. Looks like bad soda, sad color. Smells like prune, peach, ginger ale and raspberry soda. Taste of yeast, butter and champagne.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: NOV 17, 2013 Good aroma, appearance, taste and palate. Decent, memorable. Rated from the bottle.
buonissima birra ma anche piuttosto forte ( 10 gradi ). consigliata a chi ha già un po di esperienza nelle birre.
From a bottle. Pours a nice amber. Very little head. Alcohol and banana lacquer aroma. Caramel and candy sugar.

The one and only original Quadrupel!! This Trappist Quadrupel is the basic beer in this style. Its smooth, fruity. Some caramel, coffee and roasty aroma. In the end it has a long lasting taste of roasted bread and a kind of caramel sweetness.

Pours dark brown with a thin head. Aroma is zesty yeast and dark fruit. Flavor is fruity and roasted caramel, but thin.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark orange brown with a medium sized off-white khaki head. Smells of big, sweet malts, and mild fruitiness. Taste is caramel, fruit, and subtle bread. Medium-to-full bodied with a smooth texture and supple mouth-carbonation, La Trappe Quadrupel finishes with a pleasant fruity sweetness.

Bottiglia 33 cl.
Bellaspetto tonaca di frate con un cappello di schiuma beige pannosa e persistente. Aromin intensi e complessi di prugna. banana matura, malto tostato.....in bocca è abboccata, di corpo. chiude lunga e appena amara.....
Non male ma cè di meglio......

Strong fresh aroma has ripe fruits: green apple, banana.Bit caramel sweetness, yeast. Interesting lively and nuanced aroma. Hazy mahogany brown, short creamy head. Taste is sweet, long, nuanced, lively carbonation, full body, soft and round feel, alcohol warmht here also but not sting. Beer with character, well crafted, art level. Highly recommended.

0,33l bottle. A dark orange/red beer with a light brown head. The aroma has notes of caramel, sugar, currants, black fruits, apples, pears and coffee. The taste is sweet. The finish is slightly bitter.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2014 Dark amber colour nice medium mokka head, sweet caramel toffee banana like smell, sweet fruity banana nice touch of the alcohol percentage, caramel creme aftertaste, me8dium bitter

Pours a light hazy brown with medium-thin tan head. Very full aroma, dark fruits, citrus/acidic, floral, licorice. Mild to medium sweet flavor. Medium body, slick texture, lively carbonation, tingly, mild bitter yet powerful finish. This brew has a lot going on yet surprisingly not difficult to drink. Enjoyable overall.

Dark reddish brown, small white head that settles on top. Smells of banana, yeast, caramel, vanilla. Sweet taste with caramel, toffee, vanilla. Very little bitter. Gorgeous lacing. Very well balanced. Definitely try again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
if you dont wanna sleep after drinking, i dont recommend you to drink the whole bottle of Quadrupel...
Bevuta a Castellato. Ottima sia al naso che al palato (prugna, caramello, note tostate) e un finale con un punta di alcool molto interessante...

caramel, slight roasted toast herby spruce ....    earthy oak that is blended with Alc slightly overpowering (for summer hot climate especially noting). mandarine fruit.
Brownish hazy orange. Burst of co2 at first. Head didnt stay long. very minimal pillows and head.  

Sweet is medium with good alc match

lightly bitter to medium sour notes.

Medium body..... some stickyness med slickyness.   Decent finish with nice nops left behind in the mouth and lips and malt comes thru after alc rush.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2012 Probably the best quad Ive ever had. Sweeter than its more highly rated friends..rocheforet and st.bernardus, which I like. Grapes, caramel, dried fruit, and booze on the nose. Prune juice, caramel, and booze flavours. Lots of sediment. Deep, beautiful milk chocolate brown. Amazing, amazing, amazing.

A-- Poured a reddish brown color. Not that thick looking and had a short one finger head that quickly disappeared.

S-- Cherry, orange peel, fig, and sweet. Fairly thick smelling and has a very alcohol nose on it. Alot going on in this.

T-- Alcohol up front. A little bit of a yeast taste but mostly fig, prune, dark cherry, and sugar.

M-- More carbonated than other quads I have had. Not as thick and heavy as others in this style. More sugar taste and finishes very dry.

D-- Very boozy, tastes and smells every bit of 10%. Still drinkable though. Not as good as other quads are. A little too sweet and overcarbonated. Might need to be a bit colder to offset the sugar. Pricewise very drinkable. $19 in Australia for a 4 pack of 10% is a bargain. Will buy again mostly due to price.

12.7 oz pours amber with a tan head.  Aroma is basically alcohol. Taste of malt,  oak and alcohol.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Light colored, soft sweet beer with an easy to drink experience. A very nice beer to drink on a hot summer day.
The sweetness of this beer overpowers the bitterness by far. Tastes great, especially for a Dutch beer.

33cl bottle. Pours deep golden to amber with an off-white head. Fruity aroma with tropical fruits, banana, caramel, malt and dried fruits. Very fruity and very sweet. Usually Im not very fond of sweet beers, but this one is just delicious. Liquid dessert. Well integrated alcohol and all in all just a delicious beer! (2012-07-27)

Bottle. Pours amber, with a thick, creamy head. Aroma is malty caramel, chocolate, dried fruit, with notes of coffee and even some smoke. Nice, full creamy body, and moderate carbonation. Flavour is sweet malts, with dark fruits, syrup, kandi sugar, caramel, toffee and a barrel oakiness.
33cL bottle.  Copper color, translucent, oyster head, sediment settling.  Med-high carbonation, full-bodied taste, medium-bitter alcoholic aftertaste, awesome.  A work of art.

On 33 cl bottle, thanks Visionthing.
Dark golden hazy, with sediments and ok foam.
Aromas of dried fruits & malt
Full body and high complexity.
Immediate sweetness, but some balancing bitterness.
Good carbonation.
Very enjoyable

Draft at Huppel.  Pours hazy brown with a small off white head.  Aroma of fruits, banana, caramel, bread and slight alcohol.  Flavour is medium to heavy sweet, light bitter.  Full bodied with moderate carbonation.

Pours a hazy dark orange with 3 fingers of off-white head. Some bubbles emerge non-stop.

Aroma is complex: banana has main role than yeast, alcohol, figs, and probably dark fruits. 

The taste is cozy. The sweetness of the malt cover all the path from the beginning to the end. But there is a narrative in there (outset, climax and finishing) that I am not able to explain in details. All in all, the sweetness steals the others flavors. Medium-full body, noticeable carbonation (also in the last part of the taste). Alcohol remarks its presence, but it does not bother.
Not bad, I will have it again. It costs 1,19euro in a ordinary Amsterdam supermarket then it worths it.

330ml bottle. Pours a cloudy orange brown with three fingers of off white head that is extremely vibrant, bubbling up to the surface. Fades slowly to a cap. A fruity aroma, banana, some breadyness and yeastiness, some spice, cloves, dark fruits, plum, lemon, some funkiness. Great, complex nose. Sweetness and banana on the attack, with some clove and a fortified wine flavour, sweet and solvently finish with almost no discernible bitterness, and a little toast as an aftertaste. Alcohol isnt too extreme, but its noticeable on the finish and its not particularly pleasant. Smooth mouthfeel with some good weight to it and a nice spritz of carbonation. Not as good as I was expecting. The alcoholic burn made it a bit unpleasant.

Bottled, 0.33l. Hazy deep amber color with small frothy tan head and lively carbonation. Aroma of spicy hops, caramel, banana, yeast and with light citric note. Taste starts with sweet and rich maltiness, followed by refreshing fruitiness and some caramel in the back. Aftertaste is pleasant medium hoppy. Full bodied, thick texture and lively natural carbonation in palate. Great...

Nice cloudy amber. Thick foamy head. Soft floral nose.  Strong flavor. Raisins booze. Pretty carbonated. Somewhat bitter 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ching! Ching! Ching! (the sound of Las Vegas slot machines paying out the jackpot....) Nice quad from the only Trappist brewery in the Netherlands.... Beautiful to look at, delicious and potent. A pleasure to sip....
delicious.  Pours dark and clear with good frothy head.  Aroma is fruity and taste is sweet and smooth.
Raw honey color with a dense head, nice lacing, and cloudy appearance. Spicy nose with overripe banana notes and banana nut bread. Malty intro that transitions smoothly to a cherry finish.

Beautiful cloudy red-orange. Tons of little black specks of sediment. The head is big, but dissipates kinda fast. Lovely sheet of lace. Looks absolutely tremendous.

Aroma is champagne, a Belgian yeast strain, lemongrass and orange rind. Faintest hint of sour cherry.

Flavors are earthy, soil-like. The funk comes in at the end. 

Tons of CO2 goes up into the nostrils; the carbonation is intense once uncorked. Feels dry and sandpapery. This is a little overpriced, and perhaps a weaker sister (brother) to its Trappist brethren, but still a solid quad.

(750 ml from Bootleggers) Cloudy dark brown with a soft finger of tan head. Aroma of fruit, slightly vinous, chocolate, spice and yeast. Mouthfeel smooth, full, soft, lots of fine bubble carbonation. Flavor of chocolate and light spice, some cinnamon, also caramel and fruit. ABV pretty well-integrated, mild burn through finish. Nice malty quad, just lacks enough complexity and wow factor to be a big-timer.

750 ml bottle - July 2010 vintage - Pours slightlly darker-than-average amber with a thin watery eggshell white head. Aromas of malt, candi sugar, cinnamon and some curacao, lovely stoved peach, and some banana. Full body with sweetness all over the place. A little sourness by the finish, but carbonation makes it going down well. No alcohol heat whatsoever, it is nicely balanced and smoothes out the medium carbonation and the sweetness into a nice mouthfeel. Taste is spices and honey.

Bottle 33cl. Nothing is better than a La Trappe when I hope for Dutch victory tonight. Amber, cloudy with a nice foamy and lasting orange head. Nice soft fruity aroma with sence of, bread and banana, want more aroma. Soft bitter taste with some alc, but not to much. Nice one
Aromatic and delicious flavour to explore. Apareance carachterist for a quadruppel.....
Pours a cloudy brown with an off white head that fades to ring. Aroma is sweet toffee, bread, and dark fruit.  Taste is raisins, bread, alcohol, and caramel.  Soft carbonation.  Very enjoyable.
Dark, not a lot of head. Aroma is of fruit and followed by sweet flavors of dark fruit.

Bottle 0,33l at Monks Cafe in Philadelphia. Reddish brown with a creamy, stable head. Very intensive aroma - vinous, spicy (cloves), oily, woody and above all fruity (apples, cherries, pears, bananas and plums). Full body, medium carbonation. Taste is sweet, skilfully balanced by a sharp, almost peppery spiciness. Bready-fruity, only slightly astringent-bitter, very warming finish with an aftertaste of cloves and apples. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2012 Malty aroma with dark fruits and yeast... a little too strong on the fruit notes. Thick bubbly tan head with a deep bronze pour. Malty sweet and booze taste. Less fruity than expected. Medium to heavy body with buttery texture. Finishes smooth and rich, but a little bite from carbonation and alcohol.

Pours a red-ish colored beer with a decent head. Dissapates fast though! Aroma has hints of fruits like apple but also has hints of wood. The taste itself is VERY alcoholic and heavy but sweet at the same time. Has a little bit of raisin flavor which sadly enough.. im not very fond of. It IS a good beer. Just not one that really suits me personally

750 ml bottle courtesy of Jonas (non-RB). Pours tiny hazy reddish brown with a big frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving lots of thick lacing on the glass. Smell is sweet with apples, pears, cereal, alcohol, wood, dark sweet bread, very ripe oranges, cinnamon, dark grapes and hints of burnt caramel and toffee. Taste is sweet and malty with apples, pears, dark bread, wood, dark grapes, cinnamon, liquorice root, ginger, cereal, golden syrup, alcohol and hints if dark honey and resin. Mouthfeel is round, boozy, sticky sweet and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet and tiny bitter with dark bread, apples, pears, wood and alcohol.

Die Schaumkrone hielt aber nicht so lange, nur mittelmäßig. Der Geschmack ist sehr intensiv alkoholisch, aber geil. Allerdings macht das Brauwasser einen Schleimigen Eindruck. Geschmacklich eben ziemlich Alkoholisch, malzig, und fruchtig. Fazit: So seltsam das ich es wieder gut finde. Ungewohnt aber gut Trinkbar!
	
Test vom 11.12.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 11,9,9,9,12,10 - 9,75

Pour light tan and very turbid with a average sized head. The aromas show notes of fruits in particular a sweet alcoholic banana. It has flavours of rich dark fruits including figs and some peppery spice to round out the malts. It finishes with a hint of sweetness and alcoholic warmth.

Bottle. Reddish brown with a creamy, stable head. Very intensive aroma - vinous, spicy (cloves), woody and above all fruity (apples, cherries, pears, bananas and plums). Full body, medium carbonation. Taste is sweet, skilfully balanced by a sharp, almost peppery spiciness. Bready-fruity, only slightly astringent-bitter, very warming finish with an aftertaste of cloves and apples. I sort of felt reminded of sipping a classy port wine. Magnificent.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2015 Bel colore limpido arancio-ambrato con una sottile e soffice schiuma beige. Aroma dolce e pungente con sentori di frutta passita, pane, lievito e caramello. Gusto piuttosto dolce e fruttato con note maltose e di biscotto, finale prevalentemente liquoroso con un retrogusto asciutto e amarognolo. Birra mediamente corposa ed avvolgente con un tenore alcolico robusto, una struttura oleosa ed uneffervescenza vivace che la rende meno "spessa" del previsto. Lasciata a maturare in cantina per qualche anno si fa più vellutata al palato ma meno profumata al naso; il gusto si fa più "corto" e maggiormente orientato verso note di zucchero caramellato amaro.

wow. im a dark brew fan, and this stuff took me completely by surprise. appearance...meh, average looking. The 10% alcohol stamp got me curious, so i nabbed a bottle. 

Its very dark, opaque like guiness...but with absolutely no metallic or bitter taste. Very deep and fruity. Sweet instead of bitter. Slight hint of grape. Very smooth, and fruity aftertaste, you would never know how much alcohol was in it until you examined the label.

Amazing beer...its a pleasant surprise to learn that not everything black tastes either smoky or steely. Great stuff!
Bärnstensfärgad med kraftig och rik arom. Riktigt gott och enligt mitt tycke La Trappes bästa.

Bottle. A hazy orange colour with a high, frothy, off-white head. An aroma of malt, alcohol, caramel and spice. The taste is heavy sweet and medium bitter. A full body, oily and creamy texture, soft carbonation and a medium long duration. A complex and really nice beer.

Tap at Cheeky Monk. Poured a deep amber with a khaki head and good lacing. Smell is yeasty, spice, clove, light banana, caramel, and dark fruits.
