Taste is sweet prunes, dark fruit, raisins, caramel, spice, and banana. Begins sweet, somewhat spicy through the middle, with an alcoholic burn on the finish. Sticky/syrupy mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Complex beer with flavors all over the place; very, very, sweet, but yet seems to work. Good beer, but would probably be a good candidate for cellaring.

Beautiful aroma full of maltiness the color is brown and cloudy with yeasty goodness.  The taste is very earthy malty and fruity...not fruit like apples and oranges but fruity fruity.  An excellent beer id buy over and over again. You can smell the alcohol a bit but you cavt taste it.. Truly a great beer one i will enjoy over and over.
Bottle at café medeia, lisbon. Dark amber color. Thin head. Thin to medium carbonation. Medium to high sweetness. Malt, caramel aroma. Not perfect but still good.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2012 Las notas principales que se perciben son dulces. Maltas caramelizadas, ligeras notas vinosas, ciertos aromas a madera, frutas y especias. Aroma sumamente complejo.

En cuanto a la apariencia, cerveza color marron con tonos pajizos a la luz, Ligera carbonataión pero muy constante. De cuerpo medio y corona de espuma esponjosa y duradera. Contiene ciertos sedimentos por el pozo que se forma.

Al primer sorbo se siente una cremosidad inesperada y un fuerte dulzor agradable, se nota la intensidad alcohólica pero disfrasada en una estructura muy bien formada.

Al paladar, la perfección. La cremosidad aumenta y pasa de ser aterciopelada a la intensidad alcoholica con notas vinosas, Cremosidad y elegancia en una botella.

En general se trata de una excelente cerveza, compleja, elegante, bien balanceada, densa y con un final de media duración en donde la potencia alchólica y un suave dulzor invaden tus sentidos.
red fruits, dried fruits and vanilla fills the nose, bittersweet carburation and depth in flavour. Excellent.
Strong and malty with an array of flavours, while not overpowering in any category. Highly recommended.
Amber copper body, no head. Banana-peel nose. Malt, yeast...I taste a bit of scotch on the palate. Intriguing!

bottle  - pours deep amber with thick beige head .aroma is yeasty , spicy , caramel . taste is sweet , yeast and dark fruits with a crispness . good carbonation and just enough alcohol showing through  .A good one
This was very pleasant.  Aroma is of sweet berries, taste of cherry, strawberry, plums, raisins, dark fruits.  No sediment but cloudy. Smooth. One of the better trappist ales weve had so far.
The best offering from La Trappe brewery IMO. Carbonation is good, alcohol is well hidden and has a rich taste. Mouthfeel is good and eaves a clean palate. Very cheap here in the Netherlands. Get it!

Pours a deep amber carmel color with a short lasting head. Rum-raisin on the nose. I can smell the high alcohol. Butterscotch and figs on the palate. Long-lasting taste with nice mouthfeel... soft carbonation in a thick body. Excellent beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a cloudy deep orange with an absolutely huge yellowish head, extraordinary retention and comb like lacing. Aroma is sweet, spicy and yeasty: a good dose of Belgian yeast, caramel, coriander, herbal hops, a strong character. Taste is yeasty upfront supported by a very strong alcohol wave, a sticky sensation, spicy, dried fruits, fresh even at 10% ABV. Good, but was expecting more

Bottled.  Sweet, malty flavor with hints of raisins and plums. The flavor is amazing.  You can taste the alcohol in this beer, but it is not overpowering, it is a subtle touch to the flavor.  It is a very crisp beer for the high alcohol %.  Malty, raisin, plum flavors.  Love this beer, it reminds me of drinking beers while vacationing in Bruges.

330ml bottle. Dark brown/reddish color. Nice medium beige head, stays. Sweet malts, caramel, raisins, cognac in aroma. Full body, creamy, plums, raisins. Medium carbonation. Although its 10% I cant feel alcohol in it , but it kicked in when I finished bottle. Very nice beer.
Sampled at Casanovas. Pours a clear gold, thin white head. Aroma is just what youd expect from a quad, nice and yeasty.  Flavor is fantastic and simply delicious.

Bellissima, color mogano, tripudio di schiuma, compatta appena versata e persistente. Aroma fruttato con un tocco liquoroso. Al palato ritorna quel tono fruttato dolce immerso in una matrice vinosa. Evolve alla fine in un leggero " amarino " luppolato di fondo. Finale persistente. Perfetta per le sere invernali. Io, da bevitore precisino qual sono, lho bevuta in una delle sere più calde (fino ad ora) di aprile. Dicasi coerenza.
Hazy darker ruby brown color with solid off-white foam slowly reducing and sticking to glass. Some fruit tones, but also caramel, still bitter and strong in alcohol. A good beer.
Gedronken na de rondleiding in La trappe, Rood/bruin en helder van kleur. Ruikt en smaakt naar hop, zoet, caramel, anijs

Tasted Alan's at wurstkuche. Light brown. Fizzy. Can definitely taste the alcohol. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The Quadruppel New label, nose good be a bit more depth but taste compensates. Licoris and a nice balanced bitter.

33cl Bottle obtained from a Night shop in Brussels and reviewed in my hotel room. The bottle was best before Dec 2012 and was poured into two toothbrush glasses from the bathroom on 30 Oct 2010.

Lovely deep amber looking brew, an off-white foaming head sat on top of each small glass, both of which held some good lacing as I sank the beer.

Molasses, sweet, caramel and toffee filled the nose, no hints of hops at all. Add to those smells alcohol and diesel or heavy oil esters.

The taste is also a combination of the above aromas initially. The sweetness hides the alcohol in the flavours at first, but a hop endorsed bitterness at the drying end of the mouthfeel isnt strong enough to mask the power of 10%ABV and the beer ends a little unbalanced.

Bottle @ home  
 
Pours a hazy amber with a strong white creamy head that doesnt stay to long aromas are fruity caramel malt then alcohol taste is the same with yeast flavors coming in to play and overly sweet  the carbonation is vivid the body is medium the after taste is a bit spicy and momentarily  biter

Pours a mahogany colour that gives a off a complex aroma of dark fruits and toffee.Surprising amount of carbonation in this one. Despite the complextity of the flavour profile there is a nice rounded cohesiveness that brings it together and makes for a pleasant experience. At 10% abv, the alcohol is only detectable on the back in a very small way.
On tap at Apex. Pours a hazy amber with floaty particulates. Aroma is super fruity with yeast. Taste is deep fruit and caramel. Dink-happy drinkability.

On tap. Dark amber colour, clear, with nice off-white head. Mouthful of fruityness: apricots, cherry, pear, banana, dark fruits. Sweet malts, caramel and moderate yeastiness, also some spices, balanced by a good amount of hoppy bitterness. Alcohol is well masked. Palate is quite flat and the finish is dry. Complex brew nicely balanced, very good indeed.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2013 Have had many times on draft (usually  at Monks or Eulogy) and several times in the bottle (including a 15 year aged one.) Pours a thick honey gold to a hazy orange. Always with a strong white pillowy head. Lots of lace. Big chewy vanilla caramel flavor. Deep rich buttery red fruit. A malt explosion. Some kegs have pulled with blonder nuttier butterscotch notes, others have more of a red plum flavor. The well aged bottle had a thinned out body but a nice gentle smoothness. The drafts are always fuller and have a more noticeable spice bite. Might be too rich for some but I can definitely feel all the work that went into this and appreciate it. My favorite Trappist Quad.

Hazy reddish amber with a modest off-white head. Light lacing. Aroma of caramel, toffee, raisins, bread, grass, spice, alcohol, and Belgian yeast. Taste is nice and balanced. Not too sweet or yeasty, and the alcohol is fairly well hidden. Solid bitterness as well. Medium-full bodied, slightly fizzy, and dry.

Pours a cloudy copper with a big tan head. Lots of lacing. Smells complex with lots of spices, rich fruits, and yeast. Taste is also very complex with spices, Belgian yeast, ripe dark fruits, ripe tropical fruits, a bit of floral hops and Belgian candied sugar. Med-full bodied. Med carbonation, but not over done or sparkly. After tastes is spicy, dry, slightly alcoholic, and full of flavor. This does not loose its complex flavors and characters as you get to the bottom of the bottle, but it stays interesting and delicious. Something to be savored. This is world class stuff.

Bottle 330 ml [2011]. Appearance: Pours amber with a medium beige head. Good carbonation. Aroma: Sweet, spices, fruits, malt and yeast. Taste: Sweet, spices, loads of fruits, warming alcohol, caramel and malt. Overall: Very good beer, well balanced and very complex. Lots of similarities with De Struise Pannepot.

Bottle on many occasions. Pours deep ruby wuth an unbelievably creamy 3 finger white head. Sporadic but thick lacing. Aroma is bready yeast, figs, plums, lavender, dark cherry, Taste is filled with dark fruit, canduy sugar, raisins, caramel pop, perfume. Very floral. Warming and smooth for the complexity of the beer. Leaves a red delicious apple aftertaste. One of my all time favorite quads.

33cl bottle. Brown colour with a foamy and frothy off white head with a decent persistence. Aroma is alcoholic and caramelish. Flavour is sweet, with caramel hints, slightly fruity and a final alightly bittery that gives to the beer an excellent balance and an aftertaste alcoholic. Dense on palate. Carbonation is medium. Body is high. Texture is oily.
Bottle. Dark brown with a white head. Fruity aroma. Sweet caramel flavour with some alcohol.

AROMA: caramel, hay, dough, malt
APPEARANCE: amber, clear, frothy
TASTE: light sweetness, medium bitterness
PALATE: full body, creamy, average carbonation, average finish
OVERALL: heavy bitter and fizzy when just poured, then turns more mellow with a malty overtone.
Nice dark beer.definate fruitiness in the aftertatste, apple for me and maybe a bit oaky.There is a real alcohol kick to this one.I like it.
Very smooth and dark fruits. Very fruity aroma and a nutty finish. Nice bottle and has a really good color.

330 ml bottle; pours clear light brown with puffy cream colored head fading to a thin film; boozy, stale sugary syrup, stale malt and Belgian candy; maybe some stale orange peels; aroma is very syrup overall; vanilla syrup, sticky candy sugar, dried dates; sticky mouthfeel with boozy undertones; this bottle has very little yeast notes or complexity; more like a sticky barleywine to me; heavy on the candy syrup and like on the yeasty profile and body; pretty disappointing actually; nowhere near St. Bern or Rochefort
Sweet in flavor with notes of flowers and caramel, and nice bitterness. Somewhat yeast in flavor. Color is dark amber with a lasting white head.

From notes.  First reviewed 11/17/2011.  Poured from a 11.2 oz. bottle into a chalice.

The body of the beer is a full, clear brown color with a few tints of amber and ruby. A robust off-white foam with large and small bubbles carelessly intermixed forms after a careful, straight down the middle of the glass pour. It is easy to count on the trappists to make consistently good looking beer.

Dark caramel malts, molasses, some milk chocolate, earthy spices, figs, raisins, and a strong banana kick with some alcohol on the back end all create a nice, full aroma.

As a good quad should, the taste opens up into an opus of flavors. Caramel and molasses provide some firm sweetness up front, coinciding with some dark and bready malts. Some milk chocolate opens the palate for a number of dark fruits; figs, raisins, and plums are all noticeable but not dominant. Some clove and other spices lead into a surprisingly strong banana note, with the conclusion being marked by a firm alcohol presence. All in all, quite a nice beer.

The body is more medium than full, and definitely on the light side for the style, which is my one main knock. With all of the flavors going on here, it still manages to have a clean finish, with a soft booze accent to finish the sip. The carbonation falls somewhere between crisp and creamy and is well proportioned with the beer.

The alcohol is fairly present in this one, but it does not really detract from my tasting experience. Instead, it serves as a gentle reminder that this is a sipper and my speed of consumption should match that.

Picked this up at the Makro store in puerto near Cadiz Spain.  Paid about $6 for a corked 750 ml bottle. Pumped about the price. Definitely can taste the silence.  Pours a murky orangish amber into my La Trappe goblet.  Nice light beige head and some mild lacing. Smells of dark fruits raisins plums currants.  Nice backbone.  Tastes like a date bread.  Sweet slightly alcoholic mild phenols and slight alcohol warming.   Definitely a keeper and I have a great source in South Spain.

Banana and clove on the nose. A lively beer which helps that aroma zing. A rich, sticky, oily beer that hangs around for some time on the palate. In the mouth it continues on the the same vein as the aroma, with the addition of a spicy kick at the finish. Very drinkable.

2012.03.20 - 750ml bottle in Chimay glass.   Pours copper-orange.  Nose is kind of a light candied smell.   Carbonation is fairly high, and each drink envelops the tongue in a hundred little points of alcohol and carbonation that are mostly mild.  Taste is good, sweet is intimated and approximated, never actually being outright sweet.  Nice, and fairly subtle for 10%.

purple is a good colour for the label. it tastes purple!
deep bronze pour with thin head. 
clovey and bananary aromas. quite a spicey mouth with an orange twang. fair to lively carbonation. could feel the alcohol on my tongue.
quite a sweet finish

beerritz. leeds
Alcohol, cough drop, raisin. Very sweet high alcohol beer. Not One of my favourites but good in his kind.
Alla sua temperatura, questa birra e davvero una bomba! Sapori e odori fruttatissimi!!! Da provare assolutamente!

Pours amber-copper with a thick off-white head that has huge retention.  Fairly significant carbonation.  Aromas of caramel malts, cloves, and yeast.  Medium-bodied; taste is sweet while warm spices prevail on the palate.  finish is long with yeast, alcohol and slightly bitter notes.  By itself, this is a very nice beer, but doesnt really compare to the finer quads available.

33cl bottle. Pours a hazy, amber with a nicely proportioned head. The nose has vanilla and banana custard with toffee. The taste has toffee and nuts and some sultanas. Its a fruit n nut bar. The palate has a medium to full body with a tangy but creamy texture and a lovely cream finish. This does not taste 10%,. Overall, another great beer from La Trappe. I wouldnt be surprised if this one developed exponentially

Bottle from Halftime. Going to compare this again in a year to compare how it ages.

Pours a amber capped by a nice foamy head with amazing retention. Lots of visible carbonation. Nose is ripe banana, burnt sugar, and booze. Taste is similar with the addition of dark fruit, perhaps plum is most evident. Medium bodied, buy very creamy mouth. YUM!

Pours a mahogany color, a bit lighter than most quads. Quickly dissipating white head. Smell is earthy. Figs, bit hoppy, soil. Very pleasant smell, rich. Subtle raisin notes. Taste is very earthy. Lots of fig, bit of caramel a bit of banana. Not very carbonated. Pretty heavy and full bodied. Sort of medicinal finish. Pretty solid quad.

On tap at 1808 bistro. Cloudy orange/brown color with a nice pillowy with head. Smell of dark fruits, bread, licorice, and carmel. Medium body with a good amount of carbination. Taste is complex with many different flavors coming through. Little to no alcohol taste. Yummy good.

Pours a reddish brown hue with slightly off white head.  Lots of foam and nice lacing.  Aroma of figs, carmel, and alcohol.  Taste is complex.  Sweet dark fruits, licorice, and some cough syrup.  Lots of carbonation dancing on the tongue.  Very nice Quad.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2012 aroma: caramel, alcohol, 
apparenza: brown, cloudy, 
gusto: heavy cloying sweetness, 
palato: full body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish, 
favolosa,una quadrupla con i fiocchi. lalcool è persistente ma non guasta,anzi è perfettamente compatibile col sapore dolce.
bevuta allelfo

Copper tinted amber, slightly off white head, thick lacing. Fruity aroma, alcohol and malt notes with sugar. Taste is almost cloyingly sweet with figs, caramel, bready malts and some yeast. Smooth palate with somewhat prickly carbonation. Excellent.
Bread, caramel, and a little fruit in the aroma.  More caramel, fruit, and toffee in the flavor, which closes with a spicy, slightly bitter bite.  Really good.

This trappiste quad pours paler than most (Orval and westmalle excluded) but presents as a pale brown, cloudy ale with no head retention. Smells like dark fruit and caramelized sugar. Tastes like chocolate, toffee, plums and other Christmas fruits. For all those fans of trappiste beer that think this Dutch trappiste brewery is a step behind its Belgian counterparts, I think this beer proves that la trappe is right in the mix
BOTTLE. Sweet/syrup, malt and yeast nose.

Dark brown red color; good steady creamy foam; beautiful complex thick full body taste of orange, sour citrus, ethanol, fruits, sweet malts and crispy carbonation. Warm after taste, almost no bitterness. Just a terrific wonderful gerat beer.
I had this one a long time ago. If I have the chance to drink it again, Ill update this rating

In bottle. Pours a dark amber colour with a thick, tight beige head. Aroma of raisins, toffee, alcohol and caramel. Similar flavours of raisins and toffee with alcohol fairly present. A little sweet and just mildly bitter. Heavy carbonation and light CO2 prickle with a chewy mouth-feel.

Pours a deep amber/copper color with a small khaki head that dissipates into a thin ring. Aromas mostly consisting of dark fruit, sugar and alcohol. Flavors of dark fruit (mostly cherries), candy, caramel and a hint of alcohol burn. Medium bodied with kind of a creamy finish. I liked this a lot. Though nothing about this beer wows me it is solid in every aspect.
A little bit low on the aroma. Might be too much carbonated maybe. Many tastes in the palate, but the alcohol dominates a little bit. Good beer though.
This beer is start to finsh breath taking. You start with a aroma that is sweet malty and fruity in the banana foster vein. Flavor sweet,malty,hoppy and full of yeast and candy sugar.
Beers pours a a dark amber color with a 3 finger head with thick lace. Big favors of banana, vanilla, And yeast, tons of burnt candy sugars, and cream. Another great quadruple to drink.

toast, spruce, grass, coffee, cheese, licorice, rotten eggs, cough drop, butterscotch, woody, black, brown foam, rocky head, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, umami, full body, sticky, flat, long finish,

33 cl. bottle @ home. Hazy dark copper with a huge off-white head. Aroma is yeasty and a bit spicy (cinnamon?). taste is deep dark and satisfying. caramel, roasted malts and some warming well hidden alcohol. great beer.

Dark slightly hazy amber pour with small tan head. Aroma of ripe fruit, caramel and cotton candy. Taste is sweet malt, caramel and orange rind. Nice carbonation and creamy mouthfeel. Slightly bitter orange rind finish. Very good.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2012 0,75l Bottle.  Dark brown red with frothy head, that sets fast. Aromas orange, sour citrus, glue. ethanol, fruits. Palate sour, citrus, carbonation crispy, mouth feel refreshing some sweet malts. After taste warmth from alcohol, honey melon, no  bitterness. Fantastic , complex brew.

Bottled. Deep ruby to copper beer, creamy but thin head. Intes fruity aroma has plums, dates and some bubblegummy/fruity yeast. Sweet malty and candi sugary flavor, winegummy yeastiness and some alcohol. A bit straightforward. Medium body, high carbonation. Sticky and slightly alcoholic texture.
Ottima birra dal sapore molto struturato. Dolce e aromatica. Molto persistente. Aromindi frutta rossa.
This a pleasant bubbly ale that is light yet full of delicious malt flavors. The only of the 7 official Trappist ales to be made in the Netherlands.

Pours a hazy autumn gold with a long lasting head and full top-to-bottom lacing.  This is traditional, but well done: sweet caramel malt cut by light floral and carbonation bittering....just enough to balance, but never getting in the way of the alcohol or the lingering sweetness.  A big alcoholic taste.  Well done.

[Rated 06/04/2010] Pours dark red with white head. Aroma is soft and sweet, of alcohol. Flavor is really sweet and warm, a lot of
unfermentable sugars aparently. Leaves a very long and nice finish. Very good brew without week points, somewhat
sweeter than all the other trappist quads.
I loved every second of this beer!  From the slight warming sensation to the feel of this.  My favorite Trappist so far.

Pour cloudy dark brown-red, with a surprisingly small but stable head. MAlt, caramel, berries, raisins, and flowers in the aroma.  Full bodied and high alcohol taste, with notes of caramel and honey. Palate is somewhat bitter and leaves a taste of honey as well. Low-mid carbonation.

Hazed orange brown, large beige head. Aroma of toffee, light tobacco, light leather, Belgian yeast-banana, fruity esters. Taste is sweet, side by side with Westy 12, this is noticeably sweeter with more Belgian yeast influence. Nice creamy texture, soft carbonation, light woody bitter finish. A great value at 10.99/750mL.

Pours dark brown with a medium foamy and sticky head. Aroma has notes of raisin, caramel malts, spices and syrup. Taste is quite malty with notes of raisin, fruits, spices and caramel. Full bodied and carbonated. Finish is fruity and warming. A nice quadrupel.

Ive been letting this one sit for a year (definitely worth the wait).
It pours dark amber, with ruby highlights; the head is off cream and very moussey. The aroma has notes of: figs, plums, grape concord, fruitcake, rum, cloves and cinnamon. The taste is heavy-light sweetness that finishes with a malt-bomb; there are notes of: bubblegum, bananas, alcohol (rum), raisins, cloves, nutmeg and a slight bit of charcoal (aftertaste). The palate is perhaps the finest quality and reason for aging the beer; it is über full-bodied, viscous and filling - with delicate carbonation. Overall, let that bitch sit - trust me; das ist gud!

330ml bottle. Deep amber with a head that shrinks quickly but hangs around for the duration. Packs more punch in the mouth than on the nose. Perfect mouthfeel, a lovely conterpoint to the darker quads with some unique complexities of its own to make up for the lack of dark fruit notes usually found. Long finish, a little alcohol heat. Very good, but not quite in the top tier.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2012 Bottle. Pours a golden bronze with dense off white head. Plenty of lacing. Aromas dominated by fruity easters - bananas pineapple and bubblegum. Some dark fruits, spice and plenty of hot alcohol. The fruity easters really are somehwat over powering. Flavours are initially quite sweet, some bitterness through the middle before a decent whack of alcohol burn. The fruit easters are very much there in the taste and once again are quite over powering. Medium mouthfeel.
Hazy honey gold, creamy head that dissipates into a ring quite quickly. Floral, sweet aroma. Sweet honey flavour, massive kick from the ABV - a little too strong for me.

Auburn hazy colour, frotty white head. Aroma: strong, dried fruits and alcohol. Taste: first sweet dried fruits, then mild bitternes and intense alcohol flavour. Aftertaste is long and sweet. Sticky mouthfeel. Very nice, but a heavy beer.
Pours a slightly cloudy, orangish amber, with tan head. Aroma of sweet  malts. Taste of belgian sugars, and malt, with the high alcohol fairly subtle. This is a very nice Belgian Quad, thumbs up!

From a 330ml bottle on 23/12/2011. Pours a murky medium brown with a small head. Has a light aroma of fruit (apples), yeast and spices. The flavour is much bigger, with a huge fruity sweetness up front (including more apples and stonefruits), against a background of spices and a dash of pepper. There is some warming alcohol present, along with a mild bitterness. The body is quite full and the carbonation a little high at the beginning, but its quite an enjoyable sipper.

Draft at Monks. Pours a nice copper amber with little head. Beautiful aroma full of spice, dark dried fruits, and alcohol. Flavor leans on the dried fruits and alcohol, but is very balanced. Great example of the style.

Bottle @ Dans house. Violet copper appearance with an off white head. Strong caramelized, candy sugary, molasses, caramel, Belgian yeasty, somewhat fruity estery aroma. Rich toffee, caramel, candy sugar, belgian yeasty, fairly fruity, plum flavor thats somewhat cloying but thats tasty.

Bottle @ Home. Pours slightly hazy burnt orange with a offwhite head, nice lacings. Aroma of malt, yeast, plums, sugar, almonds, spices. Taste is malt, yeast, almond/marzipan, nuts, sweet fruit, sugar, peppery and light spices. Medium body, rather high carbonation, warming alcohol in the finish. 101211

750mL bottle.  Pours a clear light brown.  Aroma is strange; smells a bit like some sort of cleaning product; no doubt a contribution of the 10% ABV.  Taste is better; nice malt, fruit, and spice, though a little on the syrupy-sweet side.  A decent Quadrupel.
Pours a dark amber color.  Aroma is of malts, dark fruit, chocolate, resin, and more dark fruit.  Flavor is the same.  Nice dark fruit finish.  Much better than I was expecting.

A nice beer for a long cold evening. Aroma is fresh pineapple and hints of ginger . Taste is pretty complex, and ranges from roasted almonds, chocolate to tangerines. Aftertaste is not very present, very vague bitter. Mouthfeel is brilliant.
From bottle. Golden with big white head. Sweet aroma, sugar, yeast. Taste sweet, light fruit, yeast.

Pours copper with a massive head.
Nose shows bananas, doughy wheat, spicy phenols (cloves), along with golden syrup and candi sugar-like sweetness. Very similar to a weizenbock.
Similarly sweet flavours, lots more golden syrup, alcohol, doughy and spicy notes. Finishes with a slightly unpleasant metallic bitterness.
Body is incredibly thick and syrupy.

330ml bottle from Cracked Kettle
Pours dark brown with a medium foamy and sticky head. Aroma has notes of raisin, caramel malts, spices and syrup. Taste is quite malty with notes of raisin, fruits, spices and caramel. Full bodied and carbonated. Finish is fruity and warming. Okay quadrupel.

On tap at Biermarkt Toronto. Pours copper/amber with a creamy off-white head. Aroma of malt and yeast and some spices. Flavour is sweet with some noticeable alcohol and fruit. A great beer but only a decent Quad.
Bottle. Dark amber with white head. Nice spicy yeast nose. Taste is of sweet malt. Burnt sugar. Familiar Belgian yeast strain. Sticky mouthfeel. Alcohol well hidden. Leaves a nice warmth though.

About a year old, pours dark brown with dark tan head that diminishes quickly, aroma is of caramel,spices,bananas and some molasses and dark fruits.  Nice flavor with spices, some dark fruit and caramel, taste matches aroma quite well, not getting the bitterness others have talked about, most likely from being cellared, very good quad.
not much alcohol taste, brown, hazy, brown foam,medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lighter body than expected, average carbonation,

Very strong, very deep flavor... Great trappist beer. From the momment you taste it you can understand that it has been aged in oak barrels... A bit bitter taste too. Really great beer, and even greater if you try it in Winter...

Bottle 0.5 L.
Dark brown body with a small, light-brown head, mostly diminishing.
Malty aroma (caramel) with notes of dark fruits (prunes), raisins and spices.
Moderate sweet flavour; also a light bitter note appears in the long-lasting finish, when all the fruity hints surprisingly come up, not being overwhelmed by alcohol.
medium-to-full body with an oily texture; soft carbonation; moderate alcoholic warming in the finish.
Very enjoyable "meditation" beer!

Bottle looks simple but good. Beer in the glass copper coloured, small head. Starts strong, fine spicy, modest sweet. Hnts of alcohol. Finish well balanced, fine fruity with woody hints, still sweet. Interesting.

A nice dark amber "ale" colour. Fine head . Must, yeast and alcohol dominate the nose. Average carbonation.  Fairly fruity in the mouth with a definite bubble-gum finish. A very good  ful bodied ale but not the top of the quads!

pours amber with a tanned head. aroma of bananas, caramel, brown sugar, and alcohol. taste is sticky and sweet, with rum, burnt sugar and molasses. its highly carbonated, with masses of alcohol, and, this somewhat overpowers the flavours for me, but, it is complex and enjoyable (if a little bonkers).

Shared bottle with OleR at Tre Små Rum, Gøteborg. Pours murky brown with a small white head. Aroma of dark fruits, raisins. Taste is moderate sweet, but with a wonderful complex malty fruitiness, red ripe fruits, and dark malts. Very addictive. Sticky mouthfeel. Ends with a nice fruity kick at the bitter end.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2012 Draft. Pours deep brown with a large yellowish head... borderline brown tastes is sweet with a great flavor.  A lot of dark fruits on the tongue. Loved it and hope to rate a larger portion next time.

Dark pink, slightly murky, disappearing head.
Smells fruity, alcohol.
Flavour sweet fruits, sharp, with a lingering dry aftertaste.
Can taste the alcohol.
Palate well carbonated and medium, goes down well.
Nice but spoilt by the prominent alcohol.

Intl Great Beer Expo, 2011.  The aroma is fruit, candi sugar.  The appearance is a hazy red, creram colored head.  The flavor is like the aroma, maybe more grainy.  The finish is light hops, booze.  Medium/thick in body.  Very good.
Great citrus aroma. Heavy weight on the palate. Very smooth. Great selection for a cold winter day.

Clear medium dark amber nice whiteish head, great lacing... big malty aroma, a little hot, some belgian candy yeast aroma, relatively sweet... strong big dark fruity flavor, raisin, figs, hot, full bodied, fairly sweet.... decent, but lacks the complexity i bwould expect from a trappist brewery...

(Bottle 0,33l)
Strong sweet, fruity, light caramel and something else aroma. Hazy red-amber color. Huge, all time light brown head. Medium sweet, strong spicy, ligth fruity taste. Full body. Sticky and creamy texture. Soft alcohol warm finish.

Bottle.  Pours clear tawny with ruby highlights and a large, frothy light tan head, medium retention with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (caramel, cookie, bread, toast) with moderate Belgian yeast notes of dark fruits (dates, figs, plums) and spices.  Flavor is heavy malt and moderate yeast with mild alcohol notes, a sweet body and finish, though some drying is noticeable due to the alcohol.  Full body, medium-high warmth, medium carbonation.
brown, hazy, minimal head, tan foam, herbs, alcohol, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, long finish,
amber, orange, hazy, white foam, herbs, resin, full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, medium sweetness, medium bitterness,

Has a hazy amber color in the glass with a nice head. Aroma of roasted fruits and mild hoppiness. Taste is very smooth with some caramel and assorted fruits. It also has a sweetness to it, maybe a little vanilla. Smooth finish.

Pours a dark hazy brown amber with a small tan head.  Aroma is of Belgian yeast, fruits, banana, sweet malts and caramel.  Lots of Belgian yeast, malts, some fruity notes and brown sugar.  Strong alcohol presence.

Corked and caged bomber at home, poured into a trappist chalice. Cloudy, apple cider like appearance, medium head which fades very quickly. Aroma is apples, raisins, caramel, alcohol. Soft carbonation, full bodied. Very sweet and malty, alcoholic and winey, full of fresh and dried fruity flavors. The finish is very long, complex, and sweet, with a warming alcohol presence.

10 cl. sample from 33 cl. bottle. Clear, deep copper-brown colour with a medium, off-white head which disappears rather quickly.  Aroma gives off strong notes of caramel, toffee, almond, figs and raisins in a bit subtle  blend. Taste: Heavy sweetness. Clearly a lot of alcohol here, combined with nutty caramel flavors, notes of burnt sugar, raisins and figs. Very sweet finish, the alcohol carries the aftertaste for some time. Soft carbonation and long lasting mouthfeel. All in all La Trappe Quadrupel is a nice beer, but to sweet for my tastebuds and lacks in complexity compared to other Trappist beers.

33cl bottle. Poured into my favorite glass ;) . Dark but still transluscent with thick tan head. Nose : Coffee with scotch. Caramel. Vanilla and some tones of grapes. Dried fruits. Sip : Thick body. Sweet. Malaga icecream. Malty caramel. Balanced. One glass beer for me.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2011 Fantastica,el aroma va adueñandose del paladar,cuerpo redondo,aromas mixtos que encajan perfectamente dando un bouquet sensacional de sabores,la sensacion del alto grado de alchool es minima asi que se disfruta mas, en fin para mi es una de las mejores cervezas del mundo.
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: UPDATED: JUL 30, 2015 Tasted bottle at Ciceros in St Louis, Missouri, USA into tulip glass. Mine was labeled Koningshoeven Trappist Quadrupel with a classier label than the one pictured. Poured a deep, dark copper with some live yeast haze and thick, creamy, beige foam. Good head retention and Belgian lace. I was excited to sample the only Trappist brewery outside of Belgium (this one is in the Netherlands.) Aromas of rising bread dough, malt and fruit essences, some alcohol, no late hops. Powerful malty sweet flavors with hints of raisins, plums, black currants, molasses, burnt sugar, balanced bitterness. High alcohol by volume percentage which is warming and apparent, but not nearly as hot as youd expect. Smooth bottle fermentation. The sparkling carbonation, high attenuation, and hops contribute to a surprisingly dry finish. Some fruitiness lingers in the aftertaste. Truly delicious, among the very best beers.

330 ml bottle picked up in Brussels and taken back to Germany. Pours a dark amber color with a massive foamy off white head. Aroma is bubblegum, malt and sweet barley. Taste is alcohol and sweet malt. Palate is offensive and the beer is not so pleasant.

Bottle from Theatre of Wine, Greenwich. Dark orange pour with a white head. Sweet spice nose with hints of orchard fruit and treacle. Sweet-spicy- fruit explosion on the tongue. Big alcohol burn. Pleasant, warming finish.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2013 Fles 30 cl. 
Kleur: Amberkleurig .
Een beetje troebel. Stabiele lichtbruine schuimkraag die lang blijft bestaan.
Geur: Zoet en kruidig. 
Smaak: Zoet en licht bitter. Volle smaak 
Pittige en lange afdronk.

bottle in a pint glass - pours cloudy amber/orange with rich tan head and provides some lacing.  Nose is caramel malts and alcohol.  Aroma is yeast, caramel malts, alcohol and fruit (plums or candy).  Very sweet with a long finish.  Slightly hoppy finish, but faint/offset by alcohol.  Medium to full bodied.  Mild carbonation.  Aftertaste is coffee or roasted malts.  Not as yeasty as I would expect an Abt, but definitely as powerful body buzz-wise.

On tap at Beermarket in Toronto.  Pours dark amber with a lasting white head.  Aroma is of caramel, dark fruit and brown sugar.  Full, crisp body. Caramel, ripe fruit, alcohol, brown sugar create an amazing complexity on the palate.  Long, balanced finish.  An outstanding brew.
brown coloured body with yeast particels and a off white head a spicy yeasty malty fruity aroma a spicy malty fruity yeasty alcholic taste with a alcholic bitter finish

Draft at Blue Monk, Raisiny colored pour. Aroma of dried fruits, raisins, belgian yeast, light banana. Not as agressive as Abt 12 but a great harmony & balance of a wide array of flavors. Great mouthfeel. Hides the 10% in an awfully dangerous way. Very good
Bottle at WOB.  Light murky brown pour with a white head.  Sweet malt aromas.  A nice little quad with sweet caramel malt, banana, fruit esters, plum, raisin, and spice notes.
UPDATED: SEP 11, 2011 Cerveza de color rojizo oscuro, buen cuerpo, cremosa, leve gusto a banana, suave amargor. Buena cerveza.

Bottle.  Nice cloudy dark golden pour, lots of off white foam lacing the glass.  Candy sugar, light alcohol, fruits on the nose (light banana).  Candy and sweetness upfront, light alcohol on the end, some light rum flavors, dark fruits.  Slightly sticky, medium body, good carb.  Solid quad.

Tap.  Pours a deep amber with a small off white head.  This was suprisingly very sweet compared to the other quads I have had.  Lots of candy suger and medium fruits come through.  Achohol comes through, but a lot less then westy or rochert.  Nice, but doesnt compare to the other good quads.
Licht troebel amberkleurig bier. Smaak zoet met wat rozijnen. Erg vol en stevig bier waar je het alcoholpercentage duidelijk in proeft.

Pours a cloudy brownish orange with a medium pale head that leaves behind a nice lacing. Aroma is of apricots, caramel, figs and oak. Slightly creamy on the palate, sweet with a hint of sour - flavours of marmalade, turkish delight, sultanas, spices. A little lighter than many quadrupels but very tasty.

Reddish amber color. Off white creamy looking head. 
Tart aroma. Slightly floral. Mild malts. Cheesy. 
Sweet tart flavor. 
Hi-avg carbonation. Full bodied. Creamy. Alcoholic notes.

Pours cloudy chestnut with a pillowy tan head.  Sweet yeasty aroma, a bit of bread a bit of shortbread, a slight waft of cheese.  Quite sweet, a bit of sweaty sourness too.  Not bad; the alcohol pushes through strongly, leaving a burning long aftertaste as it warms the tounge and throat.  A bit insubstantial, the initial sweetness is too light and fleeting.
A full aroma, taste has hints of berry bringing sweetness - a little too much for my taste.  750ml bottle in Canmore

UPDATED: APR 27, 2017 Deep amber color, nice white to off-white head. Smell malts, sweetness, some carmale. taste malts, sweetness, lightly alcohol, lightly caramel. Medium to full body, medium carbonation. Nice balance. -- 1995 Bottle shared by Inoven. Dark red-brown to brown color, quickly diminishing head. Aroma is amazing, almost like a bourbon BA RIS, but the flavor has indeed gone downhill. Palate is nearly zero. But it shows it was a great beer.
Bottle in Affligem glass. Fruity banana aroma. Cloudy reddish appearance. Sweet and fruity taste. Abv is nicely hidden. Not as lively/spicy as the Westmalle. Still an excellent beer.
Bottle at Eulogy in Philadelphia.  This beer is excellent, rich taste, caramel and dark fruits.  Thanks to Dave the bartender for recommending this one.
Distinct malty trappist ale. hazelnut color with a nice frothy carmel malty head
UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 (Bottle 01/08-2011) Low light brown head, unclear amber color, rather sweet aroma and taste.

This is a fantastic quadrupel. The pour is a murky reddish brown with a slight orange tint. A thick beigey head with tons of lacing rings. The nose is malty with light bread and tons of raisin and estery yeast. Overall, the nose is of dark fruits and light malts. In the middle, a light raisin and sweet bready malt. The finish takes over with a predominant yeast flavor and tons of raisin and fruits. Overall, sweet and fruity and very drinkable for 10% ABV.

Malzfruchtiger, obstiger Geruch - angenehm. Antrunk intensiv fruchtobstig. Mittelteil malzschokoladig und immer noch fruchtiger Hintergrund. Ziemlich dichter (malzig, fruchtig) und zurückhaltend alkoholischer Abschluß. 
Gefällt voll und ganz.Test vom 29.11.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche
Very complex aroma of fruits like peach, plum, apple and alcohol sweetness. Taste is medium sweet with spicy notes. Not a light beer, very serious brew.
Tastes a bit like cough mixture, but a very nice taste for a strong trappist. 0,33 l of this is a bit much though...

Belga Sörök Háza, Budapest. Narancsos árnyalatú barna színe van, kevés piszkosfehér, gyorsan leülepedő habbal a tetején. Illata édes a cukortól, kevés karamelltől, gyümölcsöktől és az alkoholtól, de élesztőt is érezni. Telt ízétől azt kapjuk vissza, amit már az illatában is sejtettünk, igazi ízbomba, de talán túlságosan is ránehezedik a nyelvünkre, nehezen csúszik. Testes, kissé édeskés és jó alkoholos, nem éppen a hétköznapokra való főzet. Talán a quadrupel-ek között jobbakat is találni, de azért nem könnyű felvenni vele a versenyt, mert remek sör!

Date: July 30, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: Lucias, St. Paul, MN Appearance: Opaque muddy brown with nice amount of head. Aroma: Sweet and fruity. Flavor: Consistent with aroma, with a splash of alcohol, medium bodied. Other: A very well done beer.  This is one of my favorite styles and it did not disappoint.  Does not feel like you are drinking a beer at 10% alcohol.
33 cL bottle: Appearance is an amber brown with minimal off white head. Aroma is of spices malt yeast and candi sugar. Flavor is heavy in spices and a distinct apple like flavor, slightly sweet also.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2012 
33 cl bottle @ Home, BBE 09/2012. Rated on 27.04.2012
Sweet aroma with toffee typical to an aged belgian ale. Also some raisins, brown sugar and dark fruits. Flavour is sweetish with raisins, brown sugar, belgian toffee. Some berry and banana aromas with alcohol start to occur towards the end of the glass. Also a small savor of hay and metal.

Aging has made this lost some of its sweetness  but then again it hasnt given anything in exchange. Maybe the raisin notes are a bit stronger now. Palate was slightly foamy and a bit too high on CO2.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2014 Tones of prune and raisin, but not real complex. Back of the tongue tanginess. Biting carbonation, warm alcohol. Complexity is a little bit lacking, and the alcohol presence is a bit too much, but overall decent. I was less impressed on my second tasting of this beer. UPDATE: sampled a 3 year old bottle. Drier, less sweet. Very balanced, very refined, easy to drink. No alcohol bite. Cellars very well.
750 bottle. Poured light grayish brown. Aroma is of dark fruits and raisin notes. Flavour is similar. Very good.

Cloudy brown with a touch of orange and small tan head.  Aroma brown sugar and caramel.  Medium full body, minor alcohol and carbonation presence.  Flavor is mostly sweet brown sugar and molasses but fairly complex with some cherry and dried dark fruits and nice dry finish.  Excellent.

One of the most impressive beers to come from the Netherlands. Most notably is the heavy sweet caramel taste with just a touch of some (dark) fruits. It tastes lively and is far from heavy, especially judging its alcohol percentage. Pours nice and Amber with slight foam. Has a good and sweet aftertaste and is overall just great and unique.

Very good quad.  Pours a light brown color with a white foam head.  Aroma of caramel with hints of dark fruit, as well as dough from the yeast.  Has a sweet caramel taste with some notes of dark fruit.  The notes of dough round out the beer nicely.  It balances the nice carbonation and spice bite.  A tad more sweet that Roch 10 or Westy 12.  But I am really enjoying this brew.

33cl Bottle.  Appearance is dark brownish color, light beige head with okay lacing.  Aroma is caramel malts, fruits, and clove.  Taste is some dried fruits, banana, and spices including clove.  Palate is medium- to full-bodied, slight oily texture, soft carbonation, and a mild bitter finish.  A nice Quad but nothing to write home about.
Pours dark amber with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, molasses, clove and light fruit. Flavour is sweet caramel, molasses, alcohol, clove, pepper and cinnamon.
Brown with orange tones. Alot of head with a very very distinct smell of banana. Also you can smell some fruits (apples). Tastes of banana, typical belgian yast and some sirup.

Hazy deep orange, nearly brownish. Aroma of dark earthy malt, Belgian yeasty funk, and dark ripe fruit. Somewhat uncomplicated aroma, but a Quad nonetheless. Tate was impactful and big. Lots of dark fruit, earthy malt tones. Dry Belgian fruit and funk. Tastes like any other strong quad. Delicious, just not out of the ordinary.
Bottle, 750ml, aged 8 mths. Pours a lighter colour then your average quad. Smell is nice, the flavours are very good. Easy to drink and it was an enjoyable beverage
yeast and raisin aroma. lighter pour than expected. nice flavours; raisins, yeast, and other light fruits. pretty good, a nice sipper.

[Bottle] Pours a hazy dark amber color with about a half inch of dense head. Aroma of fruit esters, vanilla, banana, light alcohol and sweet rolls. The taste is of breads, light caramel, sweet figs, nutmeg, spices, lots of yeast esters and some alcohol. Lingering vanilla sweetness. Solid body and creamy mouthfeel. A tasty beer.

Bottle at mogwai bar. Pours orange-brown with a big beige foam. When pouring the beer it smells of foam bananas, just opening it was enough. We had a laugh about it but soon the aromas settled and the banana smell declined. Instead a complex aroma of candied sugar, pear, apples and dried fruits took place. The taste and flavour is packed with bananas and caramel, its rick and complex and actually quite hard to analyse. Its alcoholic and warming and very Belgian in its style. Long finish.

33 cL bottle into a Westmalle glass, from Beers of Europe.  Dark red/brown and a little fizzy with a large bubbly and creamy head.  Strong and rich, fruity, alcohol aroma.  Smooth and little fruity, with a deep but pleasant bitter taste following it.  Has a bit of a kick to it, the alcohol hits home its very abbey style.

Bottle from Bierzwerg. Poureddark amber color with a beige large head. Strong spicy, dark fruity aroma, raisin and caramel. Flavor is very complex, as I get more flavor with every sip. Caramel, raisins, spices and some yeasty notes. Finish is warming, not much alcohol. Very oily mouthfeel.

Finally poured my 2006 bottle of Koningshoeven Quadrupel in honor of my friends masters degree. Aroma of raisins, sweet chocolate, rum, candy sugar and oak. Appearance was quite unexpected, and awesome- after five years, this beauty had a full 3/4 inch head that did not go away for some time. The body was red/brown and unfiltered. Flavor was sweet and chocolate filled up front with a dark fruit/oak finish; the alcohol was pretty prevalent. Palate was very bubbly. An absolute pleasure, and, at 3.99, a jaw dropping value.
bottle 330 ml, pours amber golden with small white head, the aroma is very fruity, sweet malt, spices and a bit alcohol... the flavor is sweet malt, brew mass, alcohol..... the palate is sweet...

Bottle. Pours hazy amber with a creamy off white head. The aroma is sugar, yeast, caramel, fruit, raisins and prune. The flavour is quite sweet with notes of prune, raisins, ripe fruit, sugar and spicy yeast. Soft mouthfeel.

Pours a smooth and elegant garnet amber that is right in bewteen dark red bbrick and mahogany. Aromas burst with warm fruit cake, dark sticky caramel, Plums, prunes, raisins, dark cocoa, and mellow spice. The palate is wickedly smooth with a gentle carbonations that pushes forward dark fruity malts, molasses, creme brulee, and a wave of delicious toffee... MMmm wow

Banana!
Questa la mia prima reazione dopo i primi due sorsi.
Qualcuno per alcune birre usa la definizione "Luniverso in un bicchiere", ecco qua secondo me ci siamo proprio vicini.
Bella corposa, alcolica e intensa, profumata, molto fruttata e con note di malto evidenti.
Da bere in momenti speciali.

Served in Chimay goblet at James McNellies OKC. Pours clear brown with small off-white head. Aromas of dark fruits, caramel, toffee, and bready malts. Flavors of dark fruits, bread, toffee, caramel, and some booze. Kind of a syrupy mouthfeel. Not bad.
UPDATED: MAR 22, 2012 010811: Amber brown with a super beigh head. Fine aroma. Sweet flavor of caramel and malt..

330 ml bottle from The Bottle, York.
Appearance Amber-copper, lightly cloudy with thick white froth which diminishes.
Aroma Fruity sweet malt, pear, spices, bit of alcohol, some yeast.
Taste Fruit malt, sweet, some sweet pear, muted cake spices, hint of almond, very slight medicinal, alcohol noticeable, better than the aroma.
Palate Good smooth mouthfeel, sweet gentle warming finish leaving slight lingering sweet fruit and spice. 
Overall A good quad,  but lighter and rather less complex and rich than others ive tried.

Sweet aroma of dried raisins and burn caramel. The palate is generous and rich with cream-like texture. The attack is sweet with hint of spice and the bitter finish persistent with a cough syrup-like quality that leaves a sugary coat mouth feels.

1995 bottle from Kulminator. Ruby caramel/brown color. Small tan head. Little lacing and plenty clear. It should be after that much time in the cellar. Smells of caramel, raisins, and malt. Tastes the same with a very sweet earthy flavor. Warming, sweet aftertaste. Slight alcohol. Very nice for such an old beer.
Not the best quadrupel ive had. I didnt like the smell at all, though im pretty sure the beer was fresh. The mouthfeel of this one scored a perfect 5.
A little head, dark golden. nose with banana, light card board, pear, fullbodied and nice length with a light dry finish, sweet with banana, pear, sugar. very sweet.

On tap, pours hazy/murky brown with off white, thin head.  Aroma included some raisins and figs, other dark fruit, some toffee, molasses, spice notes.  Taste had the dark fruit, molasses notes but included some ripe fruit notes like pear/pineapple, nice dry finish, slight alcohol warmth.  Good stuff!

Malziger, deutlich alkoholischer Antrunk. Eine dumpfe Hefigkeit ist ebenfalls zu erkennen, wird aber durch die drückende Malzigkeit übertönt. Es wird etwas klebrig, neben dem Malz und der vergorenen Fruchtigkeit ist hier eine leichte Herbe zu erkennen. Dass das Bier stattliche 10% hat ist nicht zu erkennen. In dieser Alkoholklasse einzigartig! 	 
Test vom 12.5.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 10,12,12,13,12,12 - 11,95

Bouteille de 33 cl. Couleur ambrée-rousse, très belle mousse crêmeuse de belle tenue. Une palette aromatique très riche avec du miel, du caramel, du nougat, de la réglisse, des fruits mûrs et...  un alcool, tout de même bien présent (10%). Une bière assez sucrée donc, avec beaucoup de corps et de personnalité. Trouvée à Vanuxeem - Ploegstaert.
Fruity aromas with some caramel. Dark brown colour  with medium head. Strong sugary taste and high alcoholic content. Sweet finish. Heavy bodied

It has a dark amber colour and a very thick, dense head.
It has a bit of apples,pineapples and banana in the aroma, a suggestion of sugar or caramel in the palate and malty sweetness in the finish. I dont feel the 10% ABV. The brewmaster was very tricky.

Bottle 30cl. Pours nicely with a rather big light beige head. Dry fruit in the nose is my first impression followed by a slight metallic smell (this dissappear however after some time in the glass). Very rich and warm taste with some fruit flavour. Nice finish.

Bottle at home. Pours clear dark red. Candy sweet, ripe bananas and canned pears aroma with some marzipan/allmond paste. A bit spicy. Sweet, canned pears flavour with total lack of heavy quadrupel features. Some liquer feeling. Allmond. Medium, spicy body.

Bottle. Brownish orange with a fluffy, bubbly slightly tan head. Rich toffee, candied brown sugar, citrus, and dark fruits in the aroma.  Pruny, some orange flavors, touch of yeastiness and slightly bittersweet.  Medium body with vibrant carbonation.

Cerveja TOP. Sabor complexo. Coloração escura,acobreada, espuma de boa formação ambar. cheiro frutado e de pães. Boa drincabilidade, apesar de ser densa. Frutas e doces no sabor. Retrogosto um pouco amargo. Boa.
Dark amber, good head.  Thick with aroma and flavor of Belgian spices with a slight sting of alcohol.  Best to drink it cold if having it in the summer!

Appearance: cloudy woods and brush and twigs. Puffy off-white head, thick, lingers as a thicker collar with few bubbles amidst a solid blanket. Swirls thicker and richer.

Nose: quintessential Belgian quad. Nutmeg and cinnamon sticks. Brewers yeast and bread crust. Raisins, dates, figs all mingle together amidst dense breads. Candied sugars, raw pure sugarcane. Hint rooty and vegetal. Red apples. Maraschino cherries. Tickle of spice and heat in the back.

Palate: rich and yummy. Raisins, figs, and prunes. Cinnamon sticks and spice in the back of each swallow. Mouthfeel is cakey and bready. Orange candies and candied oranges. Lingering sweetness where candied pineapples join the oranges. Apple orchards border each quaff. Apple pie, apple strudel  stewed and saucy with cinnamon. Chewy prunes and dates.

Final Thoughts: a divine take on the quadruple style of Belgium. Is it a style? Some argue no, some argue yes. The fact that Belgian brewers still designate some of their darkly rich decadent brews as quadruple is enough for me. Sometimes whats in a name is just a name, but as for whats in the bottle

Pours copper amber with a nice tan head. Smells of raisins, dates, bananas, and belgian spices. Dates, raisins, bananas, belgian candied sugars and some underlying cherry notes. Mouthfeel is medium and the finish is sweet dark dried fruit.
In bottiglia allOConnor, un assaggio dal bicchiere di Simo, la peggiore delle quadrupel trappiste.

330 ml bottle thanks to weihenweizen, pours dark amber/light brown with a decent white head and some lacing in the trappist glass, aroma is full of dark fruit, fig and a hint of booze, the flavor is very sweet with tons of dark fruit and spices, the 10% is well hidden, very enjoyable.
decisamente ottima.nonostante sia una quadrupel é molto equilibrata,persistente.Gradevoli profumi floreali e fruttati che si ripetono in bocca.
As expected it has a slight alcohol kick to it.  The flavor is complex and fruity as well as being malty.  Very good ale.

33cl bottle
Dark copper color with a large head at first but some clouds in the end. Aroma has some slight alcohol notes, dried fruit, caramel, liquorice. Flavor is sweet, dried fruit, slight hoppy finish, slight alcohol touch. Sticky palate

Pours medium to dark brown, approaching Cola, with a nice, lingering light brown head.  Aroma is bubblegum- nifty.  Flavor is some bubble gum, overripe banana, brown sugar.  Body is a bit thicker than other trappist quads, and a little less dry.  tasty.

Poured from the bottle, into my Chimay Trappist glass. Pours a nice copper with hints of red, nice thick head, and good lacing. Aroma is first noted as fruity, then broken down to dried and dark fruits, raisins, prunes, etc. Flavour is mildly bitter, but much more malty. Mouth feel is medium full bodied, with a perfect amount of carbonation. Overall this is to date the best Trappist Ale Ive had, I will definitely seek out more quads, glad this was my first!

This beer poured beautiful into a wide tulip glass. The medium body was dark caramel with a thick white head, which fell into tight lacing. The scent was amazingly complex and floral. Scents of pears, pllums, fig and yeast come to the nose with a slight alcohol and ginger spice. As for the taste, it was nothing short of what I had expected from the scent. This beer was very sweet, again with yeast, nice dark fruits, some honey and the mellow taste of almost cantelope. The warmth of alcohol had a light cinnamon sugar undertone, and left the mouth feeling moist and tangy. This beer was nothing short of fantastic, and one of the best quads Ive ever had the pleasure of sharing!

Wow! Bottle share in a tulip. I had high hopes for this one and it didnt disappoint. Nose was pure dark fruits like plum, raisin, and even some cherry/strawberry. The pour was immaculate. Nice, dark, mahogany color with light brown head and nice lacing. Taste was perfect to me. Nice and sweet, like candy (but not overly sweet) with solid fruit. Like a fruit melange in the mouth. So many dark fruits and exotics. GREAT beer. Get one...now!
Pours hazy brown with a medium head. Full aroma is malts, yeast and alcohol. Flavor is malts, yeast and some alcohol. Pretty nice.

At monastery De Koningshoeven. Netherlands. Poured clear dark amber in colour with tan head. Aroma of malts and dark fruits. Leaves a nice lacing on the glass. Dark fruits in flavour with some spices. Some dry yeast in aftertaste.

(750ml bottle).  Pours slightly hazy mahogany with a light tan head and very active carbonation.  Aroma has great ripe pit fruit (plum), candied sugar and dried fruit (apricot?).  Taste is sweet but not cloying.  Very light hops on the end.  Medium bodied with a slick/sticky texture.  A bit fizzy and a smooth finish.  This is La Trappes best commonly available beer and a world class quad. The alcohol is expertly hidden, which makes this a dangerous beer.

This beer is pleaseantly tasting for a strong 10% special beer. Its has a bitter finish, and a full bodied beer.  The 10% will catch up with you, heavy taste.  One was enough for me this sitting, but I would seek this beer again.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. One of your favs. Pours a deep amber with a fairly large, fluffy beige head. Aroma is full of dark fruits and alcohol - plums, currants, fig, raisin. All this comes through in the taste with some sweetness in the background. Great beer

La Trappe Quadrupel is a sweet beer. Because of the alcohol percentage it tastes really sweet with fruity hints. The colour is amberlike en when served in the original La Trappe glass it looks great. Small foam head finishes the presentation. This beer needs to be enjoyed slow.
Bottle.Pours brownish amber with an off-white head.Aroma of spice, yeast, caramel, alcohol and nuts.Flavor is sweet and malty with some warmth and spices.Medium body, lively carbonation.Nice quad.

330 cl bottle at Brasserie Beck in DC. Pours amber with a medium beige head. Dark fruits make their presence felt in the aroma (plums, raisin, orange cherry). The yeast, spices and a well balanced sweetness allows to hide the alcohol, witch is barely noticeable. Would drink this again and again...

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2012 Bottle.
This beer is dark brown with a moderate amount of beige head.  Aroma is lots of alcohol with some dark fruit.  I would have thought this was more like 12 or 13% from the smell.  More dark fruit in the flavor and, just as I thought it would be, extremely alcoholic.

330 ml bottle from The Royale. Pours a cloudy brownish-plum color with a big, slow-descending, foamy off-white head. Aroma of overripe pit fruit, candi sugar, Belgian yeast, caramel malts, and a musty, leafy funk. Flavor of sweet caramel malts, Belgian yeast, candi sugar, berries, raisins, plums, and figs. Really sweet, malty, and fruity. Medium-bodied, with soft, medium carbonation and a fruity, coating mouthfeel. Excellent, complex beer.

Bottle from Bier Planet, Brussels. This has been sitting in my closet for nearly a year, as I was under the impression that Id already rated it. Oh well. The Easter holiday has sunk in, and I feel the need for a special treat. :-) This heavyweight Koningshoeven beer pours a clear, deep coppery brown body with a medium, off-white head which disappears rather quickly. This must be the first clear-bodied quad Ive had; the others tend to be pretty murky. Nose gives off strong tones of caramel, toffee, figs and raisins in a nice and delicate blend, though a bit subtle. Alcohol may not be present in the nose, but is quite evident in the taste; entwining itself among nutty caramel flavors, hints of burnt sugar, raisins and figs. Very sweet, and kind of straightforward, although the alcohol carries the rather balanced aftertaste on for quite some time. Soft carbonation, and very smooth mouthfeel. This is a pretty good quad, and apparently the origin of the term for the genre. All in all La Trappe Quadrupel is a nice beer, although a bit too sweet and lacking in complexity compared to its Trappist brethren.

11.2oz bottle in a Trappist glass.  Pours opaque ruby/brown with a cream-colored, lacy head.  Aroma of dark fruits, caramel malts, spicy yeast, and some light hops.  A little alcohol in the finish of this beer.  Silky texture.  Not as good as some other quads, but still a really good beer.

On tap at Ebenezers the night after Night of the Funk - November 6, 2010. Served in a chalice.

The pour brings a nice moderate brown color with a bit of a crimson-garnet hue. Really nice off-white head with a good dosing of lace on the edges of the glass. The nose brings forward some nice dark fruit characteristics with dates and figs plus some light caramel. A bit of malt and plum plus some light brown sugar notes and a bit of alcohol.

The flavor is nice with a bit of malt sweetness and light booze. The yeast does a nice job creating some esters alongside caramel plus plums, dates, and other dark fruits. A really nice body with a bit of booze. Helps bring out the complexities of the brew. Drinks quite well and was the last Trappist brewery that I needed to try to finish off the list.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 11-14-2010

Refrigerated bottle served in a La Trappe glass.  Pours a dark orange with reddish ues and off-white head.  High carbonation, lacing, and medium body.  Taste is fruit, candy sugar, and a hint of bitterness in the finish.

0.33l bottle. Pours a cloudy deep amber body with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is dark dried fruits, candy, strawberries, hints of alcohol and cola. Slightly sticky and full-bodied with lively carbonation. Fruity and quite complex flavors: strawberries, alcohol, raisin, some chocolate, spices, slightly woody and purple. Homer says purple is a fruit so I choose to believe him. This tastes purple, and purple is quite good. Ends in a warming and sweet lasting alcohol finish that tingles your throat. Really nice stuff this.

Pours a dark cloudy coppery brown with a light brown head with great lacing. Aroma is sweet malt with fruits and spice. Taste is very sweet with noticeable alcohol. Flavour of fruit and spice and hints of woodiness. Delightful beer particularly on a cold night.

Aroma: caramel or fruity sweetness
Appearance: amber brown
Taste: toasted and caramel malt
Palate: Sweet, light bitterness

Pours amber/brown with a light brown head. Aroma is lots of dark fruit, raisins, dates, cherry. Light sweetness up front with more fruit on the palate, belgian yeast, caramel. Very smooth, complex, and flavorful. Alcohol is well masked.

Bottle. Reddish copper with a tan head. Aroma: chewing gum, malt, raisins, some port. Taste: raisins, dried fruit, chewing gum, warming alcohol, grass, sweet malt. Full bodied, moussy. Nice, but not great. Actually kind of a disappointment, but that has more to do with my expectations.

At a tasting at "The 1st beer festival at The Anchor Pub", on-tap, pours amber with a small off-white head that remained in the drinking, fruity, alcoholic and very sweet aroma, noticeable taste of alcohol, nice lacing, easily flowing, sweet and alcoholic aftertaste, medium body, and overall a pretty good  beer despite the slightly disappointing taste.
This is an amazing beer. Very sweet malty aromas of molasses, maybe plum. Alcohol strength not really that noticeable.

750 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a slightly cloudy amber-brown with good-sized tan head.  Aroma is sweet raisins, booze, yeast and spice.  Taste is almost candyish sweet with modest spiciness and yeast.  Not as boozy as the aroma suggests but with some alcohol warmth in the finish.  Fine, soft carbonation.  Quite good.

On tap at the Trion Tavern in New Haven, Indiana.   Pours a deep copper color with reddish hues.  The light beige head gently laces the glass.  Spicy Belgian yeast and cotton candy aromas with a slight hint of alcohol.  Belgian yeast, spicy fruit, and sweet candy sugar flavors.

Hazy dark amber, dense beige head, silky medium body, high carbonation.

Aroma: belgian yeast, new england cider, spicy alcohol, caramel or candy sweetness.

Taste: toasted and caramel malt, complex alcohol, balancing bitterness, and some bright fruitiness.

More caramel and less dry than a tripel. Like a better version of a dubbel.

This beer is quite epic.  Pours a hazy, semi creamy brown with a nice, thin, tan head.  Aroma is incredibly complex... sweet malts, plums, raisins, brown sugar, caramel... I cant even begin to pick out everything.  Taste is pretty much the same as the aroma.  Flavors range from mild caramel malts, to heavy, ripe dark fruits and everything in between.  Finish is long, complex, and very warm.  This beer is quite amazing... almost Rochefort 10 amazing... but not quite!  Still... one of the best beers on earth.

Pours a reddish brown with tan head.  Aroma has a malt base with banana, spice, some yeast, and candied sugar.  Taste is malty with raisin, plum, clove, and bubblegum.  Alcohol is apparent on the back end. Syrupy with a creamy texture.  A lot of carbonation.  This is very tasty and dangerously drinkable.  Ill add this as one of my favorites.

The beer pours a surprising medium color color, I was expecting a much darker color. It had a huge tan head that lasted awhile with excellent lacing. 

It smells vauely similar to Rochefort but has a very distinct sweet smell to it, sweet chocolate maybe.

The taste is very smooth throughout, but not particularly complex. It tastes a combination of chocolate and hops. 

This is fairly simple quad and cant compete with big boy quads, but it is surprinsgly drinkable.
Reddish, brown appearance. Thick off-white head. Big sweet malt, dark fruit flavor. Good amount of carbonation. Only barely is the alcohol noticeable. Very good beer.

Poured into an ale glass. Appearance is a brown with a creamy beige head. Aroma of dark fruits, raisins,  prunes, and a slight touch of alcohol. Taste is one thats a bit difficult to capture. Like prunes dipped in a brandy. Fairly smooth for such a high abv. Creamy texture. This one is pretty good but I think it needs a little time to cool off.

Pours brownish, cloudy with about a inch of head. Aroma is sweet malt, banana/peaches, it is on the fruity side. Taste is excellent, sweet malt with roasted hints and with slight bitterness lurking underneath. Also flavor of bananas, sugar and yeast. Finish is medium flavor of malt and sugar. Carbonation is high enough to bite a bit that lasts into the finish. Full bodied, rough on the palate but still nice. Overall a very decent beer, but heavy on the stomach.

Bottle picked up at StateLine... Different label but i think this is the right beer. Pours a nice red light orange color. Big creamy head that slowly faded away. Leaves a nice lacing on the glass. Great nose brown sugar, dark fruits, raison, figs, apple... Taste is super smooth, creamy. Great taste. Apples, malty, fruity, raisons, some sugar (but not sweet). Overall great beer: In memory of my friend chiefers! 98-11

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2014 (15/03/2011) 2010 Jan. Vintage [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, early Feb. 2011: lovely dark red colour which is really unusual (bit less ruby than their dubbel) & nice to see with a white head that quickly diminishes, surprisingly light body for a quad, which makes it really drinkable, sugar, raisins, yeast, caramel, plums, hint bananas, touch alcohol, nice, maybe not on par with the other quads but worthwhile for being very different /////////////// ////////////// Many bottles later over the years, nothing proper to note, my opinion remains the same. Solid but not top.

Bottle from Nelson Wines. It pours cloudy dark amber with a thin beige head. The nose is caramel, dates, pear drops, sherbet and wood varnish. The taste is caramel, prune, date, fig, raisin, banana bread, brown sugar, milk and dark chocolate, some astringency and wood, with alcohol warmth towards the finish. Its medium bodied, complex and well balanced. One of my favourite trappist beers.
Nose of cotton candy and clove. Pours with a huge head but rapidly dissipates. Very drinkable with a Clove finish. Amazing how 10% can Taste so light and nimble.
Big white fully lasting head. Browny colour. Malty heavy hoppy aroma.  Good strong sweet/bitter flavor, with many intense notes. Really good belgish beer.

On tap for growler fills at Half Time.  Pours a lightly hazy caramel brown with a large beige head.  Big fruit, chewy malt, sweet bananas.  Big and sweet, jam and sweet toast and fruit compote.  Malty, very smooth.  Long lingering finish with some light booze, but overall, its well hidden.

330ml bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy, very dark brown with a large head.  Aroma is banana, burnt malt and sugars.  Sweet start.  Sweet candy sugars and yeasty finish.  Sticky.  Could be fuller for the strength.  Hides the booze.
Significantly awesome beer from the Netherlands. I knew you guys could do it!
Color is a mix between orange and lemon colors.  Has some honey and clove aromas.  Taste is of fruit and clove.  mmmmm

Sweet malty goodness with strong esters waft off the orangey/tan body with a slight reddish tinge and a white head.  Caramel sweetness and vanilla are balanced by a strong alcohol bite and mild bitterness.  Creamy and effervescent, this is an easy drinking Quadrupel.
my least favorite out of the trappist quads, the flavors are too sweet and hops are lacking, the sweetness even overpowers the fruitiness from the belgian yeasts, pass on this one

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2013 On tap at the Brick Store. Pours a dark brown with copper notes, a medium, beige, velvety head, and nearly unbroken lacing. The aroma is walnuts, dates, toffee, lemon peels, and cloves. The flavor is very sweet, a little bitter, and very blended and mellow. The palate is smooth and creamy, with just a little acidic feel and fine carbonation. Overall, this is a simply excellent beer.

Lasipullo minulla. Olut kaatuu lasiin ja on rusinaisen ruskea. Vaalea vaahto muistuttaa kananmunankuoren väriä. Oluen tuoksu on mausteinen, hedelmäinen, alkomainen ja hiivainen. Uuh.... maku on lempeän makea, hedelmäinen ja mausteinen. Lämmittää mukavasti ja on kuitenkin pehmeä. Hieman kirpeä.

Bottle.

Hazy amber with a small white head. Quite sweet aroma of malt, fruit, dark fruits, caramel and some alcohol. The same in the rather pleasant taste. "Easy" to drink despite the alcohol.
La Trappe tasting. Semi clear redish body, light brown head. Sharp alcohol, chocolate, malt, raisins, fruits and wine like aroma. Alcohol and figs in taste.

11.2 oz Koeningshoven bottle with some designs in the glass. Authentic Trappist ale. I cant make out the best before/bottling date.

It gushes as I uncap it, not a furious gush but enough to quickly overflow, I quickly poured it into my Duvel tulip. The head rises to the top slightly off white, not as brown as what I have seen in other Quads, it is more yellowish. The head recedes quickly leaving lacing all around. The color of the beer is hazy reddish brick/brown. The look is pretty seductive.

The smell is both sweet and spicy, with a little medicinal quality. A hint of alcohol. The spiciness on the nose is very pleasant.

The flavor hits you hard with this one. The carbonation just prickles your tongue. This one does not hide the alchol, the main flavor is sweet sugary alcohol. The middle flavor is fruity and is amazing, but the unhidden alcohol and bitter cloying sweetness in the aftertaste bring the taste down a little.

Overall a solid beer, and a gumtingler, but Id go after a few other quads before this one.

Draft in a trappist at sharp edge.  No head, the guy just sat the glass down and opened the tap to let that beautiful dark golden liquid flow.  Yum.  Nice and thick and heady.  Like a brown sugar bread.  Give me this instead of bread anyday.

Dark cider/brown color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of malt, yeast, some dark fruit, & caramel; Flavor of slight sweet malt, yeast, dark fruit (notably plums & cherries), caramel, raisons, spice, and some toffee; Slight alcohol at the finish; Nicely balanced and complex; A solid quad overall.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2012 Dark red with a white head. Aroma is a fruit feast . Alcoholic yet smooth body. Sweet and fruity flavour. (8/5/8/5/17)
Red body with a creamy off white head. Excellent fruity aroma with caramel, pear, red apple, orange, candy and spices. Full, alcoholic body with ideal carbonation. Sweet, fruity flavour with caramel, black sugar, orange, apple, apricot, peach and plum. Great.
Pours a very nice red-- looks like a picture in the glass.  Taste follows up the looks perfectly.  Great.
Hazy dark amber with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, heavy malty, caramel, dried fruit, spicy and yeasty. Flavor is heavy sweet and bitter. Warming alcoholic finish. Soft and smooth. Complex. 310111

Pours beautiful clear ruby amber with a huge creamy longlasting off white head leaving nice lacing. Aroma is dark fruits, raisins, malts, bread, sweet and very fresh. Fantastic fullbodied lean mouthfeel. Great flavor of sweet fruits, malts, hops and caramel; just great. Fullbodied palate just like the flavor. Finishes first sweet fruity then turning into a lean tart hoppy longlived pleasant aftertaste. A really enjoyable beer.

Aroma is raisin, plum, caramel, banana, alcohol. Appearance is medium dark brown with small head. Taste is raisin, caramel, brown sugar, followed by a pleasant lingering banana. Alcohol is present but not in a burning or negative way. Palate is full. A very sweet beer with complex flavors that lay on the tongue. Overall a nice beer. Nicely complex but probably wont buy again.

Draught at The Wharf, Aalborg. Pours dark hazy copper with a decent off-white head. Aroma is plums, raisins, banana, basement aromas, alcohol. Taste is light sweet and bitter. Medium to full body, oily, average carbonation.

750 mL cork finished bottle. Pours hazy, chestnut brown with lasting tan head. Lighter than expected for a quad. The nose is very complex, with ripe banana, sweet cherry and biscuity, sugary malt. The flavor is heavy candi-sugar, raisins, and spice from the belgian yeast. The alcohol is very present and warming, but surprisingly was not in the nose (maybe my pour was too cold). Creamy and smooth with medium mouthfeel. A nice, dry finish. Far to drinkable for 10% abv! - typical belgian craftsmanship.

750ml bottle sample purchased at the LCBO. Pours a dark orange/ brown, with a initially large pillowy head that quickly recedes to a very small ring. Nice lacing. Aroma is of dark fruits, bread and other spice. Taste is of fruit, bread and alcohol. Quite delicious.

Bottled from Koruna Pralines shop in Bratislava. Dark brown color with thick white head. Aroma, dried red fruit liquor, banana. Taste, raisins, orange, hints of green apple with banana in finish. Alcohol is nicely present. The best beer of La Trappe beers. Excellent beer.

Draught @ The Wharf, Aalborg, Denmark
Pours dark reddish brown with a off-white head. Aroma is fruity with notes of plums, raisin, dark fruits, malt, yeast and alcohol. Taste is medium sweet. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Dark pour.  Very little head.  Raisin spice and hops in the scent.  Complex mouth.  A touch boozy.  Low carbonation.  Spicy, coriander, cinnamon.  Hard to judge the mix of tastes.  Overall pleasant.  Actually find it slightly too boozy which is odd for me.

0.75l bottle from the LCBO. Appearance: Pours a murky opaque brown, some head that dissipates quickly. Aroma smells strongly of caramel, banana, cinnamon, and a nice hint of pine. Palate is smooth, not much carbonation. Taste is strongly of caramel and bananas, slightly bitter, quite sweet. Damn good beer.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2011 Dark brown beer with medium and beige head. Aroma is full and there are lots of dark fruits, raisins, bananas and also some overcooked bananas. Almost full bodied and smooth to drink. Taste is also full of dark fruits, some roastiness, peppers, alcohol without flavour but it can be feld in a good way. Enjoyable and rich fruitkissel, the best of La Trappe.

Felhős, rezes sötétbarna színben mutatja magát, tetején keletkező közepes méretű, bézs habja viszonylag hamar összeesik, vékony fátyolt hagyván maga után.
Édes illata bódítóan likőrös és aszalt gyümölcsös.
Nyelvet csípő ill. zsibbasztó, sima és szirupos testességgel indul, igen édes aromája karamellás, mazsolás és alkoholos (amely megfelelően el van rejtve), íze aszalt gyümölcsöket idéző.
Melengető, alkoholos befejezéséhez egy adag fűszer is párosul, amely után enyhén kiszárad a torok és egy édes-kissé fűszeres utóíz marad meg a szájban.
Nekem picit egyoldalú volt, mivel pl. a komlót szinte egyáltalán nem éreztem ki belőle, de ha az ember egy ilyen stílusú itókába vágja bele a fejszéjét, eddigi tapasztalataim szerint, ne is nagyon számítson az előbbire, úgyhogy a fajtájához mérten értékeltem a főzetet.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2011 Bel colore ambrato con buon cappello di schiuma. Aroma buono, inebriante tra caramello e frutta. In bocca la potenza alcolica si fa notare, ma ben equilibrata, avvolgente e lungo finale. Bel bere.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2012 A clear, red body with small head. Caramel, nuts, leather, leaves. Delightful rich sweetness in taste. Strong alcohol backup. Not quite as long lasting flavour as expected. Very warming beer, not too sweet for me, just nice and sticky. (Rating re-indexed)

Very nice trappist beer. Malt flavour with ambered cloudy body, presenting feeling of old on smelling. I also had the sensation of feeling nuts in the finish. Very pleasant, and appreciable on winter.

Maravillosa, seguramente la mejor de todas La Trappe.
Fuerte con cuerpo y muy sabrosa, no se le puede pedir mas a una cerveza.

Tamest beer Ive tried in this style.  Nose is slightly sour with a citrus note - I gave it a 6 because it just isnt particularly pleasant compared to all the other trappist styles Ive sniffed.  Has a moderately thick head that sticks around for a while.  Alcohol is non-existent in the taste..very surprising with the 10% it says on the bottle.  Agree with other reviewers that caramel, a faint trace of bubble gum, and maybe some vanilla are there.  Its very reserved for a quad and is more like a beer champagne.  I like it quite a bit.
Cloudy amber body and tan head. malty and caramel and some nuts aroma with yeast with some wooden notes in the background. Malty and fruity flavor. Alcohol and medium body. A good beer.

Pours a cloudy orange with a small head. Smells like burnt sugar with a yeastiness. Some fruity sweetness that quickly subsides leaving a not too heavy flavour on the tongue. Very delicate for such a massively strong brew. A doff of the cowl to the monks who make this one!
Dasrk fruity flavor soem what caramel was really good for this time of the year smooth finish somewhat bitter
